Permit Name: Acceptance for Filing of Offering Plan
Permit Description: Acceptances for filing of offering plans for the sale of cooperatives, condominiums, homeowners association memberships, time shares and real estate syndications.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Acceptance for Filing of Offering Plan - Amendments (RS-2/CD-2)
Permit Description: Acceptances for filing of amendments to the offering plans for the sale of cooperatives, condominiums, homeowners association memberships, time shares and real estate syndications. These are generally required annually, or when the circumstances of the offer change materially.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Accident and Health License - Domestic (UCAA-Primary, Form 1P, Form 2P, Form 3)
Permit Description: Allows an Article 42 insurer to conduct an accident and health insurance business in New York State. "Accident and health insurance," means (i) insurance against death or personal injury by accident or by any specified kind or kinds of accident and insurance against sickness, ailment or bodily injury, including insurance providing disability benefits pursuant to article nine of the workers' compensation law, except as specified in item (ii) hereof; and (ii) non-cancellable disability insurance, meaning insurance against disability resulting from sickness, ailment or bodily injury (but excluding insurance solely against accidental injury) under any contract which does not give the insurer the option to cancel or otherwise terminate the contract at or after one year from its effective date or renewal date.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Accident and Health License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion, Form 1E, Form 2E, Form3)
Permit Description: Permits a foreign accident and health insurer (out of state) to write business in New York. "Accident and health insurance," means (i) insurance against death or personal injury by accident or by any specified kind or kinds of accident and insurance against sickness, ailment or bodily injury, including insurance providing disability benefits pursuant to article nine of the workers' compensation law, except as specified in item (ii) hereof; and (ii) non-cancellable disability insurance, meaning insurance against disability resulting from sickness, ailment or bodily injury (but excluding insurance solely against accidental injury) under any contract which does not give the insurer the option to cancel or otherwise terminate the contract at or after one year from its effective date or renewal date.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Authorizes a retail on-premises licensee to install an additional bar.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Adirondack Park Variance from Shoreline Restrictions Application
Permit Description: Grants a variance to minimum shoreline lot width or building setback requirements with questions of "practical difficulties." This permit insures protections of the quality of Adirondack waters and visual character of Adirondack shorelines. Only new regional subdivision, land use and development requires an Adirondack Park Agency permit. Statutory exemptions depend on project type, scale, and location.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Adult Care Facility - Adult Home Certificate to Operate (CON, DOH 155)
Permit Description: An adult home (AH) care facility is established and operated for the purposes of providing long-term residential care, room, board, housekeeping, personal care and supervision to five or more adults unrelated to the operator. Adult homes may be operated by a natural person, a partnership, a not-for-profit corporation, a public corporation, a non-publicly traded business corporation or a limited liability company. The operator of an adult care facility may also offer to nonresidents of the facility services such as social day care program, temporary residential care, or other services the facility is authorized to provide to enable such persons to remain in or return to the community. Adult care facilities are not licensed to provide any nursing or medical care.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Adult Care Facility - Assisted Living Program Certificate to Operate, (CON, DOH 155)
Permit Description: An assisted living program (ALP) is a program available in some adult homes and enriched housing programs that combines residential and home care services. It is designed as an alternative to nursing home placement for individuals who historically have been admitted to nursing facilities for reasons that are primarily social, rather than medical in nature. The operator of the assisted living program is responsible for providing or arranging for resident services that must include room, board, housekeeping, supervision, personal care, case management and home health services. Adult care facilities are not licensed to provide any nursing or medical care.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Title V Facility Air Permit Application
Permit Description: Owners and/or operators of major air contamination sources are required to obtain a permit from the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation for the operation of such sources. Types of activities range from stationary combustion sources, to incinerators, to industrial process, exhaust, or ventilation systems. Exempt activities are in 6 NYCRR, Part 201-3.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Adult Care Facility - Enriched Housing Program Certificate to Operate (DOH 155)
Permit Description: An enriched housing program (EHP) is established and operated for the purpose of providing long-term residential care to five or more adults, primarily persons sixty-five years of age or older, in community-integrated setting resembling independent housing units. The program provides or arranges for the provision of room, board, housekeeping, personal care and supervision. Enriched housing programs may be operated by a natural person, a partnerships, a not-for-profit corporation, a public corporation, a non-publicly traded business corporation or a limited liability company. The operator of an enriched housing program may also offer to nonresidents of the facility services such as social day care program, temporary residential care, or other services the facility is authorized to provide to enable such persons to remain in or return to the community. Adult care facilities are not licensed to provide any nursing or medical care.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Adult Care Facility - Residence for Adults Certificate to Operate (DOH 155)
Permit Description: A residence for adults facility is established and operated for the purpose of providing long-term residential care, room, board; housekeeping and supervision but NOT personal care to five or more adults, unrelated to the operator. The operator of a residence for adults facility may also offer to nonresidents of the facility services such as social day care program, temporary residential care, or other services the facility is authorized to provide to enable such persons to remain in or return to the community. Adult care facilities are not licensed to provide any nursing or medical care.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Application for EMS Operating Certificate (DOH-206, DOH-1881, DOH-3777, DOH-3778) - Advanced Life Support
Permit Description: Operating Certificate required for any person or organization which provides advanced life support care, but does not transport patients.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A permit authorizing the erection and maintenance of an advertising device within 660 feet of the New York State Thruway right-of-way subject to compliance with all Federal and State statutes, rules and regulations, as well as any Thruway Authority guidance documents.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Agreement for Lease of Armory (DMNA Form 42)
Permit Description: For temporary use of a Division of Military and Naval Affairs facility, usually the drill hall, for events such as antique shows, car shows, large gatherings, book fairs and similar activities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows the operation of an agricultural fairground that guarantees compliance with the requirements to protect public health. A separate permit for a food service establishment, temporary residence, or campground operating within the agricultural fairground is NOT required unless operated by a person OTHER than the owner of the agricultural fairground.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Application to Sell a Brand of Agricultural Liming Material (PI 41, PI 41A)
Permit Description: A license is issued to qualifying registered brands of agricultural liming material approved for sale or supplied in New York. Agricultural liming material is defined as all materials and calcium and magnesium products in the oxide, hydrate, carbonate or silicate form or combinations thereof and is intended for the use in the correction of soil acidity, including such forms of materials designated as burned lime, hydrated lime, carbonate of lime, agricultural limestone, slag and marl. Before a labeled agricultural liming material product can be offered for sale or supplied in New York, a manufacturer or shipper must register each brand, the type of liming material, the brand name, minimum specifications as to total neutralizing value, the calcium and magnesium content, effective neutralizing value and fineness along with the plant location and principal office address. Such certificate constitutes a warranty by the supplier to the receiver that the material will meet the minimum specifications stated at the time of delivery.   Every year on or before February 1 licensees are required to report the net tonnage of each brand of agricultural liming material sold or supplied in New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Facilities that have emissions of criteria of certain pollutants that are less than half the major source threshold which is less than 25 tons per year for upstate and less than 12.5 tons per year for downstate are allowed to register.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: The purpose is to require owners and/or operators of air contamination sources to obtain a permit from the department for the operation of such sources. Types of activities range from stationary combustion sources, to incinerators, to industrial process, exhaust, or ventilation systems.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Certifies a trade school or other entities (such as a trade association) to provide Alcohol Training Awareness Program training to insure compliance with the NYS Alcohol Beverage Control Laws. An approved ATAP provider will issue a certificate of completion after successful completion of the program.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: This is a permit for a certificate of approval for a plan which describes the actions to be taken by an air contamination source owner/operator for each emission source during each stage of an air pollution episode so as to achieve a reduction in emissions. This is necessary to prevent further increases in air contamination when weather conditions and/or concentration of air contaminants are such that immediate action (i.e., decreasing the contaminants) is warranted. The owner of a significant air contamination source must submit a proposed episode action plan to the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation if requested.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Authorizes the licensee to make substantial or minor alternations to the premises. Farm winery licenses excepted.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: A permit authorizing an aircraft company to purchase alcoholic beverages from a duly licensed manufacturer or wholesaler for sale and consumption outside the territorial jurisdiction of New York State.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will not be offered for sale or sold in this state; A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made; The alcoholic beverages will be delivered directly to the aircraft of the permittee or to a warehouse for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor Authority;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers will purchased.  Applicant must own and operate or charter and operate the aircraft.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit authorizing an aircraft company to purchase from a manufacture or wholesaler, alcoholic beverages for sale and consumption outside the territorial jurisdiction of New York State.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will not be offered for sale or sold in this state; A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made; The alcoholic beverages will be delivered directly to the aircraft of the permittee or to a warehouse for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor Authority; Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers will be purchased; Applicant must own and operate or charter and operate the aircraft.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Retail dealers who sell, or offer for sale beverage alcohol products (such as wine or liquor stores, restaurants, bars, private clubs, grocery stores or supermarkets as well as retail dealers at large), wholesale dealers and importers in liquors, beer and/or wine; and manufacturers of nonbeverage products (industrial); must register with the U.S. Department of the Treasury, Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau prior to engaging in business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Permit regulates the manufacture, distribution and sale of non-beverage alcohol. Permit authorizes the sale and distribution of alcohol to licensed rectifiers and permittees.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit regulates the manufacture, distribution and sale of non-beverage alcohol. This permit authorizes the sale and distribution of alcohol to holders of Class C permits, and to permittees under sections 91 and 92 of Alcohol Beverage Control Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit regulates the manufacture, distribution and sale of non-beverage alcohol. Permit authorizes a wholesale druggist to sell and distribute alcohol to permittees under Sections 91 and 92 of the ABC Law, and to use alcohol in the preparation of products listed in Section 91.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: The permit authorizes the holder to sell and distribute alcohol to the holder of a winery license. The permit is issued only to a person holding a winery license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the purchase and use of alcohol by the superintendent, or duly authorized officer of a hospital, museum, laboratory, art, charitable, education or similar public institution, or by a drug store, a licensed physician, dentist, veterinarian, optometrist and chiropodist, or to a manufacturing establishment using alcohol in its processes of manufacture.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  Alcohol purchased from a distributor must be in sealed containers not larger than 5 gallons; Books and records will be maintained stating the amount of alcohol purchased, size of containers, name, address and permit number from whom it was purchased.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Licenses companies to do management planning, project design, abatement, monitoring, inspection or any other asbestos project activity.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Name: Alcoholism Facility OASAS Chemical Dependence Certification (PPD-11)
Permit Description: Allows the holder to operate a residential treatment or rehabilitation program for alcoholism. An alcoholism facility is an organizational entity which has discrete physical space, staff and management resources for the provision of examination, diagnosis, care, treatment, rehabilitation and room, board and support on a 24-hour-a-day basis for persons suffering from alcoholism or alcohol abuse, and which may, in addition, have resources for the provision of services to outpatients. An alcohol crisis center is a free-standing alcoholism facility which operates only an alcohol primary care program at a specific site and does not provide medical detoxification. Alcoholism treatment center means a free-standing alcoholism facility which operates an inpatient rehabilitation program at a specific site and which may, in addition, operate an alcohol primary care program or an outpatient alcoholism program at the same site.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Application for EMS Operating Certificate (DOH-206, DOH-1881, DOH-3777, DOH-3778) - Ambulance Service
Permit Description: Operating Certificate allows for an individual, partnership, association, corporation, municipality or any legal or public entity or subdivision to engage in providing emergency medical care and the transportation of sick or injured persons by motor vehicle, aircraft or other forms of transportation to, from, or between general hospitals or other health care facilities. It is issued initially upon Regional Council Approval and indicates approval and meeting minimum standards of 10 NYCRR 800 for ambulance service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Ambulatory Services for Mentally and Developmentally Disabled Operating Certificate (For New Program/Construction) (CON, OMR CON-1)
Permit Description: Permit defines medical assistance (Medicaid) payments for ambulatory services for the mentally retarded and developmentally disabled. These services are day treatment, clinic services and home care programs.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Any person or entity in New York that sells, offers for sale, or otherwise makes available, ammonium nitrate or regulated ammonium nitrate materials must register as an ammonium nitrate fertilizer retailer. If you have a current New York Commercial Fertilizer Distributor license, you are exempt from paying the fee for the Ammonium Nitrate Fertilizer Retailer license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Identifies and permits group to play amplified music at Anthony Wayne Recreation Area.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Application for Amusement Device, Viewing Standard or Tent Permit Application For Examination of Plans (SH-80, DOSH-700, SH-81)
Permit Description: Permit allows the operation of amusement devices, viewing stands and tents at carnivals, fairs and amusement parks where an admission fee is charged. Prevents the operation or use of devices and facilities that do not meet minimum standards of compliance. Jurisdiction also extends to dry slides, water slides, mountain coasters and fun houses. Permit does not apply to single passenger, coin operated rides where no admission for use is charged; and/or a device or structure operating (a) only in New York City, (b) operated by an entity other than a private owner or lessee on any state or county fairground.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: An Annual Permit allows toll-free travel for the first 30 miles of all New York State Thruway ticket system trips. Permit is used for Thruway commuters and frequent travelers. It is not for commercial use. Permit is only available for E-Z Pass customers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows a person or company to engage in the business of claiming, demanding, charging, receiving, collecting or contracting for the collection of, an advance fee from a customer for furnishing information concerning the location and availability of real property including apartment housing, which may be leased, rented, shared or sublet as a private dwelling, abode, or place of residence.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: Allows a person or company to engage in the business, for an advance fee, to arrange, conduct, coordinate, handle or cause meetings between a customer and the current owner or occupant of a legally occupied real property, including apartment housing who wishes to share that housing with one or more individuals as a private dwelling, abode, or place of residence.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Certificate of Inspection verifies the status of the health of honey bees and equipment and permits their interstate movement and/or transport.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits

Permit Name: Motor Vehicle Body Damage Estimator License (VS-117)
Permit Description: To identify qualified individuals for assessing body damage to lessen disputes between body shops and insurance companies.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: All apparel manufacturers and contractors engaged in the making, cutting, sewing, finishing, assembling, pressing or otherwise producing of ANY means, women's, children's, or infants' apparel or section or component thereof MUST register. This includes but is not limited to apparel services industries such as contractors, jobbers, or manufacturers engaged in pleating, embroidery, stitching, buttons, belts, trimmings, shoulder pads and other accessories. Exemptions are the cleaning or tailoring after the apparel has been sold at retail.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permits an individual or business to rent space as an independent contractor in an appearance enhancement shop.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permits an individual or company to operate an appearance enhancement shop
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Approval of Transfer or Lease of Utility Consents, Franchises, Works, Systems or Agreements
Permit Description: Approval of the transfer of utility consents, franchises, works, systems or agreements is required by the Public Service Commission to ensure that such transfers are in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Approval to Use Certain Words in a Corporate Name or Title
Permit Description: Allows the Superintendent of Financial Services to grant approval to use the following words or derivatives of the words for use in an entity's corporate name or other title: Acceptance, Bank, Finance, Investment, Loan, Mortgage, Savings, Trust. (Approval for the words: Loan, Mortgage, Finance, or Investment should be submitted to the Mortgage Banking Applications Unit.)
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits

Permit Description: Allows companies to be self-insured if they have a minimum of 26 vehicles to be registered.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: All insurance companies must be registered as a corporation. Insurance companies are not permitted to use trade names in New York and must receive prior approval from the NYS Department of Financial Service. Name changes for entities must also receive prior approval. The name must first be submitted to the NYS Department of Financial Services for consideration/approval before filing for licensure. It is highly recommended that foreign insurers have their business entity name approved prior to submitting an application. Words that must receive approval include: benefit, bond, casualty, doctor, indemnity, insurance, investment, lawyer, title, trust and underwriter. All entity names and trade names used by an individual, partnership or limited liability company must be approved by DFS, however, there is no fee required for the name approval of licensees other than actual insurance companies.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows an individual to commercially apply or supervise the commercial application of aquatic antifouling paints to boats and other marine vessels, and to register a commercial pesticide business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit is required by business entities that, for hire, provide secured transportation of valuables by means of specially designed and constructed bullet-resistant armored vehicles and armored car guards.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: License required by individuals employed by a licensed armored car carrier to provide secured transportation services; protect and safeguard valuable cargo from one place to another; or provide cash services for automated teller machines; all by means of bullet resistant armored vehicles. Additionally an armored car guard possesses or has access to a firearm. Note: Those armored car employees who may drive or accompany an armored car vehicle, but who do not carry or are not authorized to access a firearm, are not required to register under this license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Article 43 Non-Profit Health Service Corporation License
Permit Description: A license to do business as a non-profit medical indemnity corporation to furnish medical expense indemnity, dental indemnity, hospital services or health services.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Article 43 Corporation Subscriber Rate Adjustment Application
Permit Description: Approval for an Article 43 Non-Profit or Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) desiring to increase or decrease premiums for any contract shall submit a rate filing or application.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Asbestos certificates are used by individuals as proof of having received the appropriate training to safely perform the duties of any of nine classifications of asbestos abatement work. The certificate is a picture ID which allows contractors, inspectors and other interested parties to ascertain that a given individual is properly trained.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Name: Approval or Revision of an Asbestos Safety Training Program (DOH-2134A)
Permit Description: Approval indicates training sponsor has met requirements contained in Part 73 of 10 NYCRR (Asbestos Safety Training Program Requirements) as authorized by Section 905 of the Labor Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Name: License as an Assisted Living Residence, Enhanced ALR, or  Special Needs ALR (DOH-4355)
Permit Description: Licenses an entity which provides or arranges housing, on-site monitoring and personal care services and/or home care services (either directly or indirectly) in a home-like setting to five or more adult residents unrelated to the assisted living provider. The Assisted Living Residence must be certified as an adult home or enriched housing program. The license allows the entity/facility to hold itself out as an assisted living, assisted living residence, or assistive living, or uses words or terms to that effect in describing and/or marketing itself to the public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description:
Corporations, limited liability companies, and limited partnerships are required by statute to conduct activities under
their true legal or “real” name. If a corporation, limited liability company, or limited partnership desires to conduct
activities under a name other than its true legal or “real” name, a certificate complying with Section 130 of the NYS
General Business Law must be filed with the NYS Department of State. All other entities such as general
partnerships, sole proprietorships and limited liability partnerships are required to file an assumed name certificate
directly with the county clerk of each county in which the entity conducts or transacts business.

The completed Certificate of Assumed Name, together with the appropriate filing fees, should be forwarded to the New
York Department of State, Division of Corporations, One Commerce Plaza, 99 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY
12231.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Description: Allows a person to enter into an agency contract with a student-athlete, directly or indirectly, recruits or solicits a student-athlete to enter into an agency contract. Exemption to the registration include: other than a spouse, parent, sibling, grandparent, or guardian of the student-athlete, or individuals acting solely on behalf of a professional sports team or professional sports organization.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: ATV Dealer - Official Business Certificate (VS-1, VS-19, VS-141, VS-142, VS-3)
Permit Description: To allow the sale at wholesale or retail of All-Terrain Vehicles which are properly equipped for safety, and to show acceptable evidence of ownership. Exception: If already a registered motor vehicle dealer, may sell ATVs without a separate ATV Dealer license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: This permit authorizes motor carriers to transport household goods within New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit allows the holder to provide intra-state transportation for compensation in buses and full sized vans (10 Passengers or More). (Transportation in sedans, station wagons and minivans are excluded and do not require this license.)
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Authority to Transport Passengers in Charter Service (RA 52-1)
Permit Description: Intrastate authority to transport chartered or special parties between all points within the State of New York. If you intend to transport passengers between points within the State in Common or contract carriage other than charter, you must file an Application for Authority to Transport Passengers, Form RA-50.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Authority to Transport Property (Except Household Goods) (RA 61-1)
Permit Description: This permit authorizes motor carriers to transport property within New York State. This license does not cover carriers of household goods.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Approval to Sell Automobile Exhaust Emission Control Device After Market Replacement
Permit Description: This is a permit for sale/replacement of automobile emission control devices installed on automobiles built to comply with California emissions standards. If the replacement takes place through the California process, no permit is needed. If the replacement does not follow the California process, the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation has the right to require proof that the emission control device meets New York State standards.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows an aircraft operator to import kero-jet fuel into New York in the fuel tanks of its aircraft for consumption in this state for business purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certification of Backflow Prevention Device Tester (DOH-1024, DOH-1013)
Permit Description: Backflow prevention devices must be tested initially and at least once a year thereafter. These devices must be tested by trained and certified individuals. The training course is four days in duration and upon successful completion of a written and hands-on test, the candidate is certified for a period of three years.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certificate of Approval of Backflow Prevention Devices (DOH-347)
Permit Description: Installation of these devices provides positive safeguards of the distribution system water quality from potential customer contamination.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Application and Notification for Article 4 License (Milk Control) (DMC-163)
Permit Description: Person is licensed to make bacterial counts of milk and/or cream or to make tests of milk and/or cream to detect certain abnormalities, where the results of such test affects the rate of payment to the producer for such milk and/or cream, the classification of milk and/or cream as received from the producer, or the acceptance or rejection of such milk and/or cream by the operator of a milk-receiving or manufacturing plant.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Authority to write bail bonds on behalf of insurer.

Permit Description: Authority to write bail bonds on behalf of insurer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Bail Bond Agent License (Limited Liability Company) (Form 928)
Permit Description: Authority to write bail bonds as a limited liability company on behalf of an insurer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Authority to write bail bonds on behalf of insurer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Allows an individual or entity who, for a fee, apprehends and surrenders individuals on bond or bail, who have failed to appear in court, to jail or to Court. Also known as a bounty hunter.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: A bait license allows the licensee to take for sale as bait and sell as bait certain fish and aquatic insects (such as: minnows, darters, sticklebacks, tadpoles, smelt or ice fish, suckers, alewives or sawbellies).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows commercial bait taking in designated waters under the jurisdiction of State Parks.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Savings Bank by a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a holding company to acquire a savings bank. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Acquisition of an Investment Company by a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization to invest in Article 12 investment company (change in control of investment company). To assure safety of acquired institution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: There is a requirement that all bank holding companies register with the Superintendent of Banks within 180 days of incorporation. The purpose is to ensure that all bank holding companies are registered with the Banking Department.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Approval Certificate for a Bank Holding Company to Acquire all the Capital Stock of a Bank or Trust Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a holding company to acquire another bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Bank Holding Company by a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorizes the acquisition of a bank holding company by another bank holding company. Ensures public interest and competitive factors are met.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Bank or Trust Company by a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a bank holding company to acquire a bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Approval of a Bank Holding Company to Acquire the Stock of Bank or Trust Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a holding company to acquire the stock of a bank or trust company. It's purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Business School/Computer Training Facility Director License (BPSS-15)
Permit Description: Allows a person to serve as a director of a registered business school or computer training facility.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Approval to Become a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a corporation to become a holding company through the acquisition of a bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest. Also applies to acquisition of stock form savings bank and savings and loan association.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Approval to Use the Term "Bank" in the Title of a Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a bank holding company to use the word, or a derivative of the word, "bank" in the holding company's title. The purpose is to ensure that the names of bank holding companies are not so similar as to confuse the public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Merger of a Bank Holding Company with Another Bank Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a bank holding company to merge with and into another bank holding company. The purpose is to ensure that the merger is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Conversion from a Bank to Trust Company or Trust Company to Bank
Permit Description: To change lines of business. To assure sound operation of bank.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a bank or trust company organized under the banking law or a foreign banking corporation licensed by the superintendent of banks of this state or a banking corporation organized under the laws of the United States and doing business in this state to sell warehouse receipts pertaining to alcoholic beverages which it accepted as collateral security for a loan to a licensee, and which it acquired through default in payment of such loan.  Warehouse receipts must be kept on file by the permittee.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  Warehouse receipts issued for the storage of liquor or wine in bulk will be sold and delivered only to duly licensed manufacturers or wholesalers;  Warehouse receipts issued for the storage of liquor and/or wine in the original sealed containers, not exceeding one quart each of liquor or 15 gallons each of wine, will be sold only to duly licensed wholesalers and retailer;   A copy of the permit will be delivered to each purchaser;  This permit shall be valid for one transaction only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits

Permit Name: Authorization Certificate to Open and Occupy a Bank Branch Office
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a bank or trust company to establish a branch office. It's purpose is to ensure that the establishment of the office will not create unsound and destructive competition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Authorization that allows the business of a bank or trust company to be conducted. The purpose is to ensure that the chartering of an investment company will enhance public convenience and advantage without creating unsound and destructive competition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Savings Bank and Loan Branch Office by a Bank/Trust Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a bank or trust company to acquire branches from a savings bank or savings and loan association. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission to Change the Location of Branch/Principal Office (CL)
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to authorize a bank or trust company to change to designation of a branch office to that of principal office and of principal office to that of branch office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission to Establish, Maintain and Operate a Public Accommodation Office (PAO) - Bank or Trust Company
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a bank or trust company to establish an office as an adjunct to an existing banking office to conduct the activities set forth in Section 193 of the NYS Banking Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Bank/Trust Company to Acquire Branches of a Bank/Trust Company
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Bank/Trust Company to Acquire Branches of a Bank/Trust Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a bank or trust company to acquire branches from another bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application to Control More Than 10% of Voting Stock of a Bank
Permit Description: Authorization that allows one or more corporate entities and/or individuals to acquire 10 percent or more of the voting stock of a bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Approval for Bank/Trust Company to Restore Canceled Shares to Status of Authorized but Unissued
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank or trust company, with the approval of the Superintendent, to restore canceled shares back to authorized but unissued status. Application also applies to stock-form savings banks and savings and loan associations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Bank/Trust Company to Amend an Organizational Certificate
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission for a bank or trust company to make changes to its Organization Certificate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Bank/Trust Company to Convert from National Charter to State Charter
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a national bank or trust company convert to a state bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that operation of the entity as a state-chartered institution is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Bank/Trust Company to Purchase the Assets of a National Bank
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a state bank or trust company to purchase the assets of national bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Bank/Trust Company to Restate an Organization Certificate
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank or trust company to restate its Organization Certificate to reflect any changes that have been made.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Branch Closing Notice for Bank/Trust Company
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to respond to a proposal from a bank or trust company to close a branch office. The purpose is to allow the Superintendent to make a finding as to whether or not the proposed branch closing will result in a significant reduction of banking services in the community to be affected.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Bank/Trust Company to Have Excess Number of Directors
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank or trust company, with the approval of the Superintendent, to have a higher number of directors than stated in the statute. The purpose is to ensure that the institution will not have too large a board for its size.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Bank/Trust Company to Leave Director Vacancies Unfilled
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank or trust company to leave vacancies on the Board of Directors. The purpose is to ensure that there are a sufficient number of outside directors. Also applies to stock-form savings banks and savings and loan associations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows an individual to work and train under the supervision of a licensed barber.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Permit allows individual to rent space as an independent contractor in a barber shop.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual or firm to operate a barber shop.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows an individual to engage in the occupation of being a barber performing the following services upon the head of a human being: shaving or trimming the beard or cutting hair; giving facial or scalp massage with oils, creams, lotions or other preparations, either by hand or mechanical appliances; singeing, shampooing, arranging, dressing or dyeing hair or applying hair tonic; and applying cosmetic preparations, antiseptics, powders, oils, clays or lotions to scalp, face or neck.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Permit to Operate a Bathing Beach (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Grants permission to operate a bathing beach used by the public
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Registration is required by manufacturers of "new bedding" which is bedding that only contains material that has not been previously used for any purpose, including by-products produced in the manufacture of new fabric, or material reclaimed from new fabric.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Manufacturer, Repairer-Renovator or Rebuilder of Used Bedding Application  (DOS-1427-a)
Permit Description: Registration allows a business entity to engage in the manufacture, repair, renovation or rebuilding of "used bedding" which is bedding that may contain any components from previously used bedding.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Allows a retailer or wholesaler to sell any mattress or box spring which in its entirety is used and has not been repaired or renovated
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: Bell Jar Ticket Dispensing Machine Registration (GC-01BJ)
Permit Description: This registration is required for each bell jar ticket vending machine.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A license allowing a lessor to rent property to authorized organizations for the holding of bingo games. This license is issued through the local municipality.

Permit Name: Supplier License for Manufacturing or Distributing Bingo Supplies and Equipment (GC/BC-106)
Permit Description: A license allowing the manufacturer or sale of bingo supplies and equipment to authorized bingo organizations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Permission to Disburse Net Proceeds of Bingo (BC-317)
Permit Description: Allows the regulating agency to determine that bingo funds are disbursed for lawful purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A license allowing authorized organizations to conduct bingo games. Issued by the local municipality.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: An amendment to a bingo license allowing an authorized organization to change its officers and directors, persons in charge of games, auxiliary organizations assisting at games, assistants to persons in charge of games, expenses, prizes, or dates, hours and rent of games held. This is granted by the local municipality.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Allows the licensee to sell captive bred birds, wild birds acquired before November 1, 1991 to other bird breeders and to scientific, zoological or educational institutions. The licensee is also allowed to apply butt-end or seamless bands to captive bred birds produced by the licensed bird breeder. The following species of captive bred birds may be sold without this license: Diamond dove, cockatiel, crimson rosella, Eastern rosella, pale-headed rosella, red-rumped parakeet, Bourke's parrot, budgerigar, blue-masked lovebird, zebra finch, gouldian finch, society finch, java sparrow and common canary.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permit to Operate A Private Freshwater Fish Hatchery
Permit Description: Permit allows permittee to propagate, raise and sell black bass (i.e., largemouth bass, smallmouth bass).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: 1 Year/5 Year Black Bear Tracking Dog License (BTD-1, BTD-5)
Permit Description: Allows the licensee to train dogs of certain breeds to track, trail, pursue and tree black bears. Licensee is also required to carry a current New York big game hunting license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Blaster's Certificate of Competence (SH-810 , GO 1, SH-811, ID-5 DOL)
Permit Description: Any person engaged in the handling, placing and detonating of explosives must hold a Certificate Of Competence. This certificate is not valid in New York City.

Permit Description: To establish and maintain standards required by the Vehicle and Traffic Law regarding driving while intoxicated.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Take Blue Mussels from Public Underwater Lands within the State of New York by Mechanical Means
Permit Description: Permit allows the permittee by mechanical means to take a limited quantity of blue mussels (Mytilus Edulis) from specified waters. Without this permit, blue mussels may be taken with hand operated gear only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Boat Dealer Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19, VS-141, VS-142, VS-3)
Permit Description: Allows a person to buy, sell, or trade boats designed to have a motor and are used to transport one or more people across water. Allows the dealer to register boats containing motors, to promote boating safety, and provide consumer protection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Do Work or Use Property Owned by the Power Authority (St. Lawrence/F.D.R. Power Project - Boat Mooring Permit) (PA-39S)
Permit Description: Grants permittee the right to the landing and mooring of pleasure boats. Also the construction, installation, and maintenance of removable mooring facilities such as a post, dock, pier, slip, anchor or buoy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Instructor certification card identifies those individuals who have completed and required training process to instruct the state administered "Young Boater Safety Course."
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Permit for Boat/Canoe Rental at the Forest Preserve Public Campground (83-20-9-10c)
Permit Description: Allows a person to have a livery to rent row boats, canoes, or non-mechanically propelled crafts at New York state forest preserve public campgrounds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Insurance company boiler inspectors are issued a Certificate of Competency after passing a written examination to determine their knowledge on NYS Boiler Code Rules 4 and 14.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: A license authorizing the operator of premises, operated for a profit and with a capacity of twenty or more persons, to permit persons to come to the premises for the purpose of consuming alcohol beverages. This permit does not authorize the sale of alcoholic beverages,
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Certificate of Approval for Bottled or Bulk Water Facilities (DOH-349)
Permit Description: This certificate is for those facilities which bottle and distribute water used for human consumption, food preparation and culinary purposes. It sets standards for control of source water, facilities and equipment and provides for acceptable practice in sanitation, bottling and container labeling. To ensure that water quality control is maintained, basic water quality sampling requirements for in plant control are specified. Bottled water shall mean any product, including natural spring or well water taken from municipal or private utility systems or other water, distilled water, deionized water or any of the foregoing to which chemicals may be added, which are put into sealed bottles, packages or other containers, to be sold for domestic consumption or culinary use, involving a likelihood of such water being ingested by human beings.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a NYS licensed liquor or wine wholesaler to conduct no operation other than bottling, recasking, filtering or clarifying.  A $5,000 penal bond must be provided.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  Such operations will be performed only on the premises of a United States Customs bonded warehouse or in a foreign trade zone establishment pursuant to federal law, for which premises a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor Authority.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the permittee to bottle liquor manufactured outside the State of New York or wine produced in a foreign country and received in this State in bulk, and as an incident thereto, filter or clarify such wine or liquor. Bottling may be performed for, or on behalf of, wholesale liquor or wine licensees or for persons authorized to sell liquor and/or wine at wholesale pursuant to the law and regulations of another State, on the premises stated in the permit or in a United States customs bonded warehouse for which a warehouse permit has been issued under this chapter.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: Professional Mixed Martial Artist or Boxer License DOS 0321
Permit Description: Authorizes licensee to participate in mixed martial arts or boxing matches and receive a purse, money, a prize, pecuniary gain, or other thing exceeding seventy-five dollars in value.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: All gyms, clubs, training camps and other organizations that maintain training facilities providing contact sparring for persons who prepare for participation in boxing or sparring matches or exhibitions must be licensed. Temporary training facilities are exempt from licensing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Standard/Private Brand Label Registration (Wine Product, Wine Specialty, Low Alcohol Wine) (Form B-3)
Permit Description: Every brand of wine product, wine specialty, and low alcohol wine sold in New York must be registered. Registration ensures the exclusive use of labels, service marks, trade names, and trade marks.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Description: Registers a standard brand label of cider, by or on behalf of brand owner. To ensure the exclusive use of labels, service marks, trade names and trade marks. "Cider" means the partially or fully fermented juice of fresh, whole apples, containing more than three and two-tenths per centum but not more than seven per centum alcohol by volume, when used for beverage purposes, and to which nothing has been added to increase the alcoholic content produced by natural fermentation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Private Brand Label Registration (Liquor and Beer) (Form B-1)
Permit Description: To ensure the exclusive use of labels, service marks, trade names, and trade marks. Registers private brand label liquor or beer by or on behalf of a retailer. A brewer who also holds an on-premises license for a restaurant on or adjacent to the brewery premises, and sells a particular beer brewed on the premises exclusively through a vat to tap system, is not required to register the brand label with the State Liquor Authority, but is required to register the tap out of which the beer is dispensed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Standard Brand Label Registration (Liquor & Beer) (Form, B-2)
Permit Description: To ensure the exclusive use of labels, service marks, trade names, and trade marks. Registers a standard label of liquor or beer, in the absence of which, the brand may not be labeled or advertised for sale. May be filed only by a brand owner, if licensed in the NYS or, if not licensed in NYS, by the NYS licensed wholesaler who is appointed as the exclusive brand agent. A brewer who also holds an on-premises license for a restaurant on or adjacent to the brewery premises, and sells a particular beer brewed on the premises exclusively through a vat to tap system, is not required to register the brand label with the State Liquor Authority, but is required to register the tap out of which the beer is dispensed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Description: A permit valid for two years is issued by the commissioner to breath analysis operators who have completed an approved program based upon standards acceptable to the training agency and certified by the commissioner.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous

Permit Description: Brewer (D 101): Authorizes licensee to operate a brewery for the manufacture of beer. ABC Law Sections 51 and 103. Requires a $15,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Farm Brewer (FD 106): Authorizes licensee to operate a brewery for the manufacture of up to 75,000 barrels of NYS labeled beer and/or cider annually. ABC Law Sections 51-a and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Micro Brewer (MI 101): Authorizes licensee to operate a brewery for the manufacture of up to 75,000 barrels of beer annually. ABC Law Sections 51 and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Cider Producer (CD 304): Authorizes a licensee to operate a cidery for the manufacture of cider. ABC Law Sections 58 and 103. Requires a $1,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Farm Cidery (CF 309): Authorizes licensee to operate a cidery for the manufacture of up to 250,000 gallons of NYS labeled cider annually. ABC Law Sections 58-c and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Distiller Class A (DA 201): Authorizes licensee to operate a distillery for the manufacture of distilled spirits and/or operate a rectifying plant. ABC Law Sections 61(1) and 103. Requires a $25,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Distiller Class A-1 (DA 206): Authorizes a licensee to operate a distillery for the manufacture of up to 75,000 gallons of distilled spirits annually. ABC Law Sections 61(1-a) and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Distiller Class B (DB 202): Authorizes licensee to operate a rectifying plant. ABC Law Sections 61(2) and 103. Requires a $25,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Distiller Class B-1 (DB 205): Authorizes the licensee to operate a rectifying plant producing up to 75,000 gallons annually. ABC Law Sections 61(2-b) and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Distiller Class C (DC 204): Authorizes licensee to operate a distillery for the manufacture of fruit brandy only. ABC Law Sections 61(2-a) and 103. Requires a $5,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Farm Distiller Class D (DD 207): Authorizes licensee to operate a distillery for the manufacture of up to 75,000 gallons of NYS labeled liquor annually. ABC Law Sections 61(2-c) and 103. Please see the associated license fees. Winery/Special Winery (DW 301): Authorizes licensee to operate a winery for the manufacture of wine. ABC Law Sections 76, 76-c and 103. Requires a $10,000 bond. Please see the associated license fees. Farm Winery/Special Farm Winery (FW 302): Authorizes licensee to operate a winery for the manufacture of
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Permit allows a licensed brewer to sell beer at retail in bulk for consumption and not for resale at a clam bake, barbecue, or similar outdoor gathering.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Application for Brewers to Sell Beer for Off-Premises Consumption at State and County Fairs and Farmers Markets
Permit Description: Allows a licensed brewer whose annual production is less than sixty thousand barrels to sell beer in a sealed container for off-premises consumption at the NYS Fair, at recognized county fairs, and at farmers' markets operated on a not-for-profit basis. As a condition of the permit, a representative from the brewer must be present at the time of sale.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a licensee or his/her employee, or a brewer or manufacturer as defined in Section 3 of the ABC Law, or an importer having a basic permit as required by Section 1.20 of Title 27 of the Code of Federal Regulations, to obtain a permit to serve small samples of beer or malt beverages they produce or imports at establishments licensed under Section 54 or 54(a) of the ABC Law. This permit may also be issued for serving small samples of beer or malt beverages produced or imported by such licensee, brewer, manufacturer or importer at annual fairs sponsored by agricultural and horticultural societies as defined in Section 1409 of the not-for-profit corporation law, and for sampling at the licensed premises of the holder of a wholesaler’s license under Section 53 of the ABC Law issued or renewed prior to July 1, 1960 and thereafter renewed or transferred, which authorizes the holder there of to sell beer at retail to a person for consumption at their home. A beer tasting is a presentation of samples of one or more beers for the purpose of acquainting the tasters with the characteristics of the beer or beers tasted. A copy of the state's brewer license and a copy of the Federal Basic Permit issued by TTB (Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau) if the brewer is not located in New York State must be provided.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a licensee or his/her employee, or a brewer or manufacturer as defined in Section 3 of the ABC Law, or an importer having a basic permit as required by Section 1.20 of Title 27 of the Code of Federal Regulations, to obtain a permit to serve small samples of beer or malt beverages they produce or imports at establishments licensed under Section 54 or 54(a) of the ABC Law. This permit may also be issued for serving small samples of beer or malt beverages produced or imported by such licensee, brewer, manufacturer or importer at annual fairs sponsored by agricultural and horticultural societies as defined in Section 1409 of the not-for-profit corporation law, and for sampling at the licensed premises of the holder of a wholesaler’s license under Section 53 of the ABC Law issued or renewed prior to July 1, 1960 and thereafter renewed or transferred, which authorizes the holder there of to sell beer at retail to a person for consumption at their home. A beer tasting is a presentation of samples of one or more beers for the purpose of acquainting the tasters with the characteristics of the beer or beers tasted.  A copy of the state's brewer license and a copy of the Federal Basic Permit issued by TTB (Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau) if the brewer is not located in New York State must be provided.

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a person to act as a broker in the purchase and sale of alcoholic beverages for a fee or commission, for or on behalf of a person authorized to manufacture or sell at wholesale alcoholic beverages within or out of New York State.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  No such permit shall be issued to any person who does not qualify under Section 126 of the ABC Law except as to citizenship or who is interested in the manufacture or sale of alcoholic beverages in any manner whatsoever, either as an owner or partner, if a partnership, or as a stockholder, officer or director; A person holding an interest in a license to manufacture or sell alcoholic beverages in any state is ineligible to hold a broker permit in New York State;  Such permittee shall not buy or sell any alcoholic for his own account, or take or deliver title to such alcoholic beverages, or receive or store any alcoholic beverages in his own name in New York State, or offer, agree to offer or sell any alcoholic beverages to any retailer within New York State;  The permittee shall require all purchases of alcoholic beverages to be billed by the seller directly to the purchaser and paid for by such purchaser directly to the seller;  No alcoholic beverages shall be purchased for an out-of-state principal unless such principal is authorized to import such alcoholic beverages into New York State or foreign country to which such alcoholic beverages are consigned;  The permittee shall require that all alcoholic beverages purchased in New York State for the account of an out-of-state principal be delivered directly to the steamship, vessel, railroad car or transportation company for delivery to the principal outside New York State;  The permittee shall not offer for sale or act as a broker in the sale of any brand of liquor or wine in New York State except at the price and the discounts in effect for such brand in the schedule of prices to wholesalers on the date of offer or sale, unless permission in writing has been granted by the Authority for good cause shown;  The permittee shall maintain separate books and records which shall include, but not necessarily be limited to, the names and addresses of all purchasers and sellers of alcoholic beverages, the quantity and type of alcoholic beverages involved in each transaction and the amount of the commission or fee accuring to such permitee for each transaction.  Such records shall also include documents or photostats evidencing the authority of each out-of-State purchaser to import alcoholic beverages into New York State or foreign country to which such alcoholic beverages are consigned, and all correspondence, memoranda and documents relating to transactions involving alcoholic beverages and the broker's employment in connection therewith.  Such records shall be maintained for a period of at least two (2) years;  Electronic fingerprinting is required to receive this permit.  SLA requires you to schedule an appointment within 48 hours of applying for this permit.  Instructions for Electronic fingerprinting can be found at our SLA Website.  Fingerprinting will not be required upon renewal.  It is completed at initial application only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

 A person holding an interest in a license to manufacture or sell alcoholic beverages in any state is ineligible to hold a broker permit in New York State;  Such permitee shall not buy or sell any alcoholic beverages for his own account, or take or deliver title to such alcoholic beverages, or receive or store any alcoholic beverages in his own name in New York State, or offer, agree to offer or sell any alcoholic beverages to any retailer within New York State;  The permittee shall require all purchases of alcoholic beverages to be billed by the seller directly to the purchaser and paid for by such purchaser directly to the seller;  No alcoholic beverages shall be purchased for an out-of-state principal unless such principal is authorized to import such alcoholic beverages into New York State or foreign country to which such alcoholic beverages are consigned;  The permittee shall require that all alcoholic beverages purchased in New York State for the account of an out-of-state principal be delivered directly to the steamship, vessel, railroad car or transportation company for delivery to the principal outside New York State;  The permittee shall not offer for sale or act as a broker in the sale of any brand of liquor or wine in New York State except at the price and at the discounts in effect for such brand in the schedule of prices to wholesalers on the date of offer or sale, unless permission in writing has been granted by the Authority for good cause shown;  The permittee shall maintain separate books and records which shall include, but not necessarily be limited to, the names and addresses of all purchasers and sellers of alcoholic beverages; the quantity and type of alcoholic beverages involved in each transaction and the amount of the commissioner or fee accruing to such permittee for each transaction.  Such records shall also include documents or photostats evidencing the authority of each out-of-State purchaser to import alcoholic beverages into New York State or foreign country to which such alcoholic beverages are consigned, and all correspondence, memoranda and documents relating to transactions involving alcoholic beverages and the broker's employment in connection therewith. Permit Description: Allows Type B not-for-profit corporations to engage in the business of budget planning within this state and, in connection with such solicitation, enters into a contract for budget planning with an individual or entity that resides in New York State. An attorney legally allowed to practice law in New York is allowed to offer budget planning services through the same legal entity the attorney uses to practice law. Budget planners allow the making of a contract between a person or entity engaged in budget planning with a particular debtor whereby the debtor agrees to pay a sum or sums of money periodically and the person or entity engaged in the budget planning distributes, or supervises, coordinates or controls the distribution of, the same among certain specified creditors in accordance with a plan agreed upon and the debtor further agrees to pay to such person or entity any valuable consideration for such services or for any other services rendered in connection therewith.
