Permit Description: Licensing a captive insurer in New York State to provide life, annuities, accident and health, fire, miscellaneous property, etc. insurances. A captive insurance company insures all or part of the risks of its parent. This unique company is created when a business or group of businesses form a corporation to insure or reinsure their own risk. A "Pure" captive is owned and controlled by one company and insures that company and/or its subsidiaries. A group captive is an insurance company owned and controlled by two or more unaffiliated organizations which is formed to provide insurance to its group or association of owners. The owners usually consist of companies from a related business field.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Authorizes an active on-premises retail licensee to furnish alcoholic beverages for use at a specific event located off the licensed premises. Applicant must be hired to furnish provisions (food) and alcoholic beverages at the event. An applicant cannot cater for themselves. Such permit shall be valid for a period of not to exceed 24 consecutive hours commending 8:00 a.m. of the effective date of such permit and shall authorize the permittee to furnish provisions and alcoholic beverages for use at an indoor event.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The application must be received by the Liquor Authority a minimum of 15 days prior to the event;  Food must be provided by applicant/licensee, meeting the minimum requirements under Section 64(a) of the ABC Law, for example:  salads, soups sandwiches, and finger foods;  Pretzels and potato chips do not meet the minimum requirements for food;  No person shall sell, deliver or give away or cause or permit or procure to be sold, delivered or given away any alcoholic beverages to any person, actually or apparently under the age of twenty-one years;  No child, actually or apparently under the age of 16 years will be admitted to the premises at which the event is held unless accompanied by their parent or guardian or by and adult person authorized by its parent or guardian, as provided by Section 260.20 of the Penal Law;  No sale or service of alcoholic beverages shall be made during the hours prohibited by the provisions of Section 106(5) of the ABC Law or by rule of the county government having jurisdiction in the county in which the event is held;  No alcoholic beverages may be sold, served or consumed in any area where bingo is played;  Alcoholic beverages must be purchased from a licensed brewer, winery or wholesaler ONLY, and not from a retail licensee;   A separate permit is required for each point of sale for each date.  The permit must be on display at the event.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a club licensee to furnish alcoholic beverages to members for use at events located off the licensed premises. This permit authorizes a club licensee to furnish alcoholic beverages for events on the licensed premises in accordance with Section 98(2). Such permit shall be valid for a period not to exceed 24 consecutive hours commencing 8:00 a.m. of the effective date of such permit and shall authorize the permittee to furnish provisions and alcoholic beverages for use at an indoor event. This permit is subject to the following conditions:   Application must be received by the Liquor Authority a minimum of 15 business days prior to the event;  Food must be provided by applicant/licensee, meeting the minimum requirements under Section 64(a) of the ABC Law, for example:  salads, soups, sandwiches, and finger foods.  Pretzels and potato chips do not meet the minimum requirements for food;  Events held off of the club premises will be held exclusively for the use and benefit of the club members only and will be so restricted; the club has not advertised the event as open to the public; and alcoholic beverages shall be sold only to members attending the event;  No person shall sell, deliver or give away or cause or permit or procure to be sold, delivered or given away any alcoholic beverages to any person, actually or apparently under the age of twenty-one years;  No child, actually or apparently under the  age of 16 years will be admitted to the premises at which event is help unless accompanied by their parent or guardian or by an adult person authorized by its parent or guardian, as provided by Section 260.20 of the Penal Law; No sale or service of alcoholic beverages shall be made during the hours prohibited by the provisions of Section 106(5) of the ABC Law or by rule of the county government having jurisdiction in the county in which the event is held;  No alcoholic beverages may be sold, served or consumed in any area where bingo is played; Alcoholic beverages must be purchased from a licensed brewer, winery, or wholesaler ONLY, and not from a retail licensee;  A separate permit is required for each point of sale for each date.  The permit must be on the display at the event.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

A central dispatch facility dispatches "black car operators" which is a registered owner of a for-hire vehicle ( i.e. limousines) or a driver designated by such registered owner to operate the registered owner's for-hire vehicle as the registered owner's authorized designee to both pick-up and discharge passengers in New York state and has been certified that more than ninety percent of its for-hire business is on a payment basis other than direct cash payment by a passenger and that the central dispatch facility does not own fifty percent or more of the cars it dispatches. Independent owners working for themselves are not covered under this law.

Permit Name: NYS Disability and Paid Family Leave Benefits Insurance
Permit Description: New York requires employers to provide disability and paid family leave benefits coverage to employees for an off-the-job injury or illness and paid family leave. NYS Workers' Compensation Law also requires that a business produce proof of disability and paid family leave benefits coverage to a state or municipal agency when it seeks to obtain a permit to do business. Employers can obtain disability and paid family leave benefits coverage through a private insurance carrier or the NYS Insurance Fund; being self-insured; or being legally exempt from having to obtain disability and paid family leave benefits coverage. There are limited situations where businesses are exempt from providing disability and paid family leave benefits coverage. The law provides for the payment of cash benefits to employees who have become disabled because of injuries or sicknesses that have no connection to their employment, and for disabilities arising from pregnancies. The law does NOT provide for the payments of medical care. The law also provides paid leave to bond with a new child, care for a loved one with a serious health condition or to help relieve family pressures when someone is called to active military service. The law allows, but does not require, an employer to collect contributions from its employees to offset the cost to provide this benefit.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Description:
The NYS Workers' Compensation Law requires employers to obtain and keep in effect workers' compensation coverage for all employees, including day laborers, leased employees, borrowed employees, part-time employees and family members (paid or unpaid). NYS Workers' Compensation Law also requires that a business produce proof of workers' compensation coverage to a state or municipal agency when it seeks to obtain a permit to do business. Employers meet this obligation by obtaining and maintaining a workers' compensation insurance policy with a private insurance carrier or the NYS Insurance Fund; being self-insured; or being legally exempt from having to obtain workers' compensation coverage. There are limited situations where businesses are exempt from providing workers' compensation coverage. The principles of workers' compensation laws are similar throughout the United States, but each state has unique laws with different benefits.

The workers' compensation system is based on no-fault. Employees are entitled to workers' compensation benefits for job-related injuries or illnesses without regard to fault as a cause of the injury. In turn, if a workers' compensation policy is in place, employees cannot sue employers for a work-related injury or illness in most cases. The type of business and total payroll determines the business' workers' compensation rate.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Name: Application for Emergency Medical Services Certification (DOH-4245, DOH-65)
Permit Description: Identifies the bearer as having successfully completed the training program and passed the state practical and written examinations for emergency medical services practitioner who is responsible for the administration of initial life saving care of sick and injured persons. To obtain certification, applicant must demonstrate competency in assessment of a patient, use Basic Life Support equipment and techniques within their scope of practice. Must be able to perform CPR, control bleeding, provide non- invasive treatment of hypoperfusion, manage environmental emergencies and provide initial care in medical trauma emergencies and emergency childbirth.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA) Operating Certificate (DOH-155)
Permit Description: A certified home health agency is a home care services agency which possess a valid certificate of approval and is pursuant to Article 36 of the NYS Public Health Law or it can be a residential health care facility or hospital and is authorized to provide a long term home health care program. The agency needs to provide a minimum of the following services which are of preventive, therapeutic, rehabilitative, health guidance and/or supportive nature to persons at home: nursing services, home health aide services, medical supplies, equipment and appliances suitable for use in the home; and has at least one additional service which may be physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech pathology, nutritional services and medical social services. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Application for Registration as a Chain Store (CG-80)
Permit Description:
If you register your business as a chain store, you are permitted by law to purchase cigarettes at the chain store price, which is less than that normally paid by retailers.
 
Your business must be one of the following to register as a chain store: cooperative member, franchisee, vending machine operator, large volume outlet operator, or business with 15 or more retail outlets.

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a charitable, religious, civic or educational organization to sell alcoholic beverages, at auction or otherwise. Such permit is valid for a 24 hour period commencing at 8:00 a.m. and only during the hours when such alcoholic beverages may lawfully be sold by retail licensees in the county in which the auction or sale is held. Permit Description: Charitable organizations in New York must register with the Office of the Attorney General if it holds property or does business in New York for charitable purposes; or whenever they solicit or receive contributions in excess of $25,000 annually; or they pay anyone, other than an employee of the charity, for fund raising functions, regardless of the amount of contributions solicited or received. NOTE: Contributions include grants or other financial assistance from any agency of government. Allocations from a united way, incorporated community appeal or federated fund should not be counted when determining the $25,000 limit. Certain organizations are exempt from registration and can be found in NYS Executive Law, Section 172-a.

Permit Description: License required to engage in the business of check cashing. A check casher is a person or entity whose primary business is the cashing of checks, drafts or money orders for a fee. A Check Casher license is not required when a person or entity cashes checks, drafts or money orders for free, or when the person or entity cashes checks, drafts or money orders as an incident to the conduct of another lawful business (e.g. a store) and not more than $1.00 is charged. New York State strictly regulates the check cashing industry, from setting limits on the amount that can be charged for cashing a check to regulating how close together facilities can be located. The principals and employees of the check cashing business must be registered with the Department of Financial Services and fingerprinted.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the holder to operate a chemical dependence treatment or prevention services program.  Chemical dependence services are defined as the examination, diagnosis, level of care determination, treatment, rehabilitation or habilitation of persons suffering from chemical abuse or dependence and their significant others, and includes the provision of alcoholism and/or substance abuse services. Education regarding the effects of alcohol and substances on significant others may also be provided to such persons as a component of chemical dependence services.  Chemical dependency or chemical dependence is a general term used to refer to one or more of the following more specific terms: alcoholism, alcohol abuse, alcohol dependence, substance abuse, substance dependence. Chemical dependence includes conditions clinically referred to as substance use disorders and alcohol or substance-related organic mental disorders, and is often used to refer to the condition of an individual who abuses or is dependent on alcohol and also one or more substances.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Permit to Operate a Children's Overnight, Summer Day Camp or Traveling Summer Day Camp (DOH-2040, DOH-2271, DOH-367, DOH-367a, DOH-3915, LDSS-3370)
Permit Description: Permit grants permission to operate a children's camp as required by the Public Health Law and by the State Sanitary Code. Exemptions include: camps with less than 10 children; overnight camps operating less than 72 consecutive hours; day camps operating less than all or part of five days in any two week period; day camps operating between September 16 and May 14 of the following year; activities at unscheduled or drop in neighborhood settings; single purpose activities and day care centers licensed under the New York State Office of Children and Family Services. A separate permit shall not be required for a bathing beach, swimming pool or food service operated as part of a children's camp for which a permit is required.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: Application for License as a New York State Cigarette Agent or Agent/Wholesaler (CG-100-A)
Permit Description:
If you wish to purchase and affix adhesive or meter NYS cigarette tax stamps on packages of cigarettes, you must be licensed as a cigarette agent. If you wish to sell to retail dealers and other persons for the purpose of resale, you must be licensed as a wholesaler dealer of cigarettes.

You can use Form CG-100-A, Application for License as a New York State Cigarette Agent or Agent/Wholesaler, to apply for license as a cigarette agent; or to apply for both a cigarette agent license and wholesale dealer of cigarettes license.

If you wish to be a cigarette agent or wholesale dealer in New York City, you will need to obtain additional licenses with the New York City Department of Finance.

Resources:
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale,Tax Information

Permit Name: Application for Registration of Retail Dealers and Vending Machines for Sales of Cigarettes and Tobacco Products
Permit Description:
A Retail Registration Certificate allows the sale of cigarettes and/or tobacco products for retail ONLY made over the counter at a specific location or from a cart, truck, stand, or other merchandising device. Each location needs separate registrations.

A Vending Machine Registration Certificate authorizes an owner or operator of vending machine(s) to sell cigarettes and/or tobacco products through said vending machine(s).
Each vending machine must be registered. If the owner is the operator, the owner registers the machines, otherwise, the operator registers them.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows a facility to accept specimens for the microbiological, immunological, chemical, hematological, biophysical, cytological, pathological, genetic, or other examination of materials derived from the human body, for the purpose of obtaining information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease; the assessment of a health condition; or for identification purposes. Such examinations shall include procedures to determine, measure, or otherwise describe the presence or absence of various substances, components or organisms in the human body. This means that any facility issuing patient-identified results, including facilities performing research, clinical trials, insurance testing, forensic toxicology or forensic/paternity identity testing, excluding some exceptions, must hold a permit as a Clinical Laboratory. All clinical laboratories that accept clinical specimens obtained in New York State must hold a New York State Clinical Laboratory Permit. A clinical laboratory may operate one or more collecting or transfer stations with prior written approval from the NYS Department of Health.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Clinical Laboratory Director or Assistant Director Certificate of Qualification (DOH-238)
Permit Description: A certificate authorizes the holder to perform or direct one or more procedures or one or more categories of such procedures. Areas of testing include, but are not limited to, microbiology, immunology, chemistry, hematology, biophysics, cytology, pathology, genetics and blood banking. Certifies that person is responsible for the administration of the technical and scientific operation of a clinical laboratory located in or accepting specimens from New York State or in a blood bank located in or collecting, processing, storing or distributing blood products in New York State. The clinical laboratory director is responsible for the performance of all tests carried out in the laboratory, adherence to the NYS Department of Health's quality assurance standards for such tests, and accurate reporting of the test results. A director must hold a Certificate of Qualification before an initial clinical laboratory and/or blood bank permit may be processed and issued.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: To protect and preserve the natural protective features such as dunes and bluffs of coastal areas limit erosion and ensure that erosion control structures are properly constructed. Must apply for permit if you are planning on construction, modifications, restoration of structures; grading mining, dredging and deposition of bulkheads, revetment, and groins; along with other miscellaneous activities. Exempt from this permit are: normal maintenance of structures; beach grooming and cleaning; vegetative plantings; open work docks (with 200 square feet or less of deck area); sand fencing; restoration of existing structures damaged or destroyed by events not related to coastal flooding and erosion; private walkways; seasonal docks on floats.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Description: The registration allows a person to hold in any facility within New York State any feed or commercial feed manufactured in or outside of New York State for sale or distribution. The registration allows a person to distribute in New York any pet food or specialty pet brand/product that has been registered. The facility operation must maintain compliance with the laws and regulations regarding product labeling and adulteration. Any person who distributes in New York State any feed ingredient or commercial feed, except a pet food or specialty pet food, shall pay an annual tonnage fee per each ingredient or feed distributed. Persons distributing less than 100 total tons per year are exempt from payment. New York State licensed feed manufacturers are not required to hold a commercial feed registration for distribution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: A license is required to distribute in New York State any type of commercial or specialty fertilizer by the person whose labeling is applied to such fertilizer. This includes manufacturing plants, blending plants and bulk storage facilities. Commercial fertilizer is any substances containing one or more recognized plant nutrients which is used for its plant nutrient content and is designed for use or claimed to have value in promoting plant growth. Specialty fertilizers are commercial fertilizer distributed primarily for non-farm use, such as home gardens and lawns, shrubbery, flowers, golf courses, municipal parks, and cemeteries. Commercial fertilizer must have placed on or affixed to the container a label with the net weight of the contents of the package; the brand and grade under which it is sold, and the name, street address of the principal office of licensee, distributor or person responsible for placing the commodity on the market. Every calendar year, distributors of commercial fertilizer must report on a semi-annual basis a tonnage of each grade of commercial fertilizer sold in New York State to persons not required to be licensed under this Article and pay an annual tonnage fee of at least $50.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description:
One Stop Credentialing And Registration (OSCAR): 

One Stop Credentialing And Registration (OSCAR) is a website that allows carriers to interact with several New York State agencies involved in regulating motor carrier activities.   It allows the industry a single point of contact to apply, change, pay for, and receive the operating credentials for Highway Use Tax (HUT), International Fuel Tax Agreement (IFTA), and International Registration Plan (IRP).  These credentials are administered by 3 state agencies:  the Department of Motor Vehicles (IRP), the Department of Taxation and Finance (IFTA and HUT) and the Department of Transportation.  The following functions can be performed through OSCAR:  add a vehicle to an IRP fleet; transfer license plates; transfer vehicles within an IRP fleet; obtain a HUT certificate; and obtain IFTA decals.  To use OSCAR, you must be a motor carrier who is currently registered in New York for IRP, IFTA, or HUT.  You must also have a USDOT number and a NYS Tax ID number.   For more information on the One Stop Credentialing And Registration (OSCAR), visit the link below.  

International Registration Plan (IRP):

The International Registration Plan (IRP) is a registration agreement between all U.S. states (with the exception of Alaska and Hawaii), the District of Columbia, and the Canadian provinces of Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Prince Edward Island, Quebec and Saskatchewan.  IRP is an optional program for licensing commercial vehicles traveling in two or more IRP jurisdictions. The registration fees for commercial vehicles are paid to one jurisdiction and then are apportioned among all the jurisdictions in which the vehicle is used based on the number of miles traveled in each jurisdiction.

All commercial vehicles weighing over 26,000 pounds (gross weight) or having 3 or more axles (regardless of weight) are eligible to register in IRP.  Under IRP, an interstate carrier files an application with the jurisdiction in which it is based.  The IRP agreement allows the base jurisdiction to collect the registration fees for the other IRP jurisdictions the carrier requests on the application form.  The base jurisdiction issues a set of plates and a cab card for each vehicle.  The cab card lists all the IRP jurisdictions and corresponding weights that the carrier requests.

All transactions involving IRP registrations must be processed in the IRP office either by mail or in person or through the OSCAR website.  For more information on the International Registration Plan (IRP), call the NYS Department of Motor Vehicles or here are their business and customer service locations:

Business Address:
NYS Department of Motor Vehicles
International Registration Bureau
6 Empire State Plaza 
Room 136 
Albany, NY  12228

Customer Service Counter:
Swan Street Building - ESP
Core 3 - Room 136
Albany, NY

NYS Transportation Federation:

The NYS Transportation Federation was established to more closely coordinate the activities of New York State's transportation agencies and authorities to create a seamless statewide transportation system to move people and goods more efficiently through New York State.  The Federation is comprised of the NYS Department of Transportation, the NYS Thruway Authority and the NYS Bridge Authority.  Currently the Federation's permits website (linked below) provides customers with useful information to simplify the permitting process with the three agencies.   

NYS Bridge Authority:
 
The NYS Bridge Authority issues permits for certain commercial vehicles to travel on five bridges (Bear Mountain, Kingston-Rhinecliff, Mid-Hudson, Newburgh-Beacon, and Rip Van Winkle) located in New York. Commercial vehicles exceeding axle and wheel weight limits are required to obtain a NYS Bridge Authority Permit in order to cross.    Operators should contact the facility to be used to assure that the desired crossing will be permitted.  Vehicles t

Permit Name: Application by Tenants to Make a Survey and Proposed Conversion (CPS3 Form)
Permit Description: Grants the opportunity to tenants to make a preliminary survey of the feasibility of purchasing residences from owners in arms length transactions, as well as for the purpose of preventing undue harassment by one group of tenants practiced on another, or by owners of buildings or selling agents seeking to act under subterfuge of so-called "tenant-sponsored" plans. A resident application in tenant sponsored plans to convert occupied premises. A permit that exempts tenants from the requirement of filing an offering plan where they are the sponsors of the plan. This is also applicable for condominiums.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Permit to Exempt Sponsors From Filing Amendments (CPS5 Form)
Permit Description: A permit that exempts sponsors of offering plans who own less than ten percent of the units in a building or development from the requirement of filing annual amendments to the offering plan, provided that they are current in all their obligations and are financially solvent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Permit for Exemption From Amending Offering Form (CPS6 Form)
Permit Description: A permit that exempts cooperatives, condominiums and homeowners associations which have taken ownership of unsold units after a sponsor default from the requirement of amending the offering plan. It is a policy with regard to cooperative corporations and condominium associations which take title to shares or units for failure to pay maintenance or common charges.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Simplified Procedure for Homeowners Associations with a De Minimis Cooperative Interest (CPS7 Form)
Permit Description: A permit that exempts sponsors from the requirement of filing an offering plan for homeowners associations with a de minimis cooperative interest. A de minimis cooperative interest is a development which owns or maintains property with no major improvements or recreational facilities. The number of homes or lots in the development is not relevant to this status. Such developments include amenities limited to: open space including landscaped areas; private roads and/or driveways and parking spaces; private sewers or sewer systems (but excluding sewage treatment plants; private water distribution line by excluding water treatment facilities; statues, gates, monuments, walls, fences, ponds, drainage areas, etc.; private walkways; street lighting; recreational facilities such as basketball courts or playgrounds which require no or minimal maintenance; and utility lines. This treatment is not available to condominiums, cooperatives, time share developments, or other cooperative interests in realty.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: In order to terminate a corporation's existence, it must file a plan of dissolution with the court. The corporation notifies the NYS Department of Financial Services via a letter of its intent to dissolve. During the process, the court will ask the NYS Department of Financial Services if it has any objections to the corporation's dissolution.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows a corporate licensee to make corporate changes involving officers or directors, changes involving 10 percent or more of stock, or increase in stockholdings of any one stockholder to 10 percent or more of stock. Allows replacement of license, changes in premises or location, and to allow sales when business form is changed by legal means.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description:
A foreign business corporation may apply for authority to do business in New York by filing an Application for Authority pursuant to Section 1304 of the NYS Business Corporation Law with the NYS Department of State. The NYS Department of State does not give opinions as to what activities constitute doing business in New York for qualification purposes. You may wish to review a Legal Memorandum entitled "Doing Business" in New York: An Introduction to Qualification available on the Department of State's website for further clarification. In conjunction with this responsibility, the Secretary of State serves a statutory agent for corporations against whom process may be served.

STEPS IN FILING AN APPLICATION FOR AUTHORITY: 

An Application for Authority must be filed with the Department of State. A Certificate of Existence, Certificate of Good Standing or Certificate of Status must be included with the Application for Authority. You can obtain one of these certificates from the official who files and maintains corporate records in the jurisdiction of incorporation of the corporation. This official is generally the Secretary of State.

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the name of the corporation is not already in use by an existing corporation, limited liability company or limited partnership, you should request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00.

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an "Application for Reservation of Name." The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach the Certificate of Reservation to your Application for Authority when filing. The fee for reservation of name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Permission to Open a Credit Union Station (CU)
Permit Description: When authorized by the Superintendent, a credit union may open and maintain within or without the state, in any locality in which a substantial portion of its actual potential membership is employed or residing, one or more stations for the conduct of its business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description:
The NYS Department of State files certificates of incorporation pursuant to Section 402 of the NYS Business Corporation Law. In conjunction with this responsibility, the Secretary of State serves as statutory agent for corporations against whom process may be served.

STEPS IN FILING A CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION: 

One or more persons, called "incorporators" may form a corporation. Incorporators are natural persons who are 18 or older. The incorporator(s) signs the Certificate of Incorporation. The completed Certificate of Incorporation is filed with the Department of State.

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the name of the corporation is not already in use by an existing corporation, limited liability company or limited partnership, you may request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an "Application for Reservation of Name". The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach the Certificate of Reservation to your Certificate of Incorporation when filing. The fee for reservation of name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Description: Allows an individual to perform the services of nail specialty, natural hair styling, waxing and esthetics, and includes providing services to the hair, head, face, neck or scalp of a human being, including but not limited to shaving, trimming, and cutting the hair or beard either by hand or mechanical appliances and the application of antiseptics, powders, oil, clays, lotions or applying tonics to the hair, head, or scalp, and in addition includes providing, for a fee or any consideration of exchange, whether direct or indirect, services for the application of applying dyes, reactive chemicals and other preparations to alter the color, straighten, curl or alter the structure of the hair of a human being.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Permit allows the holder to take, land, and sell more than 50 crabs from waters of Raritan Bay and Lower Bay for commercial purposes.

Permit Name: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)Initial Application (PDS C-14)
Permit Description: Application certifies an individual who provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in an approved work setting. Work experience includes diagnostic assessment; evaluation; intervention; referral; and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. Certification allows for the practice of the profession of alcoholism and substance abuse counseling as a credentialed substance abuse counselor in New York. The title CASAC may not be used to engage in private practice unless otherwise authorized by law.

Permit Description: Application certifies an individual who provides alcohol and substance abuse prevention services in an approved work setting. Work experience includes comprehensive, multi-dimensional prevention services approach which includes the following five performance domains: planning and evaluation; education and skill development; community organization; public and organizational policy; and professional growth and responsibility. Certification allows for the practice of the credentialed prevention professional in New York. The title CPP many not be used to engage in private practice unless otherwise authorized by law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Application certifies an individual who provides alcohol and substance abuse prevention services in an approved work setting. Work experience includes comprehensive, multi-dimensional prevention services approach which includes the following five performance domains: planning and evaluation; education and skill development; community organization; public and organizational policy; and professional growth and responsibility. Certification allows for the practice of the credentialed prevention specialist in New York. The title CPS many not be used to engage in private practice unless otherwise authorized by law.

Work experience includes diagnostic assessment; evaluation; intervention; referral; and problem gambling counseling in both individual and group settings. Certification allows for the practice of the profession of gambling counseling as a credentialed problem gambling counselor in New York. The title CPGC many not be used to engage in private practice unless otherwise authorized by law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description:
A deposit initiator is the first bottler, distributor, dealer or agent to collect the refund value (deposit) on a beverage container sold in New York that contains carbonated soft drinks, beer and other malt beverages, mineral water, soda water, wine coolers, and water. 

You are a deposit initiator if you:
• bottle beverages in beverage containers with an established deposit; 
• distribute beverages in beverage containers with an established deposit and do not purchase the containers from a registered deposit initiator; 
• sell beverages in beverage containers and do not purchase the containers from a registered deposit initiator; or 
• act as an agent on behalf of a registered deposit initiator. 

A deposit initiator must register prior to collecting deposits on any beverage container with a refund value and must establish a refund value account.

Permit Description: Allows the permittee to take any migratory birds (such as Canada geese and gulls) at any time whenever it becomes a nuisance, destructive to public or private property, or a threat to public health or welfare. The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service must issue a permit prior to the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation granting a permit.

Permit Name: Operating Certificate for a Diagnostic and Treatment Center
Permit Description: A diagnostic and treatment center provides a comprehensive range of primary health care services. This includes part-time clinics which provides ambulatory care programs that operate less than 60 hours per month and are affiliated with a diagnostic and treatment center or general hospital. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of the operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.

Permit Name: Application for Registration as a Distributor of Alcoholic Beverages (TP-215)
Permit Description: Registration is required if you import (or cause to be imported) beer into New York State for sale or to be used for any commercial purpose; purchase warehouse receipts for beer stored in a bonded warehouse located in New York State, then remove the beer from the warehouse;  produce, distill, manufacturer, brew, compound, mix, or ferment beer in New York State for sale; or import (or cause to be imported) beer into New York City for sale or commercial use (sales in New York City include sales to purchasers whose licensed premises are located within New York City, and sales for delivery to purchasers located within the city).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Tax Information

Permit Name: Application for Registration as a Distributor of Alcoholic Beverages (TP-215)
Permit Description: Registration is required if you import (or cause to be imported) wine into New York State for sale or to be used for any commercial purpose; import (or cause to be imported) liquors into New York State for sale or use for any purpose; purchase warehouse receipts for liquors or wine stored in a bonded warehouse located in New York State, then remove the liquors or wine from the warehouse; produce, distill, manufacture, mix, compound or ferment liquors or wine in New York State for sale; are an out of state wine manufacturer and have obtained a direct shipper's license from the State Liquor Authority (SLA) to make direct shipments of wine to New York consumers from your out-of-state locations(s); or import (or cause to be imported) liquor or wine (containing more than 24% alcohol by volume) into New York City for sale or use for any purpose.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Tax Information

Permit Description:
There are four types of motor fuel registrations:
• distributor of motor fuel, 
• retail seller of aviation gasoline,
• liquefied petroleum gas fuel permittee, and
• Metropolitan Commuter Transportation District (MCTD) motor fuel wholesaler.

Distributors of motor fuel: 

You must apply for registration as a distributor of motor fuel if:
• you import (or cause to be imported ) any motor fuel (for example, gasoline, fuel grade ethanol) into New York State (NYS) for use, distribution, storage, or sale within the state; or
• you produce, refine, manufacture, or compound motor fuel within the state.

Retail seller of aviation gasoline:

You may apply for registration as a retail seller of aviation gasoline if:
•             you are a fixed‑base operator in NYS; and
•             your sales of aviation gasoline are delivered directly into the fuel tank of an airplane for use in its operation.

Liquefied petroleum gas fuel permittee:

You must register as a liquefied petroleum gas fuel permittee if:
•            you import, manufacture, or sell any liquefied petroleum gases, such as propane, ethane, or butane, identified as fuel for use in the operation of a motor vehicle or recreational boat; or
•            you fuel such a vehicle or boat in NYS.

Metropolitan Commuter Transportation District (MCTD)
motor fuel wholesaler:

You must apply for registration as an MCTD motor fuel wholesaler if:
• you make purchases of motor fuel within the MCTD for resale; or
• you make sales (other than retail sales not in bulk) of motor fuel
  within the MCTD.

This registration requirement does not apply to any business that:
• is (or is required to be) registered as a distributor of motor fuel;
• makes only retail sales of motor fuel delivered directly into a motor vehicle for use in operating the vehicle;
• does not make purchases or sales of motor fuel within the MCTD; or
• does not make any sales of motor fuel in NYS.

The MCTD is divided into two regions:

Region 1 – New York City (Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), New York (Manhattan), Richmond (Staten Island) and Queens counties), Dutchess County, Orange County, Putnam County, Rockland County, and Westchester County.

Region 2 – Nassau County and Suffolk County.

Resources:
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Name: Application for a License as a Wholesale Dealer of Tobacco Products or an Appointment as a Distributor of Tobacco Products (MT-202)
Permit Description:
You must apply for a wholesale dealer of tobacco products license to sell tobacco products, other than cigarettes, to retail dealers or others for resale. 

You must request an appointment as a distributor of tobacco products to:
• import or manufacture tobacco products, other than cigarettes, in New York State; or
• if you are located outside of New York State, file returns and pay the tax due on tobacco products you sell, ship, or deliver from outside the state to any person in New York State. 

“Tobacco products” means cigars, little cigars, or tobacco, other than cigarettes, intended for consumption by smoking, chewing, or as snuff.

Permit Description: Permit allows a private or commercial boat owner to use the Canal Corporation dry-dock for boat repairs or winter boat storage (space permitting).

Permit Description: A "divisible load" is any vehicle or combination of vehicles transporting cargo of legal dimensions that can be separated into units of legal weight without affecting the physical integrity of the load. Examples of divisible loads include: aggregate (sand, top soil, gravel, stone), logs, scrap metal, fuel, milk, trash/refuse/garbage, etc. A permit allows a New York state base plated or New York IRP apportioned vehicle to exceed the weight limits allowed by the New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law.

Permit Name: Domestic Game Bird Breeder License - Class A  (82-19-41-10)
Permit Description: Issuance of a domestic game bird breeder license to an owner or lessee of wholly enclosed lands or an entire island. This license permits the purchase, possession, and propagation of captive bred domestic game birds, providing the applicant has facilities for propagating on the licensed premises. A Class A Breeder may purchase, possess, propagate, transport, and sell domestic game birds dead or alive and their eggs. Domestic game bird means captive bred ducks, geese, brant, swans, pheasants, quail, wild turkey, ruffed grouse, Chukar partridge, and Hungarian or European gray-legged partridge.

Permit Description: Allows a person owning, leasing, operating or maintaining a dam holding back water which is known to be inhabited by fish to drawdown the water. Exempt from this permit are: the federal government or any agency or subdivision; any hydropower project licensed by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission; in the event of an emergency (such as fire, flood, storm, drought,) drawdown for public safety or public health; any artificial or man-made body of water lying wholly within the boundaries of privately owned or leased lands and operated as a farm pond, licensed farm fish pond, licensed fishing preserve water or license private trout or bass hatchery; or any city having a population of one million or more.

Permit Description: This is an approval process, not a permit. The process does not apply to business. Only five such districts have been created, the last in 1942.

Such package shall not be opened after the sale or its contents consumed on the premises where sold.  A copy of the permittee's  NYS Pharmacy License must be provided.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: "Durable Juvenile Products" means products intended for use, or that may be reasonably expected to be used, by children under the age of 5 years including products listed on the Durable Juvenile Product Manufacturers application such as cribs, strollers, walkers, etc. All Manufacturers of Durable Juvenile Products that are distributed, sold or made available in New York must be registered with the Department of State. The affected and defined entities include retailers, operators of websites that act as a platform to facilitate competitive bidding between third parties for the sale or resale of such products, secondhand dealers and commercial dealers which include manufacturers, remanufacturers and retrofitters, importer or wholesalers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Education and Training Provider Certification Application (PDS-17.1, PDS-17.2, PDS-17.3, PDS-17.4, PDS-17.5, PDS-6)
Permit Description: Certification allows an entity (accredited colleges and universities, governmental agencies, professional organizations, training institutes, in-service training programs, qualified trainers, distance learning providers and special events/conference sponsors) to offer course work/training to ensure the qualifications of instructors and the training curricula is in compliance with NYS Regulations, Part 853. Only course work/training submitted to, and approved by NYS OASAS may be identified and promoted by an Education and Training Provider through its OASAS Education and Training Provider Certificate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Election by a Federal S Corporation to be Treated as a New York S Corporation (CT-6)
Permit Description:
A corporation may elect to be an S corporation only if it meets certain IRS requirements. Treatment as an S corporation allows a corporation to avoid double taxation (once to the shareholders and again to the corporation). An S corporation generally is exempt from federal income tax. The S corporation's shareholders include on their tax returns their share of the corporation's separately stated items of income, deduction, loss, and credit and their share of nonseparately stated income or loss. 

NYS Tax Law, Article 22, Section 660, authorizes the shareholders of a federal S corporation, which is subject to tax under Article 9-A, to unanimously elect for the S corporation to be treated as a New York S Corporation. New York State does not automatically treat a federal S corporation as a New York S corporation unless the S corporation is mandated to file as a New York S corporation under Tax Law section 660(i). Therefore, unless the S corporation is a mandated New York S corporation, the S corporation needs to qualify to make the election and file Form CT-6, Election by a Federal S Corporation to be Treated as a New York S Corporation. 

By making the election, shareholders of a New York S corporation consent to pay New York State personal income tax on income earned by the corporation. Additionally, the New York S corporation is required to pay the fixed dollar minimum tax based on New York receipts, under Article 9-A.
Permit Categories: Tax Information

Permit Name: Electric and Gas Transmission Facilities Certificate of Environmental Compatibility and Public Need
Permit Description: Article 7 of the NYS Public Service Law requires a Certificate for the construction and operation of major gas and electric transmission facilities. Certificates are issued when it is determined that the construction and operation of the new transmission facility will fulfill public needs and be compatible with environmental values and the public health and safety, and comply with legal requirements. Major electric transmission facilities are lines with a design capacity of 100 kV or more extending for at least 10 miles or 125 kV and over, extending a distance of one mile or more. Major natural fuel gas transmission facilities are pipelines extending a distance of at least 1,000 feet and operated at pressures of 123 psig or more with some exceptions.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Electric Generating Facility Certificate of Environmental Compatibility and Public Need
Permit Description: Article 10 of the NYS Public Service Law requires a Certificate of Environmental Compatibility and Public Need for construction and operation of a major electric generating facility with the capacity of 80 megawatts or more. The Certificate is issued by the NY State Board on Electric Generation Siting and the Environment. This Board is within the Department of Public Service. (Article 10 expired on 1/1/03. After that date, electric generating project developers must obtain all appropriate local and state permits and approvals and undergo environmental review subject to the State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQR). Project developers may also be required to obtain a Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity (CPCN), pursuant to Section 68 of the Public Service Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Establishment of an Electronic Facility (ATM) by a Bank/Trust Company
Permit Description: Permission for a bank or trust company to establish an electronic facility. Electronic Facility means a point of sale terminal, auto teller machine or similar facility at which banking business may be conducted. The purpose is to ensure CRA and location requirements are met.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Establishment of an Electronic Facility (ATM) by a Credit Union
Permit Description: Processing of a proposal from a credit union to establish an electronic facility. The purpose is to ensure that a deposit-taking facility would not be located in a home office protected area.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Establishment of an Electric Facility (ATM) by a Savings Bank
Permit Description: Processing of a proposal from a savings bank to establish an electronic facility. The purpose is to ensure that the institution has a satisfactory or better CRA rating and that a deposit-taking facility would not be located in a home office protected area.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Establishment of an Electronic Facility (ATM) by a Savings & Loan Association
Permit Description: Processing of a proposal from a savings and loan association to establish an electronic facility. The purpose is to ensure that the institution has a satisfactory or better CRA rating and that a deposit-taking facility would not be located in a home office protected area.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Sell Ivory Products (Elephant, Mammoth, or Rhinoceros Horn)
Permit Description: Allows the licensee to sell or possess with the intent to sell products made from African Elephant or Asian Elephant. Only articles of African elephant ivory which were lawfully imported into the United State may be sold or processed with the intent to sell in New York. Only articles of Asian elephant ivory which may, under Federal law/regulations, be lawfully imported into the United States or sold in interstate commerce may be sold or possessed with the intent to sell in New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Exemption from Deposit Insurance for Commercial Banks and Trust Companies
Permit Description: This permit allows certain institutions to be exempt from the requirements of deposit insurance. It's purpose is to ensure that the applicant is not a deposit-taking institution. Applies to commercial banks and trust companies.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Certification as a Motor Vehicle Inspector (VS-120)
Permit Description: To allow qualified individuals to conduct inspections of motor vehicles to promote highway safety and clean air.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Emergency Medical Services Certification - Basic (DOH-65, DOH-4245)
Permit Description: Identifies the bearer as having successfully completed the training and passed the state practical and written examinations for emergency medical services practitioner. Bearer is responsible for administration or supervision of initial emergency care and transportation of sick or injured persons. To obtain certification, applicant must demonstrate competency in assessment of a patient, handling emergencies using Basic Life Support equipment and techniques. Must be able to perform CPR, control bleeding, provide non- invasive treatment of hypoperfusion, stabilize / immobilize injured bones and the spine, manage environmental emergencies and emergency childbirth. Must be able to use a semi-automatic defibrillator. Must be able to assist patients with self-administration or administer emergency medications as described in state and local protocol.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration for Emergency Medical Technicians' Exam - Critical Care (DOH-65, DOH-4245)
Permit Description: Identifies the bearer as having successfully completed the training program and passed the state practical and written examinations for emergency medical services practitioner. Bearer is responsible for administration or supervision of initial emergency care and transportation of sick or injured persons. To obtain certification, applicant must demonstrate competency in all EMT-Basic skills and equipment usage. Must be able to provide Advanced Life Support using the AEMT-Intermediate skills and equipment. Must be able to administer appropriate medications. To qualify for initial certification, applicant must have current certification as an EMT at the time of the written certification examination.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration For Emergency Medical Technicians' Exam - Intermediate (DOH-65, DOH-4245
Permit Description: Identifies the bearer as having successfully completed the training program and passed the state practical and written examinations for emergency medical services practitioner. Bearer is responsible for administration or supervision of initial emergency care and transportation of sick or injured persons. To obtain certification, applicant must demonstrate competency in all EMT-Basic skills and equipment usage. Must be able to provide Advanced Life Support using intravenous therapy, defibrillator and advanced airway adjuncts to control the airway in cases of respiratory and cardiac arrest. To qualify for initial certification, applicant must have current certification as an EMT at the time of the written certification examination.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration For Emergency Medical Technicians' Exam - Paramedic (DOH-65, DOH-4245)
Permit Description: Identifies the bearer as having successfully completed the training program and passed the state practical and written examinations for emergency medical services practitioner. Bearer is responsible for administration or supervision of initial emergency care and transportation of sick or injured persons. To obtain certification, applicant must be capable of utilizing all EMT-Basic and AEMT-Intermediate skills and equipment. Must be able to perform under Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Basic Trauma Life Support (BTLS) standards. Must be knowledgeable and competent in the use of a cardiac monitor/defibrillator and intravenous drugs and fluids. The EMT-Paramedic is the highest level of pre-hospital care certification. To qualify for initial certification, applicant must have current certification as an EMT at the time of the written certification examination.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certificate of Eligibility to Employ Child Performers (LS-550)
Permit Description: Any entity that employs any person under the age of 18 who renders creative or artistic services in New York as a performer and does one or more of the following: pays a fee either directly or through a third party provider, has "control" over the child performer's worksite, or an entity used to pay performers such as payroll services must file a certificate of eligibility to employ child performers.  Creative or artistic services include: actor, actress, dancer, musician, comedian, singer, stunt-person, voice-over artist, runway or print model, performer or entertainer, a songwriter, musical producer or arranger, writer, director, producer, production executive, choreographer, composer, conductor, or designer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Pension plans of commercial private employers are regulated pursuant to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA) as an employee pension benefit plan. The Insurance Department's oversight over pension plans, in general, only refers to examination and financial analysis.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Application for exemption from filing requirements based on the fact that the offering is for bonds issued by a governmental agency.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: Allows for the establishment of any trust fund or other fund established or maintained jointly by one or more employers together with one or more labor organizations, whether directly or through trustees, to provide employee benefits by the purchase of insurance or annuity contracts or otherwise, and to which is paid or contracted to be paid anything, other than income from investments of such fund for the benefit of employees employed in this state, and, if the principal office of the employer is located outside of the state, for at least twenty such employees; provided, however, that such term shall not include any such fund where its over-all management is vested, alone or jointly with other trustees, in a corporate trustee which is subject to supervision by the superintendent of financial services of any state or is a member of the federal reserve system.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Exemption from Deposit Insurance for Institutions other than Commercial Banks and Trust Companies
Permit Description: This permit allows savings banks, savings and loan associations and credit unions, which do not receive deposits or share accounts from the general public, to be exempt from the requirements of deposit insurance. The purpose is to ensure that the applicant is not a deposit-taking institution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: An Employer Identification Number (EIN), also known as a federal tax identification number, identifies a business entity. Generally, all businesses need a federal tax identification number. An EIN is a nine-digit number that the Internal Revenue Service assigns to a business. The IRS uses the number to identify taxpayers that are required to file various business tax returns. Employers, sole proprietors, corporations, partnerships, nonprofit organizations, trusts, estates of decedents, government agencies, certain individuals and other business entities use EINs. It is against the law to use an EIN for anything other than business use or to use as a Social Security Number. You may not transfer your EIN if you sell or otherwise transfer your business. The new business owner and operator will need to apply for a new EIN.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Description: Allows qualified persons to operate an employment agency; the placing of employees for a fee. In New York City, this license is issued by the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: When none of the principals of an employment agency have the necessary two years experience in placement or related activities, they may hire someone with such experience to manage and direct the placement activities of the agency.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Endangered/Threatened Species License Application (ETSSCI, ETSP, ETSEE)
Permit Description: An endangered/threatened species license is required to import, transport, possess or sell any endangered or threatened species of fish, shellfish, crustacea or wild life or hides or other parts thereof. Such as ivory.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Sell Products of Endangered or Threatened Species (DES)
Permit Description: A permit is required for the sale of endangered or threatened species, including parts and products, manufactured prior to the Endangered Species Act of 1973, or otherwise legally obtained and possessed in New York. Articles or products made from endangered and threatened species of fish, shellfish, crustacea or wild life when articles were made before the animal was listed must provide substantive evidence related to the item(s) in question proves when the product(s) was manufactured, and from whom they were acquired.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: To allow replacement of license, changes in premises, or location, and allow sales when business form is changed by legal means. Change from sole proprietorship to corporation, decease of partner, dissolution of partnership executor, administrator, receiver, trustee, assignee, committee of incompetent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Required to sell natural gas and/or electricity to end users with in NYS. ESCO must also be certified by the Utility in whose territory they will participate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: English as a Second Language School Registry Agent Certificate (BPSS-123)
Permit Description: Allows a person to recruit students to attend English as a Second Language schools.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: English as a Second Language School Registry Certification (BPSS-121)
Permit Description: Allows a school to operate as an English as a Second Language school.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: English as a Second Language School Registry Director License (BPSS-122)
Permit Description: Allows a person to serve as a director of an English as a Second Language school.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Permission for a Bank/Trust Company to Make Excess Deposits
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank or trust company to deposit more than 100 percent of its capital stock surplus fund and undivided profits with another banking corporation. It's purpose is to ensure that the proposed deposit is in the best interest of the applicant.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Excess Line Broker's License (Entity) (EX-Entity.Orig, ProducerSupp Stmt)
Permit Description: A license authorizing an entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) to procure policies from insurers which are not authorized to transact business in New York state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for Licensure as an Assisted Living Residence (ALR), Enhanced ALR (EALR), or Special Needs ALR (SNALR) (DOH-4355)
Permit Description: Certification as an EALR allows an assisted living residence to admit and retain residents who exceed the retention standards of adult homes, enriched housing programs or assisted living residences. EALRs cannot admit residents in need of 24-hour skilled nursing care or medical care. However, EALRs may retain residents in need of 24-hour skilled nursing care or medical care if certain conditions are met. This certification will allow residents to age in place. EALRs may directly employ a registered professional or license practical nurse to provide nursing services and supervise the provision of care. EALRs are not required to have a nurse on staff and may provide skilled services via a home care services agency.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Article 20 of the NYS Agriculture and Markets Law provides for the licensing of commission merchants, dealers, net-return dealers, brokers or processors who buy or receive NY farm products from producers in excess of $10,000 annually to resell at wholesale. The purpose of the license is to prevent unfair trade practices and to provide financial protection to New York producers in marketing their farm products. A producer is any person who grows farm products or sells livestock within New York State. Farm products include all agricultural, horticultural, floricultural, and vegetable and fruit products of the soil, Christmas trees, livestock and meats, poultry, nuts, honey, maple tree sap and maple products produced therefrom, wool, hides, hay, straw and grains; but shall not include eggs, dairy products or timber products, except as listed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description:
An entertainment promoter includes any person who:
• directly or indirectly, owns or operates a facility or site where entertainment events are held, and 
• allows vendors to make sales of tangible personal property at an event; 
or
• directly or indirectly, rents, leases, or grants a vendor a license to use space at an entertainment event, or 
• has management responsibility with respect to those vendors making sales at such event.

Filing for an entertainment promoter certificate:
If sales of tangible personal property are going to be made at one or more entertainment events, the promoter must file Form DTF-728, Application for Entertainment Promoter Certificate, at least 20 days before the first entertainment event is held. The Tax Department will, within 10 days after receiving a properly completed Form DTF-728, send the entertainment promoter a validated Form DTF-729, Entertainment Promoter Certificate, if the application is approved.

An entertainment promoter only needs one certificate for all events held at the same location during the calendar year, and those events must be listed on the back of the permit. An entertainment promoter must file Form DTF-728 for each additional event held at a different location or for each event not listed on the original permit held by the promoter.

These requirements apply to entertainment promoters whether or not they charge admissions for the event, and whether or not any charges for admissions are taxable. If there is more than one entertainment promoter for any entertainment event, the requirement imposed on an entertainment promoter will be satisfied if any one promoter complies with the requirement.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Tax Information

Permit Name: Environmental Laboratory Application for Approval (DOH-107, DOH-108, DOH-109, DOH-1977, DOH-1977CA, DOH-1978, Form CLP, Form CLPLAB)
Permit Description: Certifies a commercial, non-commercial (self-monitoring) or government laboratory facility to analyze samples or specimens originating from New York State. This includes air, stack emissions, potable (drinking) and non-potable water, wastewater, surface water, ground water, recreational waters, swimming pools, leachate, land runoff, solid waste, hazardous waste, soil, sediments and vegetation, as well as any substance that could contribute to the pollution of, or that could be contaminated by, material contained in such samples or specimens. An environmental laboratory may request certification in one or more of the following analyses categories: radon, radiochemistry, asbestos and fibers, lead from non-human bodies, toxic characteristic leaching procedures (TCLP), and contract laboratory protocol (CLP). Environmental laboratories do not include non-laboratory chemical testing associated with residential water softeners and residential swimming pools. An environmental laboratory must be directed by an individual who is qualified through education and experience, perform satisfactorily in at least semi-annual proficiency testing and a biennial on-site inspection. Certificate indicates a laboratory is competent to analyze environmental samples of drinking water, non-potable water, solid and hazardous waste, air and emissions and can perform the Contract Laboratory Protocol (CLP).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: License allows an individual to perform services to enhance the appearance of the face, neck, arms, legs and shoulders of another by using compounds or procedures, including makeup, eyelashes, depilatories, tonics, lotions, waxes, sanding and tweezing. They may be performed by manual, mechanical, chemical or electrical means and instruments, but shall not include the practice of electro logy. Note: Make-over consultants (such as Mary Kay consultants) and applying make-up in a theatrical setting are exempt.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Registration of a Facility to Euthanize Animals (DOH-4333)
Permit Description: An authorization issued to animal control facilities, ASPCS, humane societies, or municipalities and the person designated as their agent to purchase, possess and dispense to certified personnel sodium pentobarbital for the euthanasia of dogs and cats.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Certification as Euthanasia Technician for Animals (DOH-4332, DOH-2165)
Permit Description: Permit regulates the manufacture, distribution, and use of controlled substances (drugs) and devices. The Certificate is issued to an individual (technician) to obtain a controlled substance for the purpose of euthanizing a dog or cat. The substance is obtained from a registered facility and its agent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Application to Liberate Fish or Wildlife (LFW)
Permit Description: Allows the permitee to remove fish or fish eggs from specified water for collection, transfer, and restocking for propagation purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Producer Application for Excess Line Broker's License (Individual) (EXINDOrig)
Permit Description: A license authorizing an individual to procure insurance policies from insurers which are not authorized to transact business in New York state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Exclusion of Expenses Specifically Mentioned in the Statutes
Permit Description: This permit gives the Superintendent the authority to allow a bank to exclude certain expenses when calculating net profit. The purpose is to ensure that the proposed exclusion is in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description:
NYS Workers' Compensation Law requires that a business produce proof of workers' compensation and/or disability and paid family leave benefits coverage to a state or municipal agency when it seeks to obtain a license, permit or contract.  If the business is NOT required to carry workers' compensation and/or disability and paid family leave benefits insurance, the business can request from the Workers' Compensation Board an attestation of exemption stating that it does not require coverage. The business presents this affidavit to the state or municipal agency as part of the permit process.

There are limited situations where businesses are exempt from providing workers' compensation and/or disability and paid family leave benefits coverage. The most common situations are: the business is owned by one individual with no employees and is not a corporation; the business is a partnership under New York laws, and there are no employees; or the business is a one or two person owned corporation, with those individuals owning all of the stock and holding all offices of the corporation, and there are NO employees.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Name: License to Purchase, Own and/or Transport Explosives (not valid in New York City)  SH-850, SH-851, SH-51, GO 1)
Permit Description: To own, posses, transport and buy explosives. Not required in the City of New York. Not required to own, posses, transport or use smokeless powder or black powder in quantities not exceeding 5 lbs. for use in firing antique firearms or artifacts or replicas thereof.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Permit allows holder of a valid explosives license to apply for a permit for the storage of explosives. The purpose of application is to identify the type and quantity of explosives to be stored, and location of the storage site so that an on-site inspection can be performed. The permit is required to protect the public from illegal or unsafe storage of explosives. This is not required in New York City. This is not required for smokeless powder dealer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: License to Deal in or Manufacture Explosives (SH-860, SH-861, SH-51, GO 1, ID-5 DOL)
