Permit Description: Allows a person to sell, manufacture and transport explosives. This license is not valid in New York City.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Plan Approval of a Factory Manufactured Building (DOS 1280)
Permit Description: Insignia of Approval means the certificate, tab or tag issued by the NYS Division of Codes on behalf of the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council to indicate compliance with the standards, rules and regulations for factory-manufactured homes. Approval of a plan shall be obtained from the NYS Division of Codes for each model of factory-manufactured home and component. Factory-Manufactured Home (commonly referred to as "Modular Home") means a structure designed primarily for residential occupancy, constructed by a method or system of construction whereby the structure or its components are wholly or in substantial part manufactured in manufacturing facilities, intended or designed for permanent installation, or assembly and permanent installation, on a building site.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Description: Permits the operation of a family care home, which is a combination of a private residence with a certified family care provider to care for persons with developmental disabilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Operating Certificate Application (Family Care Home) (100 BUS)
Permit Description: People proposing to operate a family care home for persons with mental illness must submit an application to the Office of Mental Health for its review and approval prior to providing services.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: New York State Family Day Care Initial Application (Rev. 09.00)
Permit Description: Allows an operator to provide care on a regular basis for more than three hours per day per child for up to eight children in a personal residence. Approval may be given to care for up to an additional two school-aged children. Capacity is specified on registration, as are waivers issued.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Farm Labor Camp Commissary Permit (LS-113, LS-27)
Permit Description: To insure that workers in a Farm Labor Camp are aware, in advance, of the prices they will be charged for goods purchased or leased and that an accurate record is kept of all charges made to each farm worker.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows owners of man-made ponds (less than ten acres) to manage such ponds for fish production including control of undesirable fish, vegetation and insects; stocking and propagation of fish and harvesting by nets without requirement of other permits. Purpose is to provide the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation oversight of stocking and management activities while minimizing landowner permit requirements.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: New York State IDS Certification Application (DOH-4110)
Permit Description: A Certificate of Authority must be obtained to operate an integrated delivery system (IDS) in New York State. The application describes the proposed organization and operation of the IDS.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Farm Labor Contractor Certificate of Registration (LS-113, LS-27)
Permit Description: Allows a Farm Labor Contractor to recruit, transport or hire workers for employment on a New York State farm or food processing establishment. It insures that employees are working under conditions specified by New York State Law and that terms of employment are accurately conveyed to farmworkers.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: The license allows a person to manufacture (grind, mix or blend, or further process) any feed within New York State for distribution. The facility must maintain compliance with the regulations for operation of the establishment so the feed produced is not or may not be adulterated, misbranded or not maintained in any manner required by law. Feed is all edible materials which are consumed by animals and contribute energy or nutrients to the animal's diet. New York State licensed feed manufacturers are not required to hold a commercial feed registration for distribution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Field Overweight Permits are issued at the time State Police and Authority inspections reveal that a vehicle and load is in violation of statutory weight limits and the driver is not in possession of a special hauling permit for the trip. The Field Overweight Permit is issued and valid for the current trip from the point of entry on the NYS Thruway to the first interchange beyond the location of the inspection. The cost of the permit includes a $100 surcharge to pay for the administrative costs associated with field inspection and permit processing and higher than normal overweight (ton mileage) fees. The permit fee is payable at the toll station upon leaving the NYS Thruway.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Approval of Plans for Elevators, Escalators, Dumbwaiters, etc. (SH-703)
Permit Description: To ensure the proper installation and/or modification of elevators and/or escalators. Filing is required for new or altered elevators, escalators, dumbwaiters, etc., in buildings used as factories or mercantile establishments except for buildings located in the City of New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Financial Guaranty Insurance Corporation License - Domestic (UCAA-Primary, Form 1P, Form2P, Form3)
Permit Description: Organization of a domestic stock financial guaranty insurance company. Financial guaranty insurance means a surety bond, an insurance policy or an indemnity contract, and any guaranty similar to the foregoing types, under which loss is payable, upon proof of occurrence of financial loss as a result of any of the following events: failure of any obligor on or issuer of any debt instrument or other monetary obligation to pay when due to be paid by the obligor or scheduled at the time insured to be received by the holder of the obligation, principal, interest, premium, dividend or purchase price of or on, or other amounts due or payable with respect to, such instrument or obligation, when such failure is the result of a financial default or insolvency or, provided that such payment source is investment grade, any other failure to make payment; changes in the levels of interest rates; changes in the rate of exchange of currency; changes in the value of specific assets or commodities, financial or commodity indices, or price levels in general; or other events which the superintendent determines are substantially similar to any of the foregoing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Financial Guaranty Insurance Corporation License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion, Form 1E, Form 2E, Form 3)
Permit Description: Admission of foreign stock financial guaranty insurance company to New York. Financial guaranty insurance means a surety bond, an insurance policy or an indemnity contract, and any guaranty similar to the foregoing types, under which loss is payable, upon proof of occurrence of financial loss as a result of any of the following events: failure of any obligor on or issuer of any debt instrument or other monetary obligation to pay when due to be paid by the obligor or scheduled at the time insured to be received by the holder of the obligation, principal, interest, premium, dividend or purchase price of or on, or other amounts due or payable with respect to, such instrument or obligation, when such failure is the result of a financial default or insolvency or, provided that such payment source is investment grade, any other failure to make payment; changes in the levels of interest rates; changes in the rate of exchange of currency; changes in the value of specific assets or commodities, financial or commodity indices, or price levels in general; or other events which the superintendent determines are substantially similar to any of the foregoing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Fire Insurance or Salvage Company Permit
Permit Description: Permit authorizes a fire insurance or salvage company under the supervision of the NYS Department of Insurance to sell to licensees alcoholic beverages which came into its possession as a result of a fire on a licensed premises.  A copy of the Fire Incident Report is required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will be sold and delivered only to duly licensed manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers;  The sale will be held only on a licensed premises or premises for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the New York State Liquor Authority;  The alcoholic beverages will not be stored at the place of sale in excess of 48 hours after the date of sale;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers will be sold;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each purchaser;  The permittee will pay all excise taxes imposed by or under the provisions of the Tax Law;  A separate permit will be obtained for each licensed premises for which a fire occurred.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permit to Install Fish Barrier Screen
Permit Description: Permit allows a permittee or designated agents, acting on his behalf, to install a fish barrier screen for the purpose of preventing escapement of planted fish.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: To view applicable laws for mental health practitioners, please see the NYS Education Law, Article 163 - Mental Health Practitioners Law through the link below.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Allows a single landowner with a man-made pond or ponds to provide fishing facilities to fisherman. It allows the landowner and his immediate family to fish without a fishing license, allows a person paying for fishing in the preserve without a fishing license, and to sell fish taken from his license waters and may charge others for fishing or for fish taken from such waters. If under club ownership, dues may be charged allowing fishing by members of the club.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allow the movement of flat glass between the United States and Canada via the NYS Thruway from Interchange 42 to 36 (I-90) or (I-90) to N9 (I-190).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to transport alcoholic beverages in any and all vehicles owned or hired, and operated by the permittee within New York; to transport alcoholic beverages from within New York State to points outside the state; and to transport alcoholic beverages from outside New York to points within the state. A fleet permit allows the licensee to register multiple vehicles under a blanket permit without having to provide detailed information on each vehicle and allows adding and removing of vehicles without notification to the NY State Liquor Authority.  The following documentation must be submitted with the application:  Authorization Form;  $1,000 penal bond.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Floating Objects Other Than Aids to Navigation
Permit Description: Allows the placing in navigable waters of New York in the Adirondack and Catskill Parks of mooring buoys, bathing beach markers, swimming floats, speed zone markers, or any other floating object having no navigational significance. For navigable waters of New York outside the Adirondack and Catskill Parks, the NYS Department of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation has jurisdiction.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Permits placement in navigable waters of New York State (except for the Adirondack Park, the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation has jurisdiction) any mooring buoys, special markers, swim floats and other objects having no navigational significance. Permit ensures all applicable rules and regulations are adhered to and that such placement does not pose a hazard to navigation nor does it restrict access to or from any property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Assures that foods processed in New York for humans are pure and wholesome and food processing establishments conform to proper operating and sanitary standards. Activities range from wholesale food and beverage manufacturers including farm wineries to retail food stores directly handling exposed ready-to-eat foods. Food processing is defined as the processing of foods in any manner, such as by manufacturing, canning, preserving, freezing, drying, dehydrating, juicing, pickling, baking, brining, bottling, packing, repacking, pressing, waxing, heating or cooking, or otherwise treating food in such a way as to create a risk that it may become adulterated if improperly handled. Retail food stores that conduct any type of food preparation such as meat grinding or cheese slicing, heating foods, sandwich and beverage dispensing machines, preparing sushi, salad bars, and/or other ready to eat exposed foods packaging activities needs licensing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Protects public safety and health by controlling the salvaging of damaged or contaminated food, food products, and devices which come into intimate contact with food or food products. No person shall act as a food salvager unless licensed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permit to Operate Food Service Establishment (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Permit grants permission to operate a restaurant, lunchroom, diner, etc., as required by NYS Public Health Law and State Sanitary Code.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License to Close Foreign Banking Corporation
Permit Description: The NYS Department of Financial Services requires the foreign entity to send a written notice of its intent to liquidate. The NYS Department of Financial Services sends a letter to the entity requesting information and requiring certain tasks be performed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Foreign Banking Corporation to Have Fiduciary Powers
Permit Description: To permit a foreign bank to exercise fiduciary powers in New York. To assure safe operation of trust responsibilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Foreign Bank to Change Location of Branch/Agency (CL-FB/A)
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a foreign bank or trust company to change the location of its office. It's purpose is to ensure that the move would be in compliance with Banking Laws and Regulations and that it would not create or destroy competition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Change of Name of Foreign Banking Corporation
Permit Description: Certificate of authorization for change of name includes old name of foreign bank and new name of foreign bank, reason for name change (generally a merger) and request to change the name of branch, agency or representative office to new name and statement of no objection from the Deputy Superintendent of Banks along with effective date of approval.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Maintain a Branch Office by a Foreign Branch/Agency (Form FB-101)
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a foreign banking corporation to issue a license to maintain a branch office. The purpose is to ensure that the issuance would be in compliance with Banking Laws and Regulations and that it would not create unsound or destructive competition. A Foreign Bank Branch is an office of a foreign bank that is licensed by the Superintendent to conduct banking business in New York. A branch may exercise the same powers as a state-chartered commercial bank, including accepting deposits, making loans, issuing letters of credit, dealing in foreign exchange, making acceptances and, if authorized, exercising fiduciary powers. There are two types of foreign branches;?? insured and uninsured. An insured branch may conduct a retail banking business in New York, making consumer loans and accepting consumer deposits. An uninsured branch may accept deposits only as authorized by the FDIC Rules, with disclosure of their non-insured status.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for a Foreign Bank to Establish, Maintain, or Maintain a Representative Office in New York State (Form F-102)
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a foreign banking corporation to issue a license to maintain a representative office. The purpose is to ensure that the issuance would be in compliance with Banking Laws and Regulations and that it would not create unsound or destructive competition. A foreign bank wishing merely to solicit business in the U.S. may establish a representative office to conduct research on the U.S. market and engage in marketing for the foreign bank. A representative office is not permitted to perform any core banking functions for the foreign bank or make any business decisions that would obligate the foreign bank, but it is permitted to engage in a number of activities not deemed to constitute the business of banking, including acting as liaison with customers and correspondents of the foreign bank, soliciting new business for the foreign bank, soliciting investors to buy loans from the foreign bank, and soliciting loans of $250,000 or more for the foreign bank.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Maintain an Agency by a Foreign Banking Corporation (Form FB-101)
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to a foreign banking corporation to issue a license to maintain an agency office. The purpose is to ensure that the issuance would be in compliance with Banking Laws and Regulations and that it would not create unsound or destructive competition. A Foreign Agency is an agency of a foreign bank that is licensed by the Superintendent to conduct banking business in New York and has many of the same powers as a foreign bank branch, except in the case of deposits. A New York agency has many of the same powers as a branch, except in the case of deposits. An agency may issue large-denomination ($250,000 or over) CDs, may accept deposits from foreign residents and citizens and may maintain credit balances for customers incidental to its banking business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Notice of the Operation of a Personal Loan Department by a Foreign Banking Corporation
Permit Description: The purpose is to allow the making of personal loans. A foreign banking corporation is required to make written notice be submitted to the Superintendent of Financial Services prior to the establishment of the personal loan department.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Establishment of a Foreign Banking Corporation Public Accommodation Office
Permit Description: To set up liaison offices to promote business relationship between the home and the host country.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Franchise Fractional Exemption (Form G, Form H)
Permit Description: Exempts franchisors from registration of franchise sales offering circulars. Available to franchisors with audited net worth between five and fifteen million dollars.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Franchise Registration Application (UFRA-A, UFRA-B, UFRA-C, UFRA-D, UFRA-F )
Permit Description: Registration of a franchise sales offering circular. It provides potential purchasers of franchises with information needed to decide whether to purchase. A franchise is a contract or agreement, either expressed or implied, whether oral or written, between two or more persons by which: a franchisee is granted the right to engage in the business of offering, selling, or distributing goods or services under a marketing plan or system prescribed in substantial part by a franchisor, and the franchisee is required to pay, directly or indirectly, franchise fee, or a franchise is granted the right to engage in the business of offering, selling or distributing goods or services substantially associated with the franchisor's trademark, service mark, trade name, logotype, advertising or other commercial symbol designating the franchisor or its affiliate, the franchise is required to pay directly or indirectly a franchise fee.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Registration required for persons who directly or indirectly engage in the offer or sale of any franchise on behalf of another. Franchisors, subfranchisors, and their employees are not consider franchise sales agents.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License for a Fraternal Benefit Society to Operate Insurance Business - Domestic
Permit Description: License permits a fraternal benefit society to operate an insurance business to provide life, accident and sickness, and accidental injury benefits to its members and their families.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License for a Fraternal Benefit Society to Operate Insurance Business - Foreign
Permit Description: License permits a foreign fraternal benefit society to operate an insurance business to provide life, accident and sickness, and accidental injury benefits to its members and their families.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit allows development and other activities (including use of pesticides) in or near freshwater wetlands. Required for protection of wetland values and functions. Only new regional subdivision, land use and development requires an Adirondack Park Agency permit. Statutory exemptions depend on project, type, scale, and location.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Wholesale Frozen Dessert Handlers License (DMC-72, DMC-72 Supplement)
Permit Description: This is a license to permit an individual or corporation to sell and distribute frozen desserts in the State of New York. Frozen desserts include: ice cream, frozen custard, French Ice cream, French custard ice cream, artificially sweetened ice cream, ice milk, freezer made shakes, fruit sherbet, water ice, quiescently frozen confection, quiescently frozen dairy confection, manufactured dessert mix, frozen confection, mellorine frozen dessert, frozen dessert mix, or any other product with similar in appearance, odor, or taste to such products or are prepared or frozen as frozen desserts are customarily prepared or frozen, whether made with dairy products or non-dairy products.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: Wholesale Frozen Dessert Manufacturers License (DMC-72, DMC-72 Supplement)
Permit Description: This is a license which permits a person or corporation to produce, process, and package  frozen desserts for sale in the State of New York. Frozen desserts include: ice cream, frozen custard, French Ice cream, French custard ice cream, artificially sweetened ice cream, ice milk, freezer made shakes, fruit sherbet, water ice, quiescently frozen confection, quiescently frozen dairy confection, manufactured dessert mix, frozen confection, mellorine frozen dessert, frozen dessert mix, or any other product with similar in appearance, odor, or taste to such products or are prepared or frozen as frozen desserts are customarily prepared or frozen, whether made with dairy products or non-dairy products.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Registration as a Fund Raising Counsel is required by any person who for compensation consults with a charitable organization or who plans, manages, advises or assists with respect to the solicitation in New York State of contributions for or on behalf of a charitable organization, but who does not have access to contributions or other receipts from a solicitation or authority to pay expenses associated with a solicitation or authority to pay expenses associated with a solicitation and who does not solicit. A bona fide officer, volunteer, or employee of a charitable organization or an attorney at law retained by such charitable organization shall not be considered a Fund Raising Counsel.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Professional Fund Raising Solicitor Registration (CHAR009, CHAR-012)
Permit Description: Registration as a Professional Solicitor is required by any person who is employed or retained for compensation by a Professional Fund Raiser to solicit contributions for charitable purposes or for the purposes of any law enforcement support organization from persons in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: To control the business and practice of funeral directing. Only funeral directors, embalmers, and undertakers registered with the department may practice. Required by statute and regulation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Registration as a Funeral Director Student (DOH-22157)
Permit Description: To register students enrolled in funeral service institutions seeking licensure in New York. Used for new students and students resuming studies. Provides information regarding citizenship, military service, personal data, criminal convictions and institution being attended and anticipated graduation date. Information is required by statute.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Statutory requirement to engage in the business and practice of funeral directing in New York; person must be licensed and registered with the department.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: The business and practice of funeral directing must be conducted from a funeral establishment which is registered with the department. The establishment must satisfy specific facility requirements.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Certificate of Need to Possess Hypodermic Syringes and Needles (DOH H-2278)
Permit Description: This application is for the purpose of establishing qualifications to possess hypodermic syringes and needles. There are four categories; Educational, Industrial, Commercial and Agricultural activities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Allows for the propagation or keeping alive in captivity fur bearing animals such as, beaver, bobcat, coyote, raccoon, sable or marten, skunk, fisher, nutria and muskrat. It also allows the disposal of alive for propagation, exhibition, scientific or education purposes. Also, allows licensee to kill and pelt at any time. The carcasses and pelts of fur bearing animals may be possessed, transported, bought or sold at any time.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: This license allows an authorized lessor to rent property to authorized organizations to hold games of chance. This license is issued through local municipalities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A trade association is a valuable source for information, services and advice for your business.  The association listed below is for reference purposes only and does not constitute an endorsement.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Anyone that engages in any game, contest or other promotion or advertising scheme in connection with the promotion, advertising or sale of consumer products or services which offers the opportunity to receive prizes, as determined by chance, without any consideration therefor, in excess of five thousand dollars, must first file a registration setting forth the contest rules, odds and other contest information with the Secretary of State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Supplier License for Manufacturing or Distributing Games of Chance and/or Bingo Supplies and Equipment (GC/BC-106)
Permit Description: A license allowing the licensee to sell games of chance supplies, equipment, and bell jar tickets to licensed authorized organizations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Games of Chance License, Bell Jar, Raffle (GC-2, GC-2A, GC-2B)
Permit Description: A license allowing an authorized organization to conduct games of chance: raffles, bell jar, casino nights. This license is issued by the local municipality.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Application to Amend Games of Chance License, Bell Jar, Raffle (GC-6)
Permit Description: An amendment to a license to conduct games of chance (raffles, bell jar, and casino nights) allowing an authorized organization to change its officers and directors, persons in charge of games, auxiliary organizations assisting at games, assistants to persons in charge of games, expenses, types of games, or dates, hours and rent of all license periods to be held. This is issued by the local municipality.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Application to Disburse Games of Chance Proceeds (GC-317)
Permit Description: A permit allowing games of chance licensees to disburse games of chance proceeds for other than charitable purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Gas or Electric Corporation Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity
Permit Description: Permit is required for a gas or electric corporation to construct a plant or exercise any rights under a franchise.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Producer Application for General Consultant's License - Entity (C3-Entity)
Permit Description: A license authorizing an entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) to receive money, fee, commission, or things of value for examining, appraising, reviewing, or evaluating any insurance, policy, annuity, or pension contract, plan or program, or give advice on any of the above.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for General Consultant's License - Individual (C-3INDOrig)
Permit Description: A license authorizing an individual to receive money, fee, commission, or things of value for examining, appraising, reviewing, or evaluating any insurance, policy, annuity, or pension contract, plan or program, or give advice on any of the above.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Permit to Do Work or Use Property Owned by the Power Authority (St. Lawerence/F.D.R. Power Project) (PA-39S)
Permit Description: Permit allows bearer to construct removable docks and ancillary facilities, underground conduits and utility lines, limited landscaping, leach fields and storm water drainage ditches, and shoreline stabilization facilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: To allow ginseng dealers to buy, sell and export New York ginseng. Required by State and Federal laws and regulations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: All New York ginseng intended for export must be certified by the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation before export from this state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: NYS Department of Financial Services Certificate of Good Standing
Permit Description: This permit certifies that the institution is licensed by or registered with the NYS Department of Financial Services and is in good standing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permits public utilities to pass over, through or under property under the jurisdiction of Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit for Banks to Include Items in Gross Income Not Specifically Mentioned in Statute
Permit Description: This permit gives the Superintendent the authority to allow a savings bank or a savings and loan association to include certain items when calculating gross earnings or income. The purpose is to ensure that the proposed inclusion is in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. Application also applies to banks and trust companies.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Identifies and permits bus transportation companies to transport campers to group camps via park roads which otherwise restrict commercial traffic.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: New York State Group Family Day Care Initial Application (Rev.09.00)
Permit Description: Allows an operator to provide care on a regular basis for more than three hours per day for up to sixteen children in a personal residence. One caregiver is to be present for every child under two years of age; two caregivers must be present when six or more children, none of which are school-age; or eight children, at least two of which are school-age, are present. Maximum capacity is stated on license; as are waivers issued by the Office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Grower/Processor Certificate of Migrant Registration (LS-113, LS-114 , LS-28)
Permit Description: To insure that the terms of employment, as communicated to the farmworkers by the contractor, are confirmed by the grower-processor for whom the work is being performed. To insure that the information provided to the Division by the contractor is true and accurate. Certificate issued pursuant to contractor's submission of Application for Farm Labor Contractor Certificate of Registration.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: The purpose for the guide license is to regulate person(s) who offer services for hire, part or all of which includes directing, instructing or aiding another in fishing, hunting, camping, hiking, whitewater canoeing, white water rafting, or rock and ice climbing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License as Gunsmith - Dealer in Firearms (PPB-6)
Permit Description: License authorizes a gunsmith to engage in the business of repairing, altering, assembling, manufacturing, cleaning, polishing, engraving or trueing, or to perform any mechanical operation on, any firearms, large capacity ammunition feeding device or machine-gun. License authorizes a dealer in firearms to engage in the business of purchasing, selling, keeping for sale, loaning, leasing, or in any manner disposing of, any assault weapon, large capacity ammunition feeding device, pistol or revolver. The license further acknowledges that said firearms meet safety criteria established by New York State law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Requires an individual who certifies a non pre-packaged food product as Halal to file a statement of his or her qualifications to certify food as Halal. Manufacturers, producers, processors, packers, and sellers of non pre-packaged foods, which are certified as Halal, must file information about who certified the food as Halal. Food establishments and caterers who sell food prepared on their premises or under their control, which is represented as Halal, must file a Halal certification form and post the registration at their business location. Producers and distributors of foods in package form, which is certified as Halal, must file information about who certified the food as Halal.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: An annual license to conduct harness race meetings under the rules and regulations of the Racing and Wagering Board.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: License to Make Capital Improvements to Harness Track
Permit Description: License to make capital improvements to an existing harness racing track. To insure all capital improvements are in compliance with applicable state building codes and that such improvements generally serve the public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Register tanks storing regulated hazardous substances in underground or aboveground (over 185 gallons) stationary storage tanks. Allows the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation to monitor compliance with regulations regarding the handling and storage of hazardous substances, plus standards for construction of new tanks.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Operate Hazardous Waste Management Facility (EPA Form 8700-23 /OMB# 2050-0034)
Permit Description: Authorizes the management of hazardous wastes at facilities involved in the treatment, storage, or disposal of such wastes. Permit must be consistent with and no less stringent than that required under the Federal Resource Conservation and Recovery Act of 1975 (RCRA). Regulates the storage, transfer, recovery, reclamation, combustion, or disposal of any hazardous substance as listed in 6 NYCRR Part 371 or which exhibits any of the following characteristics: Ignitability Corrositivity Reactivity, or Leachability of toxic compounds (TCLP).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permission for Banks to Invest in Excess of Statutory Limits (Bank Premises)
Permit Description: Authorization to exceed 40% of capital in fixed assets used for premises. This is a liquidity limitation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Environmental Safety and Public Necessity Certification for the Siting of Hazardous Waste Facilities
Permit Description: An Environmental Safety and Public Necessity Certification issued by the NYS Hazardous Waste Facility Siting Board is necessary for the siting of any new industrial hazardous waste facility including, any new commercial facility, incineration facility, land disposal facility, and any expansion of the aggregate land disposal capacity of an existing land disposal facility.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: HMO Certification Application New York State (DOH-793, DOH-794)
Permit Description: A Certificate of Authority must be obtained to operate a managed care organization (MCO) in New York State. The application describes the proposed organization and operation of the managed care organization.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Allows a business entity to engage in the business of fitting, selecting, selling, renting, adapting or servicing of hearing aids or any other instrument to compensate for impaired hearing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Hearing Aid Business Application for Branch Locations (DOS H-a)
Permit Description: Allows a registered hearing aid business to operate a branch office in addition to the dealer's main office. Each branch must be separately registered to engage in the business of fitting, selecting, renting, adapting, or servicing of hearing aids or any other instrument to compensate for impaired hearing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Allows an individual 21 years of age or older, or an licensed audiologist, to engage in the dispensing of hearing aids which are wearable instruments, or devices designed for, or offered for the purpose of aiding or compensating for impaired human hearing and any parts, attachments or accessories, but excluding batteries and cords or accessories thereto.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Temporary Credential or Receipt of Application (TR-8)
Permit Description: This certificate of registration is intended to allow enforcement personnel to verify vehicle compliance with the law and to allow the carrier to travel in New York State for three days (72-hours). This certificate relieves the carrier from filing returns and the fee covers any highway use tax due. A carrier may not apply for more than ten in a single calendar year. This certificate is not valid for the transportation of gasoline, diesel, home heating fuel #2, etc.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Name: Application for Highway Use Tax (HUT) and Automotive Fuel Carrier (AFC) Certificate of Registration
Permit Description:
There are two types of registrations:

• A HUT certificate of registration is required for any truck, tractor, or other self-propelled vehicle with a gross weight over 18,000 pounds. (If you elect to use the unloaded weight method to file your returns, a certificate is required for any truck with an unloaded weight over 8,000 pounds and any tractor with an unloaded weight over 4,000 pounds.)

• An automotive fuel carrier (AFC) certificate of registration is required for any truck, trailer, or semi-trailer, or other attached device transporting automotive fuel. (The same gross weight and unloaded weight rules apply.)
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Name: Highway Work Permit Application for Non-Utility and Utility Work (PERM 33, PERM 32M)
Permit Description: Permit regulates activities by private persons or entities within a State right-of-way. The purpose is to prevent such activities from interfering with safe and efficient traffic flow on New York State highways.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: License entitles holder, an employee of a carrier of freight by water, a stevedore or other person, to select any longshoreman for employment.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Application to Acquire Control of a Holding Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows one or more individuals to acquire 10 percent or more of the stock of a holding company. The purpose is to ensure that the acquisition is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Home Health Aide Training Program Application (DOH-4396)
Permit Description: To regulate the planning and operation of home health aide training programs (HHATPs). To be eligible to work for hospices or certified and licensed home care services agencies, a home health aide must have completed a training program approved by the Department of Health.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Registration and Identification Number to Conduct Senior Citizens Games of Chance (GCSC-1A)
Permit Description: An identification number and registration is required for an organization to provide bingo and/or games of chance for amusement and recreation only to its members who are 55 years of age or older. Prizes awarded will be nominal in value not to exceed $5.00 per game.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Registration and Identification Number for Games of Chance and/or Bingo  (1A)
Permit Description: An identification number is required to an organization desiring to conduct games of chance such as bell jar and casino night and/or bingo.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Licenses a person to perform home inspections. A home inspection is the process by which a home inspector observes and provides a written report of the systems and components of a residential building (a structure consisting of one to four dwelling units and their garages and carports, but does not include any such structure newly constructed or not previously occupied as a dwelling unit) including but not limited to the heating, cooling, plumbing, electrical systems and structural components (foundation, roof, masonry structure, exterior and interior component or any other related residential building components). Architects, engineers, and code enforcement officials for the state or a political subdivision can continue to engage in home inspections without the need of this license provided they are working within the scope of their profession. However, if they open a home inspection business they are required to obtain a license. Architects and engineers are exempt from the course work, examination requirement, and the continuing education requirements for this license as long as they can provide proof of their professional license. Code enforcement officials must meet all qualifications.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a not-for-profit organization to conduct a tasting and/or competition for wines made by non-licensed individuals for personal or family use (homemade wine).  Proof of 501(c) Not for Profit Organization status is required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The permit shall be in effect for a period not to exceed six hours within the hours fixed or pursuant to Section 106.5 of the ABC Law;  Only one such permit shall be issued to the not-for-profit organization during any calendar year;  Whether conducted on its own or as part of a larger event, the tasting and/or competition shall be held indoors and confined to a clearly defined area and no one under the age of 21 shall be permitted in such area;  No permit shall be issued for a location that is licensed under the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law;  There will be no charge to attendees of the event, either for the wine tastings or for admission into the event.  Voluntary donations or charges for food, souvenirs, etc. are permissible.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A hospice is a coordinated program of home and in-patient care which treats the terminally ill patient and family as a unit, employing an interdisciplinary team acting under the direction of an autonomous hospice administration. The program provides palliative and supportive care to met the special needs arising out of physical, psychological, spiritual, social and economic stresses during the final stages of illness, and during dying and bereavement. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a hospital to purchase liquor, wine or beer for medicinal use only in treatment of bona fide patients of such hospital.  A copy of the permittee's NYS Hospital License must be provided.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The liquor, wine or beer, will be used only for medicinal purposes in the treatment of bona fide patients of the hospital;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made;  Only liquor, wine or beer in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of the law with respect to labels and sizes of containers will be purchased.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: A hospital is a facility or institution engaged principally in providing services by or under the supervision of physician or dentist (for dental clinic or dental dispensary). Services provided are: prevention, diagnosis or treatment of human disease, pain, injury, deformity, or physical condition. Not included are institutions, sanitarium or other facility engaged principally in providing services for the prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of mental disability. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: This permit allows a hotel liquor license holder (HL242) to sell liquor and wine for off-premises consumption provided there is no liquor stores within an 8 mile radius. The permitted space must be separate from the hotel with its own storefront and entrance. There cannot be any interior access to the hotel.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: An individual or business engaged in and conducting the business of a hotel or motel in New York State may register the name by which the hotel or motel is known by filing a Certificate of Hotel/Motel Name Filing with the Department of State. Filing with the Secretary of State shall grant the exclusive use of such name within New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License to Conduct Running Races, Steeplechases, and Hunt Meetings
Permit Description: A license to conduct hunt meetings, hurdle races and steeplechases. To insure that horse racing is conducted under New York state rules and to encourage thoroughbred horse breeding.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Permit to Stock Triploid Grass Carp
Permit Description: Allows a person to import, export, own or possess, acquire or dispose of live grass carp (Ctenohparyngodon idella) or hybrid grass carp within the state or place them in waters of New York state except as authorized by this permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Registration to Import Dry Milk Powder into New York State (DMC-1615)
Permit Description: This is an application which will permit a person or corporation to import dry milk powder into New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Independent Adjuster's License - Entity (IA-Entity.Orig, IA/PASupp Stmt)
Permit Description: A license allowing an entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) to act on behalf of an insurer in the work of investigating and adjusting claims arising under insurance contracts issued by such insurer and also to investigate and adjust claims on behalf of any other independent adjuster.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: A license allowing an individual to act on behalf of an insurer in the work of investigating and adjusting claims arising under insurance contracts issued by such insurer and also to investigate and adjust claims on behalf of any other independent adjuster.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Individualized Residential Alternative Operating Certificate Application - IRA (OMR 248)
Permit Description: Allows the provider to create an individualized service environment with the supports and services necessary to enable a person with a developmental disability to live, work and socialize with enhanced self determination, community integration and productivity.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permission for Banks to Have Interlocking Directors and Officers
Permit Description: This permit allows the Banking Board to grant permission to an executive officer of one institution to be an executive officer, director or trustee of another institution. The purpose is to ensure that there is benefit to the bank and no potential conflict of interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to manufacture alcohol intended for use and/or used for the following purposes: For scientific, chemical, mechanical, industrial, medicinal and culinary purposes; For use by those authorized to procure alcohol tax-free, as provided by the Acts of Congress and regulations promulgated thereunder; In the manufacture of denatured alcohol as provided by the Acts of Congress and regulations promulgated thereunder; In the manufacture of patented, patent, proprietary, medicinal, pharmaceutical, antiseptic, toilet, scientific, chemical, mechanical and industrial preparations or products, unfit for beverage purposes; In the manufacture of flavoring extracts and syrups, unfit for beverage purposes.  This permit authorizes the manufacturer to manufacture and distribute said alcohol to holders of industrial alcohol permits, distributors' alcohol permits Class A, distributors' alcohol permits Class B and distributors' Class C but nothing contained herein shall authorize the manufacturing and distribution of said alcohol for beverage purposes.  5x7 photos of the exterior and personal questionnaires for all permittee principal must be provided.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the permittee to manufacture alcohol intended for use and/or used for the following purpose: The manufacture of ethanol from biomass feedstock for use as fuel (including but not limited to motor fuel, heating fuel, or fuel for process heat).  5x7 photos of the exterior, personal questionnaires for all permittee principals, and a letter from the local municipality granting permission for the manufacturing of fuel must be provided.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  Less and one hundred thousand gallons will be manufactured annually for the use as a fuel;  The ethanol manufactured will be for the permittee's own use as fuel.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to purchase alcohol intended for use in the manufacture and sale of any of the following when they are unfit for beverage purposes: Denatured alcohol purchased and used pursuant to acts of Congress and regulations promulgated thereunder; Patent, proprietary, medicinal, pharmaceutical, antiseptic and toilet preparations; Flavoring extracts, syrups and food products; Scientific, chemical, mechanical and industrial products.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Inpatient Facility Comprehensive Application for Prior Approval Review (OMH-165)
Permit Description: An agency proposing to operate an inpatient program (such as an inpatient treatment program; general hospital inpatient programs; hospital for mentally ill persons inpatient programs; residential treatment facility for children and youth; and state psychiatric center inpatient programs) or proposing a significant change to a program for persons with mental illness must submit an Application for Prior Approval Review for review and approval prior to providing services.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Inspection Station Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19, VS-143)
Permit Description: To allow licensee to conduct periodic required inspections of motor vehicles, to insure competency of licensee, and to provide for consumer protection and clean air. Exception: Government entities need to register as fleet inspection stations, but pay no fees. NOTE: EFFECTIVE 7/13/2011, NYSDMV Part 79 of the Commissioner's Regulations has been changed to limit per county the number of public emission inspection stations. Many counties are already at their maximum number. You may be placed on a waiting list for a county that is at their capacity. For more information go to: http://www.dmv.ny.gov/vs-ispcap.htm
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit authorizes an institution of higher education operating under authority granted by the State Education Department to deliver or cause to be delivered alcoholic beverages to a person who is at least twenty-one years of age enrolled in a single class or course of classes authorized by the institution of higher education and conducted by an instructor or instructors engaged by the institution of higher education, provided that such person's imbibing or tasting of such alcoholic beverages is a required part of the class or course of classes, and provided that such person's imbibing or tasting of such alcoholic beverages is only for instructions purposes.  Course description must be provided.  If applicable a warehouse permit may be required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  If alcoholic beverages are to be stored in an area other than the room where the class will be held, the permittee will apply for a warehouse permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: This permit authorizes an institution of higher education operating under authority granted by the State Education Department, to deliver or cause to be delivered alcoholic beverages to a person who is at least twenty-one years of age enrolled in a single class or course of classes authorized by the institution of higher education and conducted by an instructor or instructors engaged by the institution of higher education, provided that such person's imbibing or tasting of such alcoholic beverages is a required part of the class or course of classes, and provided that such person's imbibing or tasting of such alcoholic beverages is only for instructions purposes.  Course description must be provided.  If applicable a warehouse permit may be required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  If alcoholic beverages are to be stored in an area other than the room where the class will be held, the permittee will apply for a warehouse permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits

Permit Name: Approval as Teacher of Driver Safety Education (SE I-3)
Permit Description: The permit authorizes an individual to teach driver education and to certify issuance of driver education completion certificates (MV-285s).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: License to file rates which assist insurers in rate-making or filing by collecting, compiling and furnishing loss or expense statistics, or by recommending rates or rate information.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Intermediate Care Facility for the Developmentally Disabled Application (CON, OMR I-1)
Permit Description: Allows the provider to operate a community-based intermediate care facility for the mentally retarded and for individuals with developmental disabilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Temporary Credential or Receipt of Application (TR-8)
Permit Description: This permit is intended to allow enforcement personnel to verify compliance with the law and to allow the carrier to travel in New York State for 3 days. This permit relieves the carrier from filing returns and the fee covers any fuel use tax due. This is used instead of getting an IFTA license and decals or getting the Highway Use Tax permit and filing fuel use tax returns. A carrier may fulfill its fuel use tax obligations by getting trip permits for each jurisdiction traveled.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Name: New York State International Fuel Tax Agreement (IFTA) Application (IFTA-21)
Permit Description: The license and decals are issued to allow enforcement personnel and the general public to verify through the use of sight, the licensing of a qualified motor vehicle. The license allows a qualified motor vehicle to legally (for fuel tax purposes) travel in any IFTA jurisdiction.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Description: Short form prospectus for small or specialized intrastate offering for securities to be sold only within New York State. In lieu of the prospectus called for the NY Intrastate Financing Act, an issuer proposing a small offering which is fair, just and equitable and not part of a series of offerings which in total exceeds $40,000 or a to a related group.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Application for acceptances for filing of a prospectus for securities (includes: stocks, bonds, debentures, notes, IOUs or other evidences of indebtedness, general or limited partnership interests, assignments of interest, joint venture agreements, investment contracts, membership certificates, collateral pledge agreements, warrants, rights, fractional undivided interests, trust certificates, warehouse receipts, certificates of participation and all other types of participation interests in an investment) to be sold only within New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Investment Adviser Registration (Form ADV/SEC 1707 (4/7/06), FORM ADV Part1A, FORM ADV Part 1B, NY-ADV-COVER)
Permit Description: An investment adviser is any person who, for compensation, engages in the business of advising clients either directly or through publications or writings within or from New York as to the value of securities; as to the advisability of investing in, purchasing, or selling or holding securities; or issues or produces analyses or reports concerning securities to clients. In New York, investment advisers with more than five clients in the New York must register as an investment adviser. New York accepts online filing through the Investment Adviser Registration Depository at www.iard.com.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Investment Company to Open and Occupy a Branch Office
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission to an investment company to establish an additional office. The purpose is to ensure that the establishment of the office would not create unsound and destructive competition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Investment Company Certificate of Merit/Organization Certificate
Permit Description: Authorization that allows the business of an investment company to be conducted.  The purpose is to ensure that the chartering of an investment company will enhance public convenience and advantage. An Article XII investment company is a type of banking organization that is not an “investment company” subject to registration under the Investment Company Act of 1940. An Article XII Investment company is a specialized non-depository lending institution that has broad borrowing and lending powers and may invest in stocks and bonds.  An Article XII investment company may not accept “deposits” inside the U.S., although it may accept credit balances in New York that are incidental to the exercise of its other powers and may accept deposits outside New York with the approval of the Banking Board.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application to Acquire Control of a Banking Institution
Permit Description: Authorization to invest in Article 12 investment company (change of control of investment company). To assure safety of acquired institution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Approval for Utility to Issue Long Term Securities
Permit Description: Permit allows a utility to issue stock, bonds and other forms of indebtedness.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Itinerant Vehicle Collector Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19, VS-143)
Permit Description: Allows a person to engage in business of acquiring non-operable vehicles and to sell vehicles or major component parts to a vehicle dismantler or scrap processor. Regulates the sale, registration and disposition of vehicles, thereby protecting consumers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Requires an individual who certifies a non pre-packaged food product as Kosher to file a statement of his or her qualifications to certify food as Kosher. Manufacturers, producers, processors, packers, and sellers of non pre-packaged foods, which are certified as Kosher, must file information about who certified the food as Kosher. Food establishments and caterers who sell food prepared on their premises or under their control, which is represented as Kosher, must file a Kosher certification form and post the registration at their business location. Producers and distributors of foods in package form, which is certified as Kosher, must file information about who certified the food as Kosher.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: This license authorizes the import, possession, and sale of Lake Sturgeon legally obtained outside of New York. An importer is authorized to import legally taken unprocessed Lake Sturgeon into New York. The licensee may import only to persons possessing a valid Endangered/Threatened Species Lake Sturgeon (Processor) License. The licensee and any person transporting for the licensee must carry a letter from the licensee authorizing such transportation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: This license allows the holder to process legally taken Lake Sturgeon that have been imported by a legally licensed Lake Sturgeon (Importer) in New York state. Information regarding the importation of the Lake Sturgeon must be kept by the processor for two years as well as furnish an annual report.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Name: LCV/Tandem Application/Operations Permit (TA-W6807, TA-W6808, TA-W6809, TA-W6811, TA-W6812,  TA-W6818 )
Permit Description: Permit allows for a company to operate long combination vehicles(LCV), also known as tandem trailers, on the New York State Thruway. A complete LCV/tandem consists of a tractor, first semi trailer, dolly and second semi trailer. The total carrying capacity of the entire combination must be at least 80,000 pounds. All drivers must be registered by the Thruway Authority prior to driving tandem trailers or LCVs. All tractors, trailer and dollies used in LCV/tandem operations must be certified. Service and towing vehicles owned and used for the maintenance of vehicles of LCV/tandem Permittees must be certified for operation on the Thruway System also.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permits use of State Park swimming facilities to conduct swimming classes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Allows the licensee to use certified leashed tracking dogs, with a leash of at least 12 feet in length, during the day or at night with or without the aid of an artificial light, to track and find dead, wounded or injured big game during all big game hunting seasons as well as Sundays during big game hunting seasons and the 24-hour period immediately following the last day of a big game hunting season. The licensee must possess a valid guide license as well as a big game hunting license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Application and License to Liberate Galerucella calmariensis, Galerucella pusilla, and Hylobius transversovittatus
Permit Description: This license allows the licensee and/or designated agent to release purple loosestrife biological control agents of the "Galerucella pusilla and Galeucella calmariensis" leaf-eating beetles or "Hylobius transversovittatus" a root-boring weevil. The licensee and/or designated agent must monitor the effects of the release and report findings to the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: A licensed home care services agency provides one or more of the following services: nursing services, home health aide services, and other therapeutic and related services which may include physical, speech and occupational therapy, nutritional services, medical social services, personal care service, homemaker services, and housekeeper or chore services, which may be of a preventive, therapeutic, rehabilitative, health guidance, and/or supportive nature to persons at home; and is licensed pursuant to Article 36 of the NYS Public Health Law. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service. An agency that provides solely companionship services with light housekeeping (no nursing, home health aide or personal care services) does not need this license. There is a MORATORIUM on the establishment of new LHCSAs until October 1, 2010. If you wish to submit an application that does not meet one of the exemptions, it will be held on file and will NOT be processed until the moratorium is lifted.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: No person or entity shall engage in the business of making loans in the principal amount of $25,000 or less to an individual for personal, family, household, or for investment purposes and in a principal amount of $50,000 or less for business and commercial loans, and charge, contract for, or receive a greater rate of interest than the lender would be permitted by law to charge if not a licensee without a license from the Superintendent of Financial Services.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Engage in the Business of Making Loans to the Residents of New York
Permit Description: Allows a company from out-of-state to solicit loans permitted by Article 9 of the NYS Banking Law to New York State residents.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permit for Acquisition of Control of a Licensed Lender by Means Other than Stock Purchases
Permit Description: Permits the acquisition by merger, consolidation, purchase of assets or otherwise, except by purchase of stock of a licensed lender.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Dual Authorization Certificate for Licensed Lender
Permit Description: Allows licensed lender to conduct another legal business at a licensed location other than other consumer finance business(s).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Licensing may be required to perform and play copyrighted music and/or sell copyrighted sheet music.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Licensed Lender by Purchase of Capital Stock or Equity
Permit Description: An approval that allows the acquisition of control of a licensed lender by means of a purchase of the capital stock or equity interest in such a license
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a warehouseman, railroad company, steamship company or other person who has acquired a lien pursuant to the law for the storage or carriage of alcoholic beverages, to sell such alcoholic beverages to a licensee.  A copy of the lien is required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will be sold and delivered only to duly licensed manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers;  The sale will be held on premises for which a warehouse permit has been issued;  The alcoholic beverages will not be stored at the place of sale in excess of 48 hours after the date of sale unless stored in the name of the purchaser;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of the law with respect to labels and size of containers will be sold;  The permitee will pay all excise taxes imposed by or under the provisions of the Tax Law;  Such permit shall be valid for one transaction only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization to Establish a Life Insurance Agency
Permit Description: With the approval of the superintendent and the trustees of the savings bank Life Insurance Fund, a savings and insurance bank may establish agencies for the receipt of applications for insurance and of premium or annuity payments; or, with like approval, it may appoint a savings bank as agent to perform services for its life insurance department.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Life Consultant's License - Entity (C1-Entity Orig)
