Permit Description: Authorizes an entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) to act as a consultant with respect to life, annuities, and accident and health insurance, to receive money, fee commission, or things of value for examining, appraising, reviewing, or evaluating any insurance policy, annuity, or pension contract, plan, or program, or gives advice on any of the above.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Life Consultant's License - Individual (C1 Individual)
Permit Description: Authorizes the individual to act as a consultant with respect to life, annuities, and accident and health insurance, to receive money, fee, commission, or things of value for examining, appraising, reviewing, or evaluating any insurance policy, annuity, or pension contract, plan, or program , or gives advice on any of the above.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Life Settlement Broker's License (Entity) (LSB-Entity.Org and LSB EMP)
Permit Description: License authorizes a provider and/or broker (corporations, partnerships, llcs) to negotiate the death benefit or ownership of a life insurance policy for the owner of the policy where the insured does NOT have a catastrophic or life-threatening illness or condition. Life settlements usually involve the sale of life insurance policies by owners where the insured is a senior citizen or where the insured may have a medical condition that will likely result in a shortened life expectancy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: License authorizes a provider and/or broker to negotiate the death benefit or ownership of a life insurance policy for the owner of the policy where the insured does NOT have a catastrophic or life-threatening illness or condition. Life settlements usually involve the sale of life insurance policies by owners where the insured is a senior citizen or where the insured may have a medical condition that will likely result in a shortened life expectancy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: License allows a person who maintains an electronic or other facility or system, for the disclosure, through a forum of offers and counteroffers, to sell or purchase a policy pursuant to a life settlement contract; and delivers to: a life settlement provider an offer from a life settlement broker or owner to sell a policy; or an owner or life settlement broker an offer from a life settlement provider to purchase a policy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: To allow licensee to purchase life insurance policies from viators. Life settlement company means an individual, partnership, corporation or other entity that enters into an agreement with a person owning a life insurance policy insuring the life of a person who has a catastrophic or life threatening illness or condition, under the terms of which the viatical settlement company pays compensation or anything of value, which compensation or value is less than the expected death benefit of the insurance policy, in return for the policy owner's assignment, transfer, sale, devise or bequest of the death benefit or ownership of the insurance policy to the viatical settlement company.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Life Agent's License - Entity (LA-Entity, LA-Entity.Orig)
Permit Description: A license allowing an entity (corporation, partnership, limited liability company) to solicit the public representing companies for which he/she has been appointed for the sale of one or more of the following lines of insurance: life, accident & health, travel accident, and variable annuities; and to receive commissions from the insurance company on business written.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Life Agent's License - Individual (LAINDOrig)
Permit Description: A license allowing an individual to solicit the public representing companies for which he/she has been appointed for the sale of one or more of the following lines of insurance: life, accident & health, travel accident, and variable annuities; and to receive commissions from the insurance company on business written.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Producer Application for Life Broker's - Entity (LB-Entity.Orig, LB - Supp)
Permit Description: A license allowing a corporation, through its sub-licensees, to transact business in such a manner to safeguard the interests of the insured and allows it to place insurance with, and receive commissions from, authorized insurers in New York state. Authority to solicit the lines of life, variable annuities, accident and health insurance and travel accident.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application For Life Broker's License - Individual (LBINDOrig)
Permit Description: A License allowing an individual to transact business in such a manner to safeguard the interests of the insured and allows it to place insurance with, and receive commissions from, authorized insurers in New York state. Authority to solicit the lines of life, variable annuities, accident and health insurance and travel accident.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Life, Accident and Health License - Domestic (UCAA-Primary Form 1P, Form 2P, Form 3)
Permit Description: License to operate an insurance business to sell life, accident, and health insurance and annuities contracts.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Life, Accident and Health License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion Form 1E, Form 2E, Form 3)
Permit Description: License to operate an insurance business to sell life, accident and health insurance and annuities contracts.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Producer Application for Limited Agent's License - Entity (LR-EntityOrig)
Permit Description: Allows employees of a rental vehicle company, wireless communication equipment vendor, or self services storages companies entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) to offer insurance coverage to those renting vehicles, wireless communication equipment or self services storage containers. Authority to write limited coverage related to the rental of motor vehicles, wireless communication equipment or self service storage containers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows employees of rental vehicle company, wireless communication equipment vendor or self services storage companies to offer insurance coverage to those renting vehicles, wireless communication equipment or self services storage containers. Authority to write limited coverage related to the rental of motor vehicles, wireless communication equipment or self services storage containers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Limited Liability Company (Foreign Professional) Application for Authority (DOS 1369-f-a)
Permit Description:
A foreign professional service limited liability company organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than New York State may apply for authority to do business and render a professional service in New York State by filing an Application for Authority pursuant to Section 1306 of the NYS Limited Liability Company Law with the NYS Department of State. Profession includes any practice as an attorney and counselor-at-law, licensed physician, or any of the professions designated in Title 8 of the NYS Education Law. To view a list of professions, visit the NYS Education Department's website.

Optional Services: 

Availability of Name: In order to determine whether the proposed name of the foreign professional service limited liability company is available, you may request a name availability search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) You may reserve the name of the limited liability company while finalizing your plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an "Application for Reservation of Name" with the Department of State. The fee for reserving a name is $20. When submitting your Application for Authority to the Department of State for filing you must include the Certificate of Reservation issued by the Department of State.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Limited Liability Company (Foreign) Application for Authority (DOS 1361-f-a)
Permit Description:
A foreign limited liability company organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than New York State may apply for authority to do business in New York State by filing an Application for Authority pursuant to Section 802 of the NYS Limited Liability Company Law with the NYS Department of State.

STEPS IN FILING AN APPLICATION FOR AUTHORITY:

The NYS Department of State has an Application for Authority form available on its website.  

You must attach to the Application for Authority a Certificate of Existence, Certificate of Good Standing or Certificate of Status from the official who files and maintains limited liability company records in the jurisdiction of the limited liability company. (Please Note: This official is generally the Secretary of State.) 

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the name of the foreign limited liability company is not already in use by an existing limited liability company, corporation or limited partnership you may request a "name search.” The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the foreign limited liability company’s name is available, you may wish to reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an “Application for Reservation of Name.” The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach this Certificate of Reservation to your Application for Authority when filing. The fee for filing the Application for Reservation of Name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual domiciled in the State of New York to take and land lobsters for commercial purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Milk Dealer License - Bargaining and Collecting Cooperative (DISPS-7)
Permit Description: Authorizes a cooperative association to engage solely in the negotiation and sale of its member's milk and receipt of sale proceeds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Name: Limited Liability Company (Professional Service) Articles of Organization (DOS-1374-f)
Permit Description:
A professional service limited liability company (“PLLC”) is an unincorporated organization of one or more professionals formed to render a professional service. Profession includes any practice as an attorney and counselor-at-law, licensed physician, or any of the professions designated in Title 8 of the NYS Education Law. To see a listing of professions, visit the NYS Education Department's website.

STEPS IN FILING ARTICLES OF ORGANIZATION: 

A professional service limited liability company is formed by filing Articles of Organization pursuant to Section 1203 of the NYS Limited Liability Company Law. The NYS Department of State has a form available on their website. You may also draft your own form pursuant to Section 1203 of the NYS Limited Liability Company Law, or purchase forms in a legal stationery store in New York.

Submit a certificate of good standing from the appropriate Appellate Division or a Certificate of Authority (Form PLS709) under seal from the NYS Department of Education, Division of Professional Licensing Services, Corporations Unit, 89 Washington Avenue, 2nd Floor, Albany, NY 12234. 

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the proposed name of the professional service limited liability company is not already in use by an existing corporation, limited liability company or limited partnership, you may request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may wish to reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an “Application for Reservation of Name.” The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach this Certificate of Reservation to your Articles of Organization when filing. The fee for reservation of name is $20.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Statement of Certification for Limited Use Vehicles
Permit Description: Gives the manufacturer or importer of a "limited use vehicle" approval to sell the vehicle in New York state for registration purposes. A "limited use vehicle" has a maximum speed capability of not more than 40 miles per hour.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Authorization of Military Convoys on NYS Thruway
Permit Description: To coordinate convoyed military vehicles (more than ten vehicles) to prevent multiple convoy facilities overload and provide smooth travel with other users of the NYS Thruway system.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Limited Liability Company (Domestic) Articles of Organization (DOS 1336)
Permit Description:
A limited liability company (“LLC”) is an unincorporated business organization of one or more persons who generally have limited liability for the contractual obligations and other liabilities of the business. The Limited Liability Company Law governs the formation and operation of an LLC. An LLC may organize for any lawful business purpose or purposes. The LLC is a hybrid business entity form that combines corporation-style limited liability with partnership-style flexibility. The flexible management structure allows owners to shape the LLC to meet the needs of the business. The owners of an LLC are “members” rather than shareholders or partners. A member may be an individual, a corporation, a partnership, another limited liability company or any other legal entity.

STEPS IN FILING ARTICLES OF ORGANIZATION: 

Organizers form an LLC, by filing the Articles of Organization (pursuant to Section 203 of the Limited Liability Company Law, with the Department of State). Organizers prepare, sign and file the Articles of Organization that creates the LLC. Any person or business entity may be an organizer. Organizers may be, but need not be, a member of the LLC formed.

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the name of the limited liability company is not already in use by an existing limited liability company, corporation or limited partnership, you may request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file "Application for Reservation of Name." The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach the Certificate of Reservation to your Articles of Organization when filing. The fee for reservation of name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Limited Liability Partnership (Foreign) Notice of Registration (DOS-1527-f)
Permit Description: A foreign limited liability partnership may register as a New York registered foreign limited liability partnership with the Department of State by filing a Notice of Registration pursuant to Section 121-1502(a) of the Partnership Law. A copy of the last registration, renewal, or similar filing, if any, filed by the limited liability partnership in the jurisdiction where it is registered as a limited liability partnership or a certificate, issued by the jurisdiction where it is registered as a limited liability partnership must accompany the Notice of Registration. The Notice of Registration must set forth the profession or professions to be practiced by the foreign limited liability partnership. "Profession" includes any practice as an attorney and counselor-at-law, or as a licensed physician, and those professions designated in Title 8 of the NYS Education Law.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Registered Limited Liability Partnership (Domestic) Certificate of Registration (DOS-1526-f)
Permit Description:
A partnership without limited partners may register as a registered limited liability partnership with the Department of State by filing a Certificate of Registration pursuant to Section 121-1500(a) of the New York State Partnership Law. The Certificate of Registration must set forth the profession or professions to be practiced by the partnership. "Profession" includes any practice as an attorney and counsellor-at-law, or as a licensed physician, and those professions designated in Title 8 of the NYS Education Law.

Registered limited liability partnerships must, within 120 days after registration with the Department of State, publish a notice in two newspapers in the county in which the principal office of registered limited liability partnership is located once a week for six consecutive weeks. The county clerk of such county designates the newspapers for publication. One newspaper must be printed daily and the other printed weekly. Proof of publication (Certificate of Publication with the Affidavits of Publication of the newspapers) must be submitted to the NYS Department of State for filing. The filing fee is $50. Failure to comply with the publication requirement will result in the suspension of the registered limited liability partnership's authority to carry on, conduct or transact business in New York.

Registered limited liability partnerships must file a Registered Limited Liability Partnership Statement within 60 days prior to the fifth anniversary of the effective date of its registration and every five years thereafter. The Department of State provides and mails the Registered Limited Liability Partnership Statement two months prior to its due date. The filing fee is $20. Information regarding Registered Limited Liability Partnership Statements is available on the Department of State's website.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Description:
A foreign limited partnership is a partnership that is formed under the laws of any jurisdiction, including any foreign country, other than the laws of New York and that has one or more general partners and one or more limited partners. A foreign limited partnership may apply for authority to do business in New York by filing an Application for Authority with the Department of State pursuant to Section 121-902 of the Revised Limited Partnership Act. The name of the foreign limited partnership must contain the words "Limited Partnership" or the abbreviation "L.P." In addition, certain words and phrases may also require the consent or approval from another State agency prior to filing the document with the NYS Department of State. Provisions relating to the use of certain words and phrases in the name of the limited partnership are in the Revised Limited Partnership Act.

STEPS IN FILING AN APPLICATION FOR AUTHORITY AS A FOREIGN LIMITED PARTNERSHIP: 

The foreign limited partnership is required to file an Application for Authority with the Department of State which includes a Certificate of Existence, Certificate of Good Standing or Certificate of Status from the official who files and maintains limited partnership records in the jurisdiction of organization of the limited partnership.

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the name of the limited partnership is not already in use by an existing limited partnership, limited liability company or corporation, you may request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an "Application for Reservation of Name." The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach this Certificate of Reservation to your Application for Authority when filing. The fee for reservation of name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Plenary Miscellaneous Permit for Market Research Testing
Permit Description: Permit authorizes market research companies to conduct a tasting to test markets for research. A copy of the federal label approval for each product being tested must be provided.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  Permit will be issued for only one occasion; Application will be filed 30 days prior to the scheduled market research test.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Limited Partnership (Domestic) Certificate of Limited Partnership (DOS-1391-f)
Permit Description:
A domestic limited partnership is a partnership formed under the Revised Limited Partnership Act with one or more general partners and one or more limited partners. A limited partnership may be formed by the general partner(s) by executing a partnership agreement (See §121-110 of the New York State Revised Limited Partnership Act) and filing a Certificate of Limited Partnership with the Department of State pursuant to Section 121-201 of the Revised Limited Partnership Act. The name of the limited partnership must contain the words "Limited Partnership" or the abbreviation "L.P." In addition, certain words and phrases may also require the consent or approval from another State agency prior to filing the document with the Department of State. Provisions relating to the use of certain words and phrases in the name of the limited partnership are contained in the Revised Limited Partnership Act.

STEPS IN FILING A CERTIFICATE OF LIMITED PARTNERSHIP:

The Department of State has a Certificate of Limited Partnership form available on its website. You may also draft your own form pursuant to the Revised Limited Partnership Act or purchase a form from a legal stationery store in New York. 

Availability of Name: (optional) In order to assure that the proposed name of the limited partnership is not already in use by an existing corporation, limited liability company or limited partnership you may request a name search. The request must be in writing to the Department of State. The search fee for each name submitted is $5.00. 

Reservation of Name: (optional) If the name is available, you may wish to reserve it while finalizing your business plans. To reserve the name for 60 days, file an "Application for Reservation of Name.” The Department of State will send you a Certificate of Reservation. Attach this Certificate of Reservation to the Certificate of Limited Partnership when filing. The fee for filing an Application for Reservation of Name is $20.00.
Permit Categories: Legal Structures

Permit Name: Limited Service Laboratory Registration, Disclosure of Ownership and Controlling Interest Statement (DOH-4081, DOH-3486)
Permit Description: A laboratory facility operating in New York or accepting specimens from New York that performs only tests classified under the Federal Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988 (CLIA) as Waived and/or Provider-Performed Microscopy Procedures (PPMP) may registered for the designation as a "Limited Service Laboratory". These laboratory facilities include hospital extension clinics, nursing homes, home health care agencies, school/student health services, dialysis facilities, ambulatory surgery centers, county health departments, correctional facilities, ambulance/rescue squads and other direct patient care facilities. Laboratories which are set up as a joint venture of several practitioners, partnerships or practices and practices which are owned, managed and/or operated by managed care organizations, hospitals, or consulting firms are also included in this designation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Certificate of Environmental Safety for Liquefied Natural or Petroleum Gas Storage Facility
Permit Description: No person shall commence the preparation of a site for, or begin the construction of, a liquefied natural or petroleum gas storage or conversion facility in the state without having first obtained an environmental safety permit issued with respect to such facility or activity. Any such facility with respect to which a permit is issued shall not thereafter be built, maintained or operated, and any such activity with respect to which a permit is issued, shall not be carried out, except in conformity with such permit and any terms, limitations or conditions contained therein; provided that nothing herein shall exempt such facility from compliance with state law and regulations thereunder or with municipal laws and regulations thereunder not inconsistent with the provisions of such permit. A permit may be transferred, subject to approval to a person who agrees to comply with the terms, limitations and conditions contained therein. Legislation approved in 1976, but with a moratorium on new construction. This moratorium has been extended every two years, preventing any new facilities to be constructed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: To allow the sale of alcoholic beverages resulting from salvage, liquidation or judicial action. Authorizes a licensee who is selling or liquidating their business to dispose of the entire stock of alcoholic beverages in connection with such sale.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit for Use of Living Animals
Permit Description: This permit allows a laboratory or institution to use living mammals and/or birds in properly performed or conducted scientific tests, experiments or investigations, including educational demonstrations. The laboratory must provide evidence that the general research or teaching program of the institution or laboratory will contribute to the understanding of the problems of human or animal health.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Approval of Loan to Affiliated Interests
Permit Description: Approval of loans (money, stocks, bonds, notes) to corporate officers; any contract with an affiliate must be approved by the Commission under the Public Service Law to ensure that it is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Registration is required by the Lobbying Act if an individual or organization has been retained to lobby (attempt to influence the passage or defeat of legislation by the State Legislature, the approval or disapproval of legislation by the Governor, or the outcome of a rule, regulation, or rate-making proceeding by a State agency or any attempt to influence the passage or defeat of any local law, ordinance, or regulation by any municipality or subdivision thereof or the adoption or rejection of any rule or regulation having the force and effect of local law, ordinance, or regulation on rate making proceeding by any municipality or subdivision thereof) on behalf of another individual or organization and anticipates expending, incurring or receiving over $5,000 in a calendar year.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows commercial lobster fishers to take bait fish with one 300 foot long gill net in an area where the use of gill nets is otherwise prohibited by law. Bait fish so taken may be used only by the permit holder for his or her own lobster fishing. This permit is also known as a Lobster Bait Gill Net Permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows non-residents of New York who are not residents of a state that permits New York residents to taken lobsters in its waters to land lobsters legally taken in waters outside New York state waters.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual not domiciled in the State of New York to take and land lobsters for commercial purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Long-Term Home Health Care Program (LTHHCP) Operating Certificate (CON, CON Link)
Permit Description: A long term home health care program is a coordinated plan of care and services provided at home to invalid, infirm, or disabled persons who are medically eligible for placement in a hospital or residential health care facility for an extended period of time. This program can be provided in the person's home, or in the home of a responsible relative or other responsible adult, but not in a private proprietary home for adults, private proprietary convalescent home, residence for adults, or public home. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Milk and Milk Products Import Permit (DMC-1514, DMC-1514 Supplement)
Permit Description: Gives permission to ship Grade A dairy products into New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Registration entitles holder, an employee of a carrier of freight by water, a stevedore or other person, to engage in the physical movement of waterborne freight or to perform labor or services incidental to the movement of waterborne freight, such as cargo repair, coopering, cargo storage, maintenance, mechanical weighing, sampling, scaling, carpentry on vessels, piers or other waterfront terminals in the Port of New York and New Jersey.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: The issuance of this certificate to the agent shows that the agent is permitted by law to sell lottery tickets.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Low-Level Radioactive Waste Disposal Facility Program
Permit Description: Establishes guidelines for any person who operates or proposes to operate a land disposal facility in New York state used for permanent disposal of low-level radioactive waste. Disposal sites that meet these requirements may also be used for disposal of NARM waste. Land disposal facilities must be sited, designed, operated, closed, and controlled after closure to reasonably assure that exposures to humans are within the limits established in the performance objectives in 6 NYCRR Sections 382.11 through 382.15.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Authorizes and enables licensee to manage the career of a licensed boxer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Certificate of Waiver from Mandatory Disinfection Requirements (DOH - 1029)
Permit Description: This certificate is issued to indicate that a public water supply maintains basic safeguards to ensure satisfactory bacteriological quality of the drinking water and, therefore, does not have to comply with the mandatory disinfection requirements. Such waivers are granted to public water system with ground water source only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Certification as a Manufacturer of Mobile/Manufactured Homes (DOS-1803)
Permit Description: Certification is required to manufacture or produce manufactured (mobile) homes, including the manufacture outside of the state of New York for sale into New York. Certification is required for manufacturers approved to construct manufactured homes by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. Manufacturer's warranty seals are required to be attached to the manufactured homes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Certification as a Mechanic for Mobile Homes (DOS-1704)
Permit Description: Certification is required to perform services such as modification, alteration or repair on the structural systems of a manufactured (mobile) home.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Certification as a Retailer of Manufactured Homes (DOS-1802)
Permit Description: Certification is required to engage in the retail selling or offering for sale, brokering or distribution of manufactured (mobile) homes to persons who purchase manufactured homes for purposes other than resale.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Certification as an Installer of Manufactured Homes (DOS-1705)
Permit Description: Certification is required to install or set up a manufactured (mobile) home for a buyer, including the affixation of a manufactured home to a foundation or supports at a building site; the assembly and fastening of structural components of manufactured housing, including the completed roof system; and the connection to electrical, oil, water, gas, sewage, and similar systems that are necessary for the use of the home for dwelling purposes. Installer's warranty seals are required for manufactured homes installed in New York State. Certified installers are permitted to service a manufactured home without obtaining a separate certification as a mechanic.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Limited Certification as a Manufacturer, Retailer, Installer or Mechanic of Manufactured Homes (DOS-1727)
Permit Description: Limited Certification as a manufacturer, retailer, installer or mechanic is issued to a person who is employed by a person or business entity that has obtained Certification as a manufacturer, retailer, installer or mechanic if such person satisfies all other standards for certification. Persons with limited certification shall act as a certified manufacturer, retailer, installer or mechanic only within the scope of their employment and certification shall cease to be valid if the employer ceases to be certified or if the person ceases to be employed by the employer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permits the conduct of recreational boat races, parades and events. Includes motorboat, personal watercraft, sailboat, canoe and other floating craft in the Adirondack Park only. Permits also covers on-water fireworks displays. Ensures adherence to boating concerns and all applicable rules and regulations. Addresses the protection of public safety crew or racing shell events sponsored by educational institutions or amateur rowing clubs are exempt from permit. Excludes these activities being held in the Adirondack or Catskill Parks, for permit requirements for the Adirondack or Catskill Parks contact the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Permit for Class A Marina in Lake George (marina appl)
Permit Description: Class A Marina is any facility located in whole or in part within the Lake George Park which provides services or berthing places for vessels by engaging in any of the following activities: (1) the sale of marine products or services, except for such sale as part of a dry land facility which does not quick launch vessels or regularly service vessels berthed on the waters of Lake George; (2) the sale, lease, rental or charter of vessels of any type; (3) the operation of a boat launch; (4) the offering of rides, instruction or water-based recreation for a fee; (5) the operation of a quick launch facility servicing the waters of Lake George regardless of the location where the vessels are stored; or (6) the storage, berthing or mooring of two or more motorized vessels and/or non-motorized vessels 18 feet in length, or more not registered to the owner of the property, regardless of remuneration or profit, except: (i) the use of residential or association docks, wharfs or moorings by the owner of the facility, the owner's family or the owner's gratuitous guest, or such use by a person as part of the single family residential rental of a residence or a residential unit which includes the use of a dock, wharf or mooring; (ii) docks, wharfs and moorings used as an accessory use to a hotel, motel, inn, housekeeping cottage, campground or recreational vehicle park, used exclusively by registered guests; (iii) docks, wharfs, and moorings used as an accessory use to a restaurant, used exclusively by patrons while dining at such restaurant; and (iv) docks, wharfs and moorings used exclusively by persons engaged in the sale of fishing products or the sale and service of SCUBA products.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Application for Marine District Party and Charter Boat (96-19-15-10)
Permit Description: Permit allows the operation of a party boat or charter boat for the purpose of taking or attempting to take marine fish for recreational purposes in the marine and coastal district or land fish taken outside the territorial waters of New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Food Fish and Crustacea Dealers and Shippers License (96-19-002- Text 12)
Permit Description: Allows a person (or employees of such person) to resale trade or barter marine food fish or crustacea, whether to be used as food or bait; to operate a facility for packing, holding or storing such marine food fish or crustacea prior to consignment, transport or sale; or to ship, transport or traffic in marine food fish or crustacea for resale, trade or barter to persons other than the final consumer within the state or export food fish or crustacea landed in New York to outside the state. Exemptions are for common carriers who transport marine food fish or crustacea and to holders of a food fish license, a lobster license, or a blue-claw crab license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Allows person to land food fish for commercial purposes. This license does not allow fishing in New York state waters, only the privilege of landing fish from outside New York's territorial sea. This permit is also known as: Food Fish Landing License.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Non-Resident Marine Commercial Food Fishing License (96-19-14-q)
Permit Description: Allows a person not domiciled in New York State to take and land food fish for commercial purposes. Allows for commercial netting and landing and sale of marine fish. Exemptions for small nets, bait traps, and angling (no sale). This permit is also known as: Food Fish (Non-Resident) License.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Resident Marine Commercial Food Fishing License (96-19-15 -q)
Permit Description: Allows person domiciled in the State to take and land food fish for commercial purposes. Allows for commercial netting and any sale of marine fish. Exemptions for small nets, bait traps and angling (no sale). This permit is also known as: Food Fish (Resident) License.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows the importation and introduction of live marine plant or animal life for cultivation purposes for each importation activity. This permit is only issued to holders of a marine hatchery permit or an on/off bottom culture permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: A marine hatchery permit entitles the holder to possess, raise and breed marine plant and animal life, including but not limited to shell fish, lobster, crab, shrimp and food fish to sell the products of a marine hatchery, where less than legal size, to other permitted marine hatcheries and culture permit holders.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Marine Regatta Permit (Adirondack and Catskill Parks)
Permit Description: Permits the conduct of recreational boat races, parades and events. Includes motorboat, personal watercraft, sailboat, canoe and other floating craft. Permits also covers on-water fireworks displays. Ensures adherence to boating concerns and all applicable rules and regulations. Addresses the protection of public safety crew or racing shell events sponsored by educational institutions or amateur rowing clubs are exempt from permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Alcoholic Beverage Control Marketing Permit (Three Years)
Permit Description: Permit authorizes an unlicensed out of state supplier or a licensed in state supplier to do tastings (using product from the applicant's or wholesaler's inventory);  to take orders for and/or forward orders to licensed wholesalers; and to market product in accordance with the provisions of the Consent Orders. If the permittee is from out of New York State then a current copy of the state license and a copy of the Federal Basic Permit is required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The supplier will obtain a transportation permit or contact with a company that has a transportation permit, in order to transport the alcoholic beverages to the event site;  No fee shall be charged by the supplier or wholesaler to a consumer attending or participating in such event;  Each sample shall be limited to:  in the case of beer, wine products and cider, to 3 ounces or less; in the case of wine, to 2 ounces; and in the case of liquor, to one-quarter ounce;  Liquor and wine used for tastings do not have to be price posted items.  Liquor and wine used for sales by the bottle must be price posted.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Alcoholic Beverage Control Marketing Permit (One Time)
Permit Description: This permit authorizes an unlicensed out of state supplier or a licensed in state supplier to do tastings (using product from the applicants' or wholesaler's inventory); to take orders for and/or forward orders to licensed wholesalers; and to market product in accordance with the provisions of the Consent Orders. If the permittee is from out of New York State then a current copy of the state license and a copy of the Federal Basic Permit is required.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The supplier will obtain a transportation permit or contact with a company that has a transportation permit, in order to transport the alcoholic beverages to the event site;  No fee shall be charged by the supplier or wholesaler to a consumer attending or participating in such event;  Each sample shall be limited to: in the case of beer, wine products and cider, to 3 ounces or less;  in the case of wine, to 2 ounces; and in the case of liquor, to one-quarter ounce;  Liquor and wine used for tastings do not have to be price posted items.  Liquor and wine used for sales by the bottle must be price posted.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permit to Hold a Mass Gathering (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Grants permission to hold a gathering which is likely to attract 5,000 or more people and continue for 24 hours or longer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: License for Business of Installing, Servicing or Maintaining Security or Fire Alarm Systems (DOS-1587-a)
Permit Description: This registration allows a master electrician to engage in the business of installing, servicing and maintaining security and fire alarm systems in the city or town in which they are licensed as a master electrician. If a master electrician wishes to engage in that business outside of that city or town, they must be licensed as a security and fire alarm installer pursuant to Section 69-m of NYS General Business Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Authorizes licensee to bring together boxers to take part in exhibitions.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Medicaid Managed Care Service (HMO Implementation Plan/PHSP Expansion Application)
Permit Description: A Certificate of Authority must be obtained to implement a Medicaid Managed Care service. A revised certificate is required to expand the Medicaid managed care service area.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Allows use of purse seine (a large commercial net) to take menhaden (a large herring from which oil and fish meal is prepared).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Approval of certificate of merger of public utility corporations is required by the New York State Public Service Commission to ensure that merger is in the public interest and that the merged company is financially viable.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Meter Service Provider/Meter Data Service Provider Eligibility Form
Permit Description: Required for providers other than the utilities to be eligible to perform meter and meter data services in New York. Metering services include meter installation, maintenance, testing and removal of meters and related equipment. Meter data services consist of meter reading, meter data translation, and customer association, validation, editing and estimation (CAVEE).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Approval of Utility Meters and Associated Devices
Permit Description: Any utility under the jurisdiction of the Public Service Commission must obtain approval of a meter before it can be used in New York State for the purpose of customer billing. Approval by the Commission ensures meter accuracy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Operate Migrant Farmworker Housing Facility (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Grant permission to operate a farmworker housing facility for seasonal agricultural workers. Applies to migrant farmworkers housing facilities occupied by five or more persons one or more of whom are employed to perform farm activities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Application to Receive and/or Process Milk and Milk Products - Part 2 (DMC M-1507)
Permit Description: Permit is required to process and sell dairy products in the State of New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to operate as a distributor to purchase packaged milk for resale.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Authorizes a change in the type of milk business activity to operate a new or add an additional plant or take over an existing business. Primary purpose of this permit is to provide notification so proposed changes can be reviewed and relevant provisions of the law are complied with.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to operate as a milk broker. A dealer can negotiate the purchase or sale of milk to or for another milk dealer. They are not allowed to purchase, take title of the milk, sell, or physically handle milk themselves.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to operate as a milk hauler only; transports the milk, in bulk, from farm to plant or from plant to plant or in packages form, for the account of another licensed milk dealer. They cannot buy or sell milk.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to operate as an operating cooperative. An operating cooperative is engaged in, either directly or by contracting or arranging for the marketing or handling of members milk under its control to buyers or through a milk plant. This includes such activities as operating a bulk tank route, directing the shipments of members milk, or by operating a plant or transfer station.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Required for any person who operates any single location or mobile unit which pasteurizes fluid milk or manufactures milk into other dairy products. Authorizes a milk dealer to operate a plant only. The dealer does not purchase or sell milk.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to handle (process, manufacture, distribute) milk that is produced on a dealer's own farm. To be used by milk dealers who sell exclusively milk produced by their own herd.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Authorizes a milk dealer to purchase milk from individual producers and/or cooperatives and/or other milk dealers for manufacturing use or to be processed for sale and distribution as fluid milk.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Name: Milk Dealer License - Small Store Operating as a Distributor (DISPS-7)
Permit Description: For store operators who purchase more than 3,000 pounds of milk per month and who transport such packaged milk to its own store for sale to consumers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Milk Dealer License - Store Selling Wholesale (DISPS-7)
Permit Description: Authorizes a store to sell milk to wholesale customers or to deliver milk to its own stores.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: New York Certified Milk Inspector Certificate (DMC-1502)
Permit Description: Certifies that the applicant is qualified to conduct inspections of dairy farms in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Name: Milk Producer Permit (Dairy Farm Inspection Report)
Permit Description: Permits a dairy farmer to sell milk to a cooperative or processor.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Allows the applicant to weigh or otherwise determine the volume or weight of milk, or shall sample milk when such samples are to be tested to determine the amount of component or components therein, where the result of such test is used as a basis for payment for such milk or for the purpose of official inspection or for public record.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Underground, surface mining, and reclamation. Removing greater than or equal to: 750 cubic yards or 1000 tons of minerals from the earth (such as: sand, gravel, shale, limestone, clay, sandstone) within any 12-month period or mining over 100 cubic yards minerals from or adjacent to any body of water not subject to the jurisdiction of NYS Environmental Conservation Law, Article 15 or the public land laws. Exemptions are activities of the NYS Office of General Services with respect to lands underwater, mining activities that fall below the tonnage or cubic yard criteria and the excavation, removal, and disposition of minerals from construction projects, exclusive of the creation of water bodies, or excavation in aid of agricultural improvement projects.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Mobile Car Crusher Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19, VS-144)
Permit Description: Allows a person to engage in business of operating a transportable car crusher but cannot acquire ownership of crushed vehicles. Regulates sale, registration and disposition of vehicles, thereby providing consumer protection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Operate Mobile Home Park (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Permit grants permission to operate a mobile home park with 5 or more sites, as required by the NYS Public Health Law and State Sanitary Code. If operating within the five boroughs of New York City (New York, Bronx, Kings, Richmond or Queens counties), contact the NYC Department of Buildings at 212-566-5000 and NYC Department of City Planning at 212-720-3291.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Certificate of Competence for Operator of Mobile Laser (SH-275)
Permit Description: Operators of mobile lasers are required to demonstrate adequate knowledge before being certified to use them independently. Professional engineers, land surveyors, and operators of mobile lasers used in research are exempt.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration of Mobile Lasers and Laser Installation (SH-280)
Permit Description: High Intensity lasers and low intensity lasers used exclusively in research must be registered with the Department and a person qualified to ensure laser safety must be designated.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Notice of Intent to Use Mobile Lasers at a Temporary Job Site (SH M-280.1)
Permit Description: This permit is issued when a high intensity laser is to be brought into the state for temporary industrial use. This is to ensure that a properly certified operator will use the laser, and to enable the Department of Labor to inspect operations if judged necessary.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Approval of depository agreement (money transmitter). To assure the safety of a required bond or pledge of assets to protect consumers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Engage in the Business of Issuing Travelers Checks, Money Orders, Prepaid/Stored Value Cards, and/or Transmitting Money (DFSMT, DFSMT Rev 10.03.2011)
Permit Description: A Money Transmitter is a business that issues and sells traveler’s checks, prepaid/stored value cards,  money orders, and transmits money on behalf of the public by any means including transmissions within this country or abroad by wire, check, draft, facsimile or courier. Generally, a money transmitter markets its services through a network of agents.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Uniform Mortgage Banker Branch Office Form
Permit Description: License required for licensed New York State mortgage bankers that solicit or process loans from locations other than its principal place of business, irrespective of whether the only contact such locations have with applicants is by internet, telephone, facsimile or other electronic process.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: License required for companies that engage in the business of making five or more mortgage loans on 1-4 family owner occupied residential property located in the State of New York. Making a mortgage loans means for compensation or gain either directly or indirectly, advancing funds, offering to advance funds, or making a commitment to advance funds to an applicant for a mortgage loan or a mortgagor as a mortgage loan.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Registration for exempt entities that engage in direct lending. Companies that are exempt from licensing under Part 39 of the General Regulations of the Banking Board must register for an exempt mortgage banker registration. They include subsidiaries of banks, insurance companies and credit unions as well as not-for-profit corporations engaging in mortgage loan origination activities. Companies exempt from licensing under Section 590.1 (e) of Article 12-D of the NYS Banking Law have the option of registering their company.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Required for registered New York State mortgage brokers that solicit or process loans from locations other than its principal place of business, irrespective of whether the only contact such locations have with applicants is by internet, telephone, facsimile or other electronic process.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Registration required to engage in the business of soliciting, processing, placing or negotiating mortgage loans for others, or offering to solicit, process, place or negotiate mortgage loans for others on 1-4 family owner occupied residential property located in the State of New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Registration for exempt entities that do NOT engage in direct lending. Companies that are exempt from licensing under Part 39 of the General Regulations of the Banking Board must register for an exempt mortgage broker registration. They include subsidiaries of banks, insurance companies and credit unions as well as not-for-profit corporations engaging in mortgage loan origination activities. Companies exempt from licensing under Section 590.1 (e) of Article 12-D of the NYS Banking Law have the option of registering their company.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mortgage Guaranty Insurance Agent's License - Individual (MGINDOrig)
Permit Description: Authority to act as agent in the writing of mortgage guaranty insurance. Gives the authority to transact the business of mortgage guaranty insurance in this state for the particular insurance company named in the application and license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Mortgage Guaranty Insurance Corporation License - Domestic (UCAA Form 1, Form-3)
Permit Description: Allows an organization of a domestic stock mortgage guaranty insurance company in New York to sell mortgage guaranty insurance. "Mortgage Guaranty insurance" means insurance against financial loss by reason of nonpayment of any sum required to be paid under the terms of an instrument of indebtedness (mortgage) secured by a lien on real estate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mortgage Guaranty Insurance Corporation License - Foreign (UCAA Form 1, Form-3)
Permit Description: Admission of a foreign mortgage guaranty insurance company in New York to operate an mortgage guaranty insurance company. "Mortgage Guaranty insurance" means insurance against financial loss by reason of nonpayment of any sum required to be paid under the terms of an instrument of indebtedness (mortgage) secured by a lien of real estate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: An individual who engages in the business of mortgage loan originating with respect to New York residential real estate must obtain a license from the NYS Banking Department. A mortgage loan originator (MLO) is an individual who for compensation or gain or in the expectation of compensation or gain takes a residential mortgage loan application or offers or negotiates terms of a residential mortgage loan. Each MLO must be an employee or an independent contractor of an ??originating entity?. An originating entity includes a licensed mortgage banker or registered mortgage broker. It may also include other entities approved by the NYS Banking Department (such as those involved in the financing of manufactured homes). An individual who, as an originating entity or any stockholder of an originating entity, engages in mortgage loan originating activities or supervises persons engaged in loan processing or underwriting, must registered as an MLO. A loan processor or underwriter is an individual who performs clerical or support duties as an employee at the direction of, and subject to, the supervision and instruction, of a licensed MLO. Individuals engaged solely in loan processor or underwriter activities, certain individuals who are real estate brokers, or an individual engaged in extensions of credit for timeshare plans generally are not included in the definition of mortgage loan originators. Except if the individual is working as an independent contractor of an originating entity. An individual employed by a bank, trust company, private banker, bank holding company, savings bank, savings and loan association, thrift holding company or credit union organized under New York State law, another state, or the United States, or subsidiary or affiliate of such bank, trust company, private banker, bank holding company, savings bank, savings and loan association, thrift holding company or credit union does not need a MLO license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Uniform Mortgage Branch Office Form - Servicer
Permit Description: Registration required for licensed New York State mortgage loan servicers that engage in loan servicing activities from locations other than its principal place of business, irrespective of whether the only contact such locations have with borrowers is by internet, telephone, facsimile or other electronic process.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: A mortgage loan servicer is any person or entity in the business of servicing residential mortgage loans. Servicing includes receiving any scheduled periodic payments from a borrower pursuant to the terms of any mortgage loan, including amounts for escrow accounts, and making payments to the owner of the loan or other third parties of principal and interest and such other payments with respect to the amounts received from the borrower as may be required pursuant to the terms of the mortgage loan documents or servicing contract. In the case of a home equity conversion mortgage or reverse mortgage, servicing includes making payments to the borrower.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Mutual Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion Application, Form 1E, Form 2E, Form 3)
Permit Description: License to operate an insurance business to sell fire, theft, property, etc. insurance in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation License for Admission to New York - Foreign
Permit Description: Admission of foreign mutual property/casualty insurance company to New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Exempt Mortgage Loan Servicers are loan servicers that are exempt from full registering provisions but intend to service mortgages in the state. They are subject to business conduct requirements and business background and financial responsibility requirements. Each exempt person must notify the Superintendent of Financial Services that it is acting as a mortgage loan servicer in this state and they must comply with all other regulations applicable to mortgage loan servicers. Full registration provisions do not apply to the following: Any Insurance company, banking organization or foreign banking corporation licensed by the Superintendent or the Comptroller of the Currency to transact business in New York State; Any national bank, federal savings bank, federal savings and loan association, federal credit union, or any bank, trust company, savings bank, savings and loan association or credit union organized under the laws of any other state or US instrumentality with the power to make mortgage loans; Licensed Mortgage Bankers; Registered Mortgage Brokers; and any person who is employed by a Mortgage Banker, Mortgage Broker, Mortgage Loan Servicer or other Exempt Organization, to assist in the servicing of Mortgage Loans for that employer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description:
A transporter is any person who has the use or control, or the right to the use or control, of any means of transportation used in transporting motor fuel, including a barge, truck, railroad car, or pipeline. 

You must register to obtain a license as a motor fuel importing/exporting transporter if you are a transporter who:
• transports motor fuel into New York State for use, distribution, storage, or sale in New York State; or 
• transports motor fuel in New York State to a point outside New York State.

Resources:
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Name: Approval of a Motor Vehicle Accident Prevention Course (DS-951)
Permit Description: Allows businesses to conduct motor vehicle accident prevention courses for point insurance and liability insurance reduction purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permit for Experimental Use of New Pesticides (44-19-9)
Permit Description: A permit is issued for the shipment, delivery, or use of a pesticide product which is to be tested to determine the scope of limitations of its usefulness and effect of its use on human life and the environment.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Motor Vehicle Repair Shop Original Facility Application (VS1, VS-19, VS-145)
Permit Description: To perform mechanical and/or body work to motor vehicles or diagnosing motor vehicle malfunctions. To promote highway safety by requesting proper repair of motor vehicles (including emergency vehicles) and to provide consumer protection. Activities allowed: repair of motor vehicles for compensation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Municipal Cooperative Health Benefit Plans (MCH1 - MCH14)
Permit Description: A municipal cooperative health benefit plan is a self insured entity formed by five or more school districts for the purpose of providing medical surgical or hospital services to its employees by way of a group contract and premium equivalent rates.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows a person to register private property as a "muskrat marsh." A registered muskrat marsh may be trapped, pursuant to a permit to trap, during an otherwise closed season.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Application to Trap on Registered Marsh
Permit Description: Allows a person to trap on a registered muskrat marsh during an otherwise closed trapping season.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Formation of a Mutual Holding Company by a Mutual Savings Bank
Permit Description: A mutual savings bank may reorganize so as to cause its deposit taking and other activities to be conducted by a stock savings bank subsidiary of a mutual holding company, formed for such purpose. The plan of reorganization must be approved by the superintendent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Formation of a Mutual Holding Company by a Savings and Loan Association
Permit Description: A mutual savings and loan association may reorganize so as to cause its deposit taking and other activities to be conducted by a stock savings and loan subsidiary of a mutual holding company, formed for such purpose. The plan of reorganization must be approved by the superintendent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Life Insurer License - Domestic (UCAA-Primary Application, Form 1P, Form 2P, Form 3)
Permit Description: To ascertain and mandate a level of financial wherewithal so that it will be able to meet the needs of the consumers of this state for the foreseeable future.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Life Insurer License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion Application, Form 1E, Form 2E , Form 3)
Permit Description: Admission of a foreign stock life insurance company to write life insurance business described in Article 42. To ascertain and mandate a level of financial wherewithal so that it will be able to meet the needs of the consumers of this state for the foreseeable future.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation License - Domestic (UCAA - Primary Application, Form 1P, Form 2P, Form 3P)
Permit Description: Allows an organization of a domestic mutual property/casualty insurance company to sell fire, theft, property, etc.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Savings Banks and Savings & Loan Associations - Authorization to Amend Organization Certificate
Permit Description: Allows a mutual savings bank or a mutual savings and loan association to amend its organization certificate for the purpose of changing the corporation's name.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Mutual Trust Investment Company Charter, Authorization Certificate
Permit Description: Authorization that allows the business of a mutual trust investment company to be conducted. The purpose is to ensure that the formation of the company is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual to provide the services of cutting, shaping and enhancing the appearance of the nails of the hands and feet. Permit also includes the application and removal of artificial nails.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Certificate of Filing on Names, Marks, Devices on Certain Vessels (DOS-242)
Permit Description: A Certificate of Filing may be made with the Department of State to show ownership of any word, name, symbol, picture, design or any combination of these, on vessels, receptacles or utensils.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Authorization to Acquire a National Bank by Merger
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a national bank to be merged with and into a state bank. The purpose is to ensure that the merger is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows sales of handicrafts at Niagara Reservation State by Native Americans.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual to perform services to the hair, head, face, neck and scalp, including shampooing, arranging, cutting, shaving, twisting, weaving and braiding. The license does not permit the application of dyes, reactive chemicals or other preparations to color, straighten or curl hair.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Statement of Load Test for Passenger Carrying Amusement Device (SH P-88)
Permit Description: Statement of Load Test is required prior to the initial operation of certain amusement rides. Tests can be performed either in the presence of an inspector or the manufacturer, a representative of the liability insurance carrier or a licensed professional engineer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: This permit allows duly authorized representatives of the applicant to negotiate and consummate an agreement for the establishment of an operating agency relationship for the distribution in New York State of the products of an out-of-state manufacturer or wholesaler.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The permittee shall not offer for sale, solicit or accept any order in New York State for the sale of any alcoholic beverages;  Samples of the alcoholic beverages manufactured or sold by the applicant shall not be imported into New York State until such permit is issued;  Negotiations shall only be with a wholesaler who is authorized under their license to keep and offer for sale such alcoholic beverages;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each wholesaler with whom negotiations are to be conducted;  Only a duly authorized representative of the applicant shall negotiate the agency agreement on behalf of the out-of-state licensee and such representative shall be in possession of appropriate credentials evidencing his authority;  Where any person not designated in this application is so authorized, notification of such authorization shall be forwarded within 10 days of the Liquor Authority;  If there are any changes in any of the facts set forth in this application, a supplemental statement giving notice of such change shall be delivered to the Liquor Authority within 10 days after such change.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: This permit allows duly authorized representatives of the applicant to negotiate and consummate an agreement for the establishment of an operating agency relationship for the distribution in New York State of the products of an out-of-state manufacturer or wholesaler.  This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The permittee shall not offer for sale, solicit or accept any order in New York State for the sale of any alcoholic beverages; Samples of the alcoholic beverages manufactured or sold by the applicant shall not be imported into New York State until such permit is issued;  Negotiations shall only be with a wholesaler who is authorized under their license to keep and offer for sale such alcoholic beverages;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each wholesaler with whom negotiations are to be conducted;  Only a duly authorized representative of the applicant shall negotiate the agency agreement on behalf of the out-of-state licensee and such representative shall be in possession of appropriate credentials evidencing his authority;  Where any person not designated in this application is so authorized, notification of such authorization shall be forwarded within 10 days to the Liquor Authority;  If there are any changes in any of the facts set forth in this application, a supplemental statement giving notice of such change shall be delivered to the Liquor Authority within 10 days after such change.
