Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: New York State-Bred Thoroughbred Foals Registration
Permit Description: A thoroughbred horse must have be foaled in New York state and the dam of such foal must meet New York domicile requirements of either resident for 1997 and subsequent years (be continuously in residence in New York state from no later than 90 days after her last cover in the year of conception and thereafter remain in residence until foaling in New York state or for non-residents must foal in New York state and be bred-back to a registered New York stallion and thereafter remain in New York state for a continuous period of 90 days after giving birth to such foal.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A stallion standing in New York State at the time he was bred to the Dam of a New York-bred. A stallion must be registered with the New York State-Bred Registry and must be either owned by a resident of this state and standing the entire season in this state; or owned by a resident of another state but standing the entire stud season in this state and leased by a resident of this state for a term of not less than two years.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: NY State Thruway Credit Agreement (TA-W51312, TA-W5181, TA-W5106, TA-W68161, W-9 or W-8, TAP601)
Permit Description: This credit agreement allows companies or individuals using trucks or buses on the Thruway to establish charge accounts to charge tolls, receive discounts and have documentation for exemption from TMT for miles driven on the NYS Thruway.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the manufacturer of non-beverage products to purchase liquor, wine or beer from duly licensed manufacturers or wholesalers for use in the process of the manufacturer of such products.  A letter from the U.S. Treasury Department classifying the products as exempt from Special and Commodity Taxes must be provided.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The liquor, wine or beer will be used only in the process of manufacture of the non-beverage products described;  The liquor, wine or beer will not be offered for sale nor sold in this state;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made;  The liquor, wine or beer will be delivered directly to the manufacturing establishment of the permittee and will not be stored elsewhere in the state;  Only liquor, wine or beer in the original sealed containers which comply with the provision of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers may be purchased, unless otherwise specifically authorized by the permit;  Records will be kept for two years of all purchases.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits

Permit Name: Approval Review of Personalized Recovery Oriented Services (OMH 167)
Permit Description: An agency proposing to operate an outpatient program (such as an assertive community treatment; clinic; comprehensive psychiatric emergency program (CPEP); continuing day treatment; day treatment; intensive psychiatric rehabilitation treatment; and partial hospitalization) or proposing significant changes to a program for persons with mental illness must submit an Application for Prior Approval Review for review and approval prior to providing services. An agency proposing to offer a Personalized Recovery Oriented Services (PROS) program must file application form OMH 167, Application for Prior Approval Review Personalized Recovery Oriented Services (PROS) Program.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the manufacturer of non-beverage products to purchase liquor, wine or beer from duly licensed manufacturers or wholesalers for use in the process of the manufacturer of such products.  A letter from the U.S. Treasury Department classifying the products as exempt from Special and Commodity Taxes must be provided.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The liquor, wine or beer will be used only in the process of manufacture of the non-beverage products described;  The liquor, wine or beer will not be offered for sale nor sold in this state;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made;  The liquor, wine or beer will be delivered directly to the manufacturing establishment of the permittee and will not be stored elsewhere in the state;  Only liquor, wine or beer in the original sealed containers which comply with the provision of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers may be purchased, unless otherwise specifically authorized by the permit;  Records will be kept for two years of all purchases.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Name: Human Tissue/Non-Transplant Anatomic Bank License (DOH-2973, DOH-2973 (e-f), DOH-2973(i) DOH-2973(a))
Permit Description: A license is required for any person or facility that solicits, retrieves, performs donor selection and/or testing, preserves, transports, allocates, distributes, acquires, processes, stores or arranges for the storage of nontransplant anatomic parts, including bodies, body parts, organs, or tissues from living or cadaveric donors, for education or research purposes conducted at another facility.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Grants the appointee limited power as a public officer to the extent of being able to take acknowledgements and administer oaths within the State of New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Notice of Compliance with Disability Benefits Law (DB-120)
Permit Description: A Notice of Compliance advises employees with whom their employer has disability benefits insurance coverage and how to file a claim for an off-the-job injury or illness. Employers may obtain this coverage either through a private insurance carrier, through the New York State Insurance Fund, or becoming authorized by the Board to be self-insured. Employers must obtain this form from their insurance carrier or licensed agent. This form is not filed. It must be completed with identifying insurance information and displayed in the workplace.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Name: Notice of Compliance with Workers Compensation Law (C-105)
Permit Description: A Notice of Compliance is a posting requirement which advises employees with whom their employer has workers' compensation insurance coverage and how to file a claim for an on-the-job injury. Employers may obtain workers' compensation coverage either through a private insurance carrier or through the New York State Insurance Fund. Upon securing of workers' compensation insurance or Board-approved self-insurance. Employers must obtain this form from their insurance carrier or licensed agent. This form is not filed. It must be completed by the insurance carrier, self-insured administrator or the Board's Self-Insurance Office with identifying insurance information and then displayed by the employer in the workplace.
Permit Categories: Employer Information

Permit Description: Whenever an institution's shareholders are required to vote, the Department must review and clear the proxy materials to ensure that all disclosures are included.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License as a Premium Finance Agency - Change in Control (DFSPF)
Permit Description: Obtains regulatory approval for change in control of a licensed premium finance agency.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Notification Filing for Real Estate, Securities or Theatrical Syndications (Form-99)
Permit Description: Notification filing pursuant to National Securities Markets Improvement Act of 1996 (NSMIA). All persons engaged in an offering of or transaction in securities or theatrical syndications within or from New York must file. No filing is required for listed securities. Any person engaged in a offering or transaction of real estate syndications must file as well.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: Allows the licensee to act as an agent for a property owner or lessee to take, temporarily possess, transport, and release or humanely destroy nuisance wildlife, at any time whenever the wildlife becomes a nuisance, destroys property or menaces an individual or domestic animal.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: "Nursery dealer" means any person, firm, partnership, association or corporation, It is not a grower or an original producer of nursery stock in New York that buys, acquires, or receives on consignment nursery stock for the purpose of reselling, transporting, or otherwise disposing of the same. The certificate registers nursery dealers as selling only certified stock and is required as a condition of sale. Persons desiring to sell, or handle for sale, or otherwise dispose of nursery stock in New York must register unless they are registered as, or plan to register as, a Plant Grower.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: License allows individual to practice nursing home administration at any certified nursing facility in New York State. The purpose is to insure quality of services in New York State nursing homes through the establishment of standards of education, training and experience for the person administering such facilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Permit is required for bulk milk haulers whose vehicle exceeds the maximum legal weight to operate on the New York State Thruway.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Certifies a person to provide direct personal resident care and services including, but not limited to, safety, comfort, personal hygiene or resident protection services, for compensation, under the supervision of a registered professional nurse or licensed practical nurse in a long term care residential health care facility (nursing home facility) and to be listed on the NYS Residential Health Care Facility Nurse Aide Registry. To obtain nurse aide certification and be listed in the NYS Residential Health Care Facility Nurse Aide Registry, an individual must successfully complete a New York State approved residential health care facility nurse aide training program and pass the New York State authorized clinical skills competency examination and written or oral competency examination. An individual who provides services to residents only as a feeding assistant does not need this certification. NYS-trained graduate nurse, NYS-licensed Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse are not required to complete further training to obtain certification.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: New York State Thruway Authority Occupancy Permit (TA-W41337)
Permit Description: An occupancy permit authorizes the use of property within the New York State Thruway right-of-way. It includes, but is not limited to, parking, modification(s), vegetable gardens, pipelines, electric and telephone wires, cable television wires, fiber optic cables, etc. The permittee is responsible for the installation, maintenance, repair and restoration of Thruway Authority property during original construction and the term of the occupancy.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Certification by design architects and engineers that building construction projects were designed and constructed in compliance with applicable codes per Title 19 NYCRR Part 448
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Description: Permission to erect an off-premise advertising sign on private lands within the Adirondack and Catskill Parks. To ensure appropriate and aesthetically pleasing signage in Parks.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous

Permit Description: Provides for registration of offering statements by those offering for sale subdivided vacant land situated outside of New York or in New York if sold on an installment plan to ensure that the land is as described and that the purchaser is guaranteed deed of ownership when the contract of sale is completed. The requirements for Offering Statements are found in Section 135.2 of Part 135 of Title 19 of the New York Code of Rules and Regulations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: Allows operation on State Parkway and access in State Park parking lot reserved for tour bus operators.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows operation on State Parkway and access in State Park parking lot reserved for tour bus drivers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows a person to teach curricula areas they are approved for in a license private school. This permit is valid for only three years.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: Allows the holder to raise, breed, or grow marine plant and animal life, including containment on, or in, any rack, raft, float, cage, or similar structure and/or in any natural waters of New York state. Products are raised for eventual sale as a food product. The Temporary Marine Area Use Assignment Program is issued in association with this permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: New York State Out-of-State Direct Shipper's License (Wine) (29)
Permit Description: Allows a legal entity such as an individual or sole proprietorship, partnership, or a corporation entity that holds a basic permit to manufacture wine issued by the U.S. Department of Treasury's Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau and who holds a wine manufacturer's license issued by a State other than NYS and who by virtue of such out-of-state wine manufacturer's license is authorized to sell wine produced by the manufacturer at retail, packaged in sealed containers for consumption off the winery premises, to customers for personal use and NOT for resale. This license will authorize the out-of-state wine manufacturer to directly sell and ship to a NYS resident customer limited quantities of wine produced by the Out-of-State Wine Manufacturer of up to but no more than 36 cases of wine (no more than 9 liters each case) per year directly to the NY resident of legal age.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: A permit authorizing the erection and maintenance of off-premises advertising signs adjacent to the interstate and federal aid primary highway system subject to control under the Highway Beautification Act. New York must provide continuing "effective control" of outdoor advertising or be subject to a loss of ten percent of their federal aid highway funds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Outpatient Facility for the Developmentally and Mentally Disabled Operating Certificate (OMR O-1)
Permit Description: Allows operation of a facility for the examination, diagnosis, care, treatment, rehabilitation or training of the mentally disabled on an outpatient or nonresidential basis.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Approval of Plans for Aerial Tramway, Chair, Gondola, J-Bar, T-Bar, Rope Tow, Poma Lift, Skimobile, Etc. (SH-706)
Permit Description: Ensures the proper construction, installation and/or modification of passenger tramways
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Application/Change Form For a Patient Service Center (PSC) (DOH-1589)
Permit Description: Allows a permitted clinical laboratory facility to operate a collecting station also known as a patient service center for the collection, drawing and/or temporary storage of materials derived from the human body, until forwarded to the clinical laboratory for testing. Patient Service Centers may be a fixed or mobile facility.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Permit to Peddle in State Park Camping Areas
Permit Description: Permit identifies and regulates vendors at campsites selling products such as newspapers, charcoal and ice. Ensures that park patrons and campers are not unduly disturbed and that vendors comply with Tax Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permission for Bank to Add an Increase in the Value of Bank Premise to Gross Income
Permit Description: This permit allows a bank to add to gross income an increase in the value of real estate or building(s) used as its place of business. The purpose is to ensure that a bank's profits are properly computed and not overstated. Also applies to savings banks and savings and loan associations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permit to Do Work on or to Use Property Owned by or Under the Jurisdiction of the Power Authority (Recreational or Agricultural) (PA-39)
Permit Description: Permit allows bearer to use land controlled or owned by the Power Authority for recreational or agricultural use. Permit insures that the intended use will be compatible with the Authority's use of subject property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Permit for Use of State-Owned Property
Permit Description: This permit allows for the temporary use and/or occupancy of properties controlled by the Department of Transportation. This permit is a 30-day revocable permit. Activities may be residential or commercial. A permit enables the Department of Transportation to maintain control over the use of its property. Permit Exemptions: Permit not required for municipal water and sewer lines which are in improved highway corridor. Permit not required for residential utility line crossings. Permit not required for the use of property by a public utility incorporated pursuant to the provisions of the Transportation Corporation Law in which the use occupies an improved highway corridor. This exemption primarily applies to crossings and longitudinal occupancies of non-freeway right of way and crossings of freeway right of way. It does not apply to longitudinal occupancies of freeway right of way.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit for Directional Signs on State Property (ROW 332-3A)
Permit Description: Directional signs serve two purposes: They provide directional information to business establishments offering goods and services deemed necessary or of interest to motorists, and they provide alternate directional signing for those businesses who were required to remove their advertising signs as a result of Section 88 of the Highway Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Do Work On or To Use Property Owned by or Under the Jurisdiction of Power Authority (PA-39)
Permit Description: Permit allows bearer or its contractor(s) to construct, install, operate, maintain, repair, replace, and remove facilities on land owned in fee by the Power Authority and easements under the jurisdiction of the Power Authority. Permit insures that intended use will be compatible with and not damage the facilities or uses of the Power Authority.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Install a Traffic Control Signal on State Owned Property (SM P-00001)
Permit Description: An agreement allowing private interests to install a traffic control signal on New York State highways at intersections with private roads.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Commercial Pesticide Applicator Certification allows an individual to purchase or apply restricted use pesticides, supervise the commercial application of pesticides, register a pesticide business or agency, or apply for a commercial permit to sell pesticide products.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Certification allows an individual to purchase and use restricted pesticides for the production of agricultural commodities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A business registration certificate and vehicle decals allows a certified commercial applicator to operate a business to commercially apply pesticides. An agency (generally a state or local government entity or school) requires an agency registration to apply pesticides to its own property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Pesticide Commercial Permit (Sale of Restricted Pesticides)
Permit Description: This permit is issued to persons seeking to distribute, sell, offer for sale, purchase for the purpose of re-sale, or possession for the purpose of resale of restricted pesticides. A commercial permit holder is allowed to legally sell restricted pesticides to other commercial permit holders, certified pesticide applicators and purchase permit holders. Types of businesses requiring this permit are: farm supply stores, pesticide manufacturers, pesticide distributors, agricultural pesticide dealers, turf supply businesses, and pest control supply businesses.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: To view applicable laws for mobile home parks, please see NYS Legislature's Real Property Law, Article 7 through the link below.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: The registration of all pesticides that may be offered for sale, use, and distribution in New York state is required. The registration is for a period of two years. Any product that is registered by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency must also be registered by New York. Under no circumstances does NYS register products when these products are not registered by U.S. EPA.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Commercial Pesticide Technician Certification allows an individual, who is at least 17 years of age, to purchase or apply general use pesticides or apply restricted use pesticides under the direct supervision of a certified commercial pesticide applicator.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Apply Pesticide for the Control of Undesirable Fish (44-19-6)
Permit Description: Allows the holder to use chemicals for the control or extermination of undesirable fish in any waters of New York state. Treatment must be done to the entire lakes and ponds including any tributary systems.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Use a Pesticide for the Control of an Aquatic Pest (AQV)
Permit Description: Allows the holder to use chemicals for the control or elimination of biting aquatic insects such as mosquitoes and black flies in any waters of New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Use a Pesticide for the Control of Aquatic Vegetation
Permit Description: Allows the holder to use chemicals for the control or elimination of aquatic vegetation in any waters of the New York state. Chemicals that are allowed are: copper sulfate for algae, diquat for submerged and emergent vegetation, and low-volatile esters, salts and amnes of 2,4-D for emergent vegetation. Other chemicals may be authorized when it is evident that their use will conform with the intent and purpose of law and regulations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License to Operate Pet Cemeteries and Pet Crematoriums (DOS P-a)
Permit Description: Permit allows an individual or a company to engage in the business of operating a pet cemetery or pet crematorium.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Allows any person, firm, corporation, partnership, or other association who engages in the sale or offering of more than nine dogs and/or cats per year directly to the public for profit. Exemptions of this license are duly incorporated humane societies, individuals or businesses selling less than 9 dogs and/or cats per year; and breeders who sell less than 25 dogs and/or cat born and raised on the breeder's residential premise.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Pet Food and Specialty Pet Food Registration (FSI-435)
Permit Description: Allows someone to manufacture or distribute pet foods or specialty pet foods. Each brand or brand type must be registered. The brand label and product analysis must accompany the registration. Purpose of the registration is to safeguard pets, consumers, and the pet industry in New York and to insure that the products are accurately and completely labeled.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Registration is required for all facilities having an aggregate storage capacity for petroleum or petroleum products of 1,101 to 399,999 gallons or any tank whose capacity is greater than 110 gallons where 10% or more of the volume of the tank is underground. Heating oil tanks less than 1,100 gallons are excluded from this registration requirement. Registration is made with the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation, except in the following four counties: Nassau, Suffolk, Rockland and Westchester. Program delegation has been made to these counties by NYS DEC and registration is made with these counties directly through the county's health department. Transfer of ownership requires registration application along with any test results. This petroleum tank registration requirement also satisfies compliance with 6 NYCRR Part 230 Vapor Recovery Requirements.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: All major petroleum facilities having storage capacity of 400,000 gallons or more of petroleum are required to have a license from the Department of Environmental Conservation. This license controls the transfer and storage of petroleum, and provides a fund to ensure prompt cleanup and removal and swift and adequate compensation to restore businesses and others damaged by petroleum discharge. Types of major facilities are: storage terminals, refineries, manufacturing, utilities, railroad, vessel/barge, pipelines, etc.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Photography/Film Permit for Parks and Historic Sites
Permit Description: This permit is required for photography or filming for commercial or publicity purposes. It allows OPRHP to establish conditions to prevent damage to park and historic site resources or undue disturbance to park patrons.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: License entitles the holder, an employee of a carrier of freight by water, a Stevedore or other person, to directly or indirectly supervise he work of registered longshoremen and checkers at piers or other waterfront terminals in the Port of New York and New Jersey.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows the permittee to possess a piranha for exhibition purposes. This permit is no longer of natural resource protection need or concern but is required by law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Certificate of Compliance for Place of Public Assembly
Permit Description: Certificate is issued to those businesses inspected under the provisions of the Labor Law that indicates that the place of business is in conformance with the code. This certificate is not required in New York City.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Registration and Certification as a Plant Grower (PI-69)
Permit Description: Persons operating a business in which nursery stock (trees, shrubs, plants, flowers, etc.) is propagated, grown or cultivated for the purpose of distribution or selling the same as a business shall register as a Plant Grower. Plant growers are not required to obtain a certificate as a Nursery Dealer to sell their nursery stock.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to purchase, receive or sell alcoholic beverages or receipts, certificates, contracts or other documents pertaining to alcoholic beverages, in cases not otherwise expressly provided for by this chapter, when in the judgment of the Liquor Authority such would be appropriate and consistent with the purpose of this chapter.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of the law with respect labels and size of containers will be sold;  The permittee will comply with the rules and regulations of the State Tax Department.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Authorizes a summer or winter license to store alcoholic beverages in the licensed premises after the expiration of the license period.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Allows the applicant to permanently plug and abandon a well and allows the applicant to obtain a release of their financial security. This is the most important phase in the life of a well. It makes sure that the plugging is done properly according to technical and environmental standards to guarantee no underground pollution of aquifers. The NYS Department of Environmental Conservation reviews the applicant's proposed procedure to ensure that a proper mix of cement and other materials are placed in appropriate locations in the well bore so as to permanently prevent the immigration of fluids from one underground zone to another.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: The Superintendent of State Police may appoint persons as police officers for any corporation owning or operating a railroad express company or steamboat company. The Superintendent of State Police files the Certificate of Appointment with the Department of State. The Secretary of State in turn issues the license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: This license is required for individuals who guard cargo on piers or other waterfront terminals in the New York/New Jersey Harbor as well as those involved with the movement of waterborne freight in the New York/New Jersey Harbor. License entitles holder, an employee of a carrier of freight by water or the operator of any pier or other waterfront terminal to guard  or protect  property on any pier or other waterfront terminal in the Port of New York and New Jersey as required by the Waterfront Commission Act.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: License to Possess and Sell Protected Wildlife (82-19-48-10d)
Permit Description: Allows a qualified individual to possess and/or sell protected fish, wildlife, shellfish, crustacea, or aquatic insects for propagation, scientific, or exhibition purposes only. Animal possessed under a Possess and Sell license may only be sold to individuals in New York state, who possess a valid license for propagation, scientific, or exhibition purposes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: This license allows qualified individuals to possess, transport, import or export, or cause to be transported, imported, or exported any of the following live wildlife: all subspecies of lion (Panthera leo), the raccoon dog (Nyctereutes procyonides), any animal with the overall appearance of which makes it impossible to distinguish from a wolf (Canis lupus) or a Coyote (Canis latrans), any raccoon, or native or non-native wildlife or fish, shellfish, crustacea, aquatic insects, bird's nests, venomous reptiles, or eggs for the following purposes: of propagation, banding, scientific or exhibition. This license does not include endangered or threatened species.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Permit to use Pound or Trap Net (MCR-13)
Permit Description: Allows the holder to operate a pound or trap net in specific waters of Little and Great Peconic Bay in Suffolk County. The net must not interfere with navigation or shellfish culture.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: License as a Premium Finance Agency (DFSPF)
Permit Description: A premium finance company enters into premium finance agreements with an insured person or acquires premium finance agreements from insurance agents or brokers or other premium finance agencies. A premium finance agreement is an arrangement under which a premium finance agency or an insurance broker or agent advances funds to an insurance company to pay an insurance premium on behalf of the insured and receives repayment by the insured over a period of time.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Enter into Premium Finance Agreement (Annual License Fee Letter)
Permit Description: License to enter into premium finance agreements with insureds or to acquire same. To insure proper disclosures and practices.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Prepaid Health Services Plan (PHSP) Certification for New York State (DOH-793C)
Permit Description: A Certificate of Authority must be obtained to operate a managed care organization whose enrollees are substantially persons eligible to receive comprehensive health services under Title XIX of the Federal Social Security Act or other public programs. The application describes the proposed organization and operation of a Prepaid Health Services Plan.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Authorization Certificate of Private Banking Charter
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a private banker business to be conducted. The purpose is to ensure that the formation of the firm will enhance public convenience and advantage. A private bank is a bank owned by an individual or a partnership. A private bank may engage generally in the full range of commercial and investment banking activities, except that it cannot take deposits.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: License allows an individual or company to engage in the business of conducting investigations to locate the whereabouts of missing persons, find the location or recover lost or stolen property, find the causes and origin of, or responsibility for fires, libels, losses or accidents, or injuries to real or personal property. Private Investigators conduct investigations for a fee, hire, or reward.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Permit allows a licensed private investigator or bail enforcement agent to operate a branch office in addition to the private investigator/bail enforcement agent's primary office. A separate license is required for each branch office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Allows a person to recruit students to attend a private (trade) school.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: Allows a person to serve as a director of a licensed private school.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: Allows a person to serve as a director of a private school for one year only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Private School for the Mental Disabled Operating Certificate (CON, OMR P-1)
Permit Description: Allows the provider to operate a private school for the mentally retarded.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: License/Registration to Operate a Private School in New York State (BPSS-1)
Permit Description:
This license allows the operation of a non-degree private school in New York state. Private schools are all other schools, including for-profit schools that provide instruction in and/or preparation for high school equivalency examinations to out-of-school youth or adults.

Before prospective school owners decide to pursue school licensure, they should be certain that the owner and the institution comply with all of the requirements set forth in Education Law and Commissioner's Regulations. 

The Bureau of Proprietary School Supervision (BPSS), within the Office of Adult Career and Continuing Education Services (ACCES) of the State Education Department, has simplified the licensing process so that all institutions that can satisfy the required standards can achieve licensure or registration. If your institution is seeking licensure, read the applicable laws and regulations and policy guidelines. Follow the steps in the "Summary of Licensing Steps" in working with BPSS to secure the appropriate licenses

To open additional schools, you must complete your first renewal as a private career school. Renewals are done every two years.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Description: Allows a person to teach curricula areas they are approved for in a licensed private school. This permit is valid for only one year.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Licensed Private Career School Teacher Application (Permanent) (BPSS-16)
Permit Description:
Allows a person to teach a curricula area they are approved for in a licensed private school.

Please note that Private Career School Teacher Licenses are ONLY VALID at private career schools licensed by the Bureau of Proprietary School Supervision (BPSS). These teacher licenses cannot be used by individuals to conduct or advertise for training outside of a licensed private career school setting nor are they meant to endorse or legitimize the teaching abilities of the teacher other than to indicate that he/she qualifies to teach the subject listed at a BPSS-licensed private career school.

Read all of the enclosed material to determine whether you qualify for a permit or license and to determine the appropriate instructional area(s) for which you should apply. A permit or license may be issued for one area depending upon applicant qualifications. The BPSS office will only evaluate an applicant for the area requested on the application. However, an applicant should not apply for licensure in areas for which (s)he does not qualify since the evaluation process may be prolonged while the Bureau awaits additional transcripts or documentation of experience. An evaluation cannot be made without an application and non-refundable fee. Once the evaluation is performed, the fee is earned regardless of whether a teaching credential is issued. Appeals of evaluations must be made in writing within thirty (30) days following the issuance of the evaluation.

Further information and instructions are available at the Bureau of Proprietary School Supervision (BPSS) webpage below.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation, Certificate of Recognition as an Accredited Reinsurer - Mutual Foreign
Permit Description: Certificate of recognition is issued by the Superintendent to a foreign mutual accredited property/casualty insurance company in New York allowing the company to engage in the business of life insurance, annuities, title insurance, mortgage guaranty insurance, or financial guaranty insurance.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: DMV Application for Registration Processing by Private Sector Partners (PSP-1)
Permit Description: Contract between business partners and DMV which allows on-site procurement of vehicle registrations and other documents through a computer system linked directly to DMV. Appropriate registration/title transactions are: registrations, re-registrations, amended registrations, duplicate registrations, duplicate titles, registration renewals, plate surrenders, replacement of lost/stolen plates, custom plates, title only (for lease buybacks) and in-transit permits (if appropriate to business).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: License to Operate a Private Service Bureau or Open a Branch Office (MV-372, MV-521.1)
Permit Description: License to engage in the business of assisting for-hire in securing licenses to drive motor vehicles, or registrations or titles of motor vehicles. Exemption: A NYS Licensed Motor Vehicle Dealer is not required to obtain a license as a private service bureau in order to engage in the business of assisting for hire in securing registrations or titles of motor vehicles for customers who have purchased vehicles from them, but a license is required if a dealer engages in the business of assisting in securing registrations or titles for the general public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A processing plant superintendent certificate is issued to a person who will take charge of milk processing plants and designates this person as the one in charge of all sanitary requirements including pasteurization at that plant.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Exemption for a professional employer organization business that does NOT maintain an office in New York, AND does NOT engage in direct solicitation of business in New York, AND does NOT have more than twenty-five (25) worksite employees in New York, AND is licensed to do business as a PEO in another state that has the same or greater requirements as New York.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Registration allows any person whose business is entering into professional employer agreements with clients. In determining whether the professional employer organization employs all or a majority of the employees of a client. Typical services provided may include payroll administration, employee benefits design and administration, tax administration, and compliance with tax and workplace legislation. Temporary help firms and employment agencies are exempt for this registration.
Permit Categories: Employer Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Authorizes any person, and in the case of a corporate promoter shall include any officer, director, employee or stockholder thereof, to produce, arrange, or stage any professional boxing or wrestling contest or exhibition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Producer Application for Property/Casualty Agent's License - Entity (PCEntityOrig)
Permit Description: A license allowing an partnership to solicit the public for the sale of property and casualty lines of insurance and to receive commissions from the insurance company on business written.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Producer Application for Property/Casualty Agent's License - Individual (PCINDOrig)
Permit Description: A license allowing an individual to solicit the public for the sale of property and casualty lines of insurance and to receive commissions from the insurance company on business written.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Producer Application for Broker's License - Entity (BR-Entity.Orig, ProducerSupp Stmt)
Permit Description: A license allowing an entity (corporation, partnership and limited liability company), through its sub-licensees, to transact insurance business in such manner as to safeguard the interests of the insured and allows it to place insurance with, and receive commission from, authorized insurers in New York state. Authority to sell all kinds of insurance except life insurance, annuities, and bail bonds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Producer Application for Broker's License - Individual Form (BRINDOrig)
Permit Description: A license allowing an individual, through its sub-licensees, to transact insurance business in such manner as to safeguard the interests of the insured and allows it to place insurance with, and receive commission from, authorized insurers in New York state. Authority to sell all kinds of insurance except life insurance, annuities, and bail bonds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation, Certificate of Recognition as an Accredited Reinsurer - Alien
Permit Description: Certificate of recognition is issued by the Superintendent to an assuming insurer not authorized to do business in New York but which is in compliance with conditions prescribed by regulations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Application for Reinsurance Intermediary's License (Individual) (Form RI-1)
Permit Description: A license authorizing an individual to act in soliciting, negotiating, or procuring the making of any reinsurance contract or binder, or to accept any reinsurance contract or binder on behalf of an insurer.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application to Receive/Process Milk and Milk Products (Raw Milk) (DMC-1507 (Rev. 5/06))
Permit Description: This is a permit issued to a dairy farmer granting permission to sell raw milk directly to the public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Property/Casualty Insurance Corporation, Certificate of Recognition as an Accredited Reinsurer - Stock Foreign
Permit Description: Recognition of a foreign stock accredited property/casualty insurance company in New York. A corporation engaged in the business of property/casualty insurance may not engage in the business of life insurance, annuities, title insurance, mortgage guaranty insurance or financial guaranty insurance.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Protection of Waters Permit (Supplement D-1, Supplemental D-2, Joint Application Form)
Permit Description: (Construction, Reconstruction or Expansion of Docks, Moorings and Platforms; Excavation and Fill-in Navigable Waters; Disturbance to the Bed or Banks of Protected Streams) This permit allows an applicant to perform an activity or build a structure that will impact the bed or banks of a body of water such as filling or dredging in navigable waters; construction, reconstruction, or modifications of certain docks, mooring areas, and platforms or other navigable waters. It is required to minimize the disturbance of streams and water bodies to prevent the unreasonable erosion of soil, increased turbidity of the waters, irregular variations in velocity, temperature and level of the waters, the loss of fish and aquatic life, the destruction of natural habitat and the danger of flood or pollution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Permission to Establish, Maintain and Operate a Public Accommodation Office (PAO)
Permit Description: A banking organization may apply for approval to establish and operate not more than one public accommodation office as an adjunct to each of its branch offices.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Public Adjuster's License  - Entity (PA-Entity.Orig, IA/PSupp Stmt, EMP-1)
Permit Description: Allows an entity (corporation, partnership, or limited liability company) to act on behalf of an insured in negotiating the settlement of a claim for loss or damage caused by fire occurring in this state; to advertise or solicit employment as an adjuster, and to provide the same service for another public adjuster.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows the holder to act on behalf of an insured in negotiating the settlement of a claim for loss or damage caused by fire occurring in this state; to advertise or solicit employment as an adjuster, and to provide the same service for another public adjuster.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for Examination of Plans for Public Assembly (SH-700)
Permit Description: To provide information on applicant, premise and project activities for new or altered buildings to be used as places of public assembly. "Places of public assembly" shall include (1) a theater, (2) moving picture house, (3) assembly halls maintained or leased for pecuniary gain where one hundred or more persons may assemble for amusement or recreation, except (a) halls owned by churches, religious organizations, granges, and public association and free libraries as defined by section 253 of the education law, and (b) hotels having fifty or more rooms.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Permit to sell articles or commodities on public campgrounds. Items include: food products, non-alcoholic beverages, ice, charcoal, fuel wood, boats, canoes, and newspapers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permits operation of a vessel carrying passengers for hire. Evidence the vessel has satisfactorily passed an annual safety inspection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: License to Operate a Public Vessel for Hire
Permit Description: Permits licensee to operate public vessels carrying passengers for hire on sole state waters not subject to U.S. Coast Guard jurisdiction. Type of license, limitations, endorsements are printed on form for one of the following categories: Joint Pilot & Engineer, Joint Pilot & Engineer (water skiing only), Master, Master (apprentice), Engineer (steam), or Engineer (motor).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Approval of Plans for Public Water Supply Improvement (DOH P-348)
Permit Description: Allows the bearer to construct a new public water supply system or improve, modify or extend an existing system, including fluoridation. This permit ensures that there should be adequate water quantity and satisfactory quality.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Dispensation of Hours in Public Works Projects (PW-30)
Permit Description: A dispensation permitting employees on public work projects to work more than eight hours per day and/or more than five days per week in cases of extraordinary emergency, including fire, flood or other danger to life or property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Purchasing Group Registration (Part A, Part B)
Permit Description: Registers a group formed pursuant to the federal liability risk retention act of 1986 which has as one of its purposes, the purchases of liability insurance on a group basis; purchases such insurance only for its group members and only to cover their similar or related liability exposure, is composed of members whose businesses or activities are similar or related with respect to the liability to which members are exposed by virtue of any related, similar, or common business, trade, product, services, premises, or operations; and is domiciled in any state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: State Licensed Real Estate Appraiser Application (Assistant) (DOS-1432 -a)
Permit Description: Allows an individual to work and train under the supervision of a certified real estate appraiser. Appraisals require cosign involving a federally related real estate transaction over the deminiumus level.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Pyrotechnician's Certificate of Competence (SH 870, SH872, id-5dol)
Permit Description: Allows a person to perform the preparation for and the firing of pyrotechnics displays in New York. The certification is to protect the public from the hazards associated with pyrotechnics. Certification insures that only persons of proper ability and experience shall engage in such uses and operations. Pyrotechnics means any combustible or explosive compositions of manufactured articles designed and prepared for the purpose of producing audible or visible effects that are commonly referred to as fireworks.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Application to Conduct Quarter Horse Race Meetings
Permit Description: A license to conduct quarterhorse race meetings. To insure that horse racing is conducted under New York state rules and to encourage quarterhorse breeding. Please note quarterhorse racing has not been conducted since 1986.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A license is required of all individuals who will participate in any activity at pari-mutuel harness or thoroughbred race meets in New York State. The purpose is to maintain proper control over race meetings conducted pursuant to New York state law. All natural persons must obtain an occupational license. Examples include: managing owner, racing owner, trainer, assistant trainer, jockey, jockey apprentice, jockey agent, veterinarian, farrier, stable employee, track supplier, equipment supplier, salesman, security, concession operator.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A license to conduct race horse meetings by business corporations. To insure that horse racing is conducted under New York state rules and to encourage thoroughbred horse breeding.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A license to conduct race horse meetings by non-profit franchise racing associations. To insure that horse racing is conducted under New York rules and to encourage thoroughbred horse breeding.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Radiation control permits are required for certain discharges of radioactive material to the environment. This permit is issued for radioactive discharges to air and water, for incineration of radioactive waste, or for environmental studies using radioactive material. There are exemptions for very low levels of radioactive emissions to air.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration of Generally Licensed Radiation Device (SH-2)
Permit Description: Certain devices containing radioactive sources are permitted to be acquired without prior approval, but with subsequent registration. The registrant is authorized to use the device for certain purposes and must comply with regulatory requirements. Registration is needed to track the whereabouts of all devices and ensure proper disposal.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Radiation Equipment Safety Officer Certification/Recertification Application (DOH - 2481)
Permit Description: Certification of private individuals to perform surveys of dental, podiatric, and veterinary facilities as required by Part 16 of the State Sanitary Code.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: Registration required for all radiation producing equipment in New York State to provide accountability and to ensure safety standards and compliance through inspections. Any person, place, facility, or mobile unit where ionizing radiation equipment installation (x-ray equipment or device that can emit radiation by virtue of the application of high voltage) is maintained and operates in the healing arts or in educational institutions must register. Examples of places, facilities, or mobile units are: hospital; medical, dental, chiropractic, osteopathic, podiatric or veterinarian institution, clinic or office; an educational institution; a commercial, private or research laboratory performing diagnostic procedures or handling equipment or material for medical use; or any trucking, storage, messenger or delivery service establishment. X-ray facilities operating in New York City must register with the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's Office of Radiological Health at 212-676-1580. X-ray facilities operating outside of New York City must register with the NYS Department of Health's Bureau of Environmental Radiation Protection. The owner/operator of the x-ray equipment is solely responsible for the registration of their x-ray equipment. The forms filed by the installer of the x-ray system do not ensure that the x-ray equipment is properly registered.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: License to use types and quantities of radioactive materials which require more control than just registration. Applicant must submit detailed information on facilities, procedures, and training and experience of staff. Guides are provided to assist in preparing submittals.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: State Certified Real Estate Appraiser Application (General) (DOS-1432-a)
Permit Description: Allows an individual to perform all types of commercial and residential appraisals to real property. It allows the use of the title "Certified General Real Estate Appraiser". Under federal law, allows an individual to perform appraisals in federally related real estate transactions.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: The filing of a offering statement or prospectus for the contemplated offering which shall contain information and representations required by NYS General Business Law, Article 32-A for real estate securities to be offered in or from New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Description: Allows licensee to transfer, receive, use or have possession of radioactive materials. Radioactive material is any solid, liquid, or gas which emits radiation spontaneously. Radioactive materials can consist of byproduct material, source material, special nuclear materials in quantities not sufficient to form a critical mass, naturally occurring radioactive materials, and accelerator-produced radioactive material. License ensures that radioactive materials are handled by qualified persons in a safe manner. Places, facilities or mobile units that handle radioactive materials consist of: hospitals; medical, dental, chiropractic, osteopathic, podiatric, or veterinarian institution, clinic or office; educational institution; commercial, private or research laboratory performing diagnostic procedures or handling equipment or material for medical use; or any trucking, storage, messenger or delivery service establishment.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Notice of Proposed Temporary Industrial Use of Radioactive Material (Under Reciprocity) (DOSH R-240)
Permit Description: Companies outside of New York State, which are licensed by another state or the USNRC to use radioactive materials in another state, can apply for reciprocity to permit the same uses in New York State for 30 days in a year. Notice is necessary so we can review the company's license to be sure it is current and so we can inspect their activities in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Radiologic Technologist Intravenous Contrast Media Certification
Permit Description: Certificate allows a licensed and registered radiologic technologist to administer and inject contrast media while assisting a licensed practitioner who is physically present in the examination room during the course of the performance of the examination. Certification recognizes that the licensed and registered radiologic technologist has received training in the recognition of adverse reactions to intravascular contrast media and in cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: License allows a person to apply radiography to a human being, under the supervision of a professional medical practitioner, for diagnostic purposes. Radiography includes x-ray or radiology, computer tomography (CT), angiography, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), mammogram, and ultrasounds. The license reduces the possibility of unnecessary exposure to radiation which would result from equipment operation by inadequately trained persons.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Registration allows a licensed radiologic technologist (diagnostic) to practice radiography in New York State. Radiography includes x-ray or radiology, computer tomography (CT), angiography, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), mammogram, and ultrasounds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: License allows a person to apply radiopharmaceutical or nuclear medicine to a human being, under the supervision of a professional medical practitioner, for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes radiopharmaceutical or nuclear medicine. Nuclear Medicine consists of radioactive material that is injected, swallowed, or inhaled and gives off gamma rays, which are detected by a special gamma camera or other probe.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: License allows a person to apply radiation therapy to a human being, under the supervision of a professional medical practitioner, for therapeutic purposes. Radiation therapy is the use of an external beam and remote after loading brachytheary equipment for the application of high energy ionizing radiation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Registration allows a licensed radiologic technologist (therapy) to practice radiation therapy in New York State. Radiation therapy is the use of an external beam and remote after loading brachytheary equipment for the application of high energy ionizing radiation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Games of Chance License, Raffles (GC-2, GC-2A, GC-2B, GC-7R, GC-RCF, GCVS-1, GCVS-2)
Permit Description: This license allows an authorized organization to conduct raffles. The license allows an organization to derive net proceeds or net profits from raffles in the amount less than $30,000 during one occasion or part thereof in a calendar year. If a raffle amount is over $30,000, an additional license must be obtained from the local municipality as well. This license is issued by the local municipality. Certain authorized organizations may conduct a raffle without complying with this license if the organization will derive net proceeds from raffles in an amount less than $5,000 during the conduct of one raffle and shall derive net proceeds from raffles in an amount less than $20,000 during one calendar year.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: The Superintendent of the New York State Police may appoint and designate "railroad police", "steamboat police" or "express police". Certification grants approval to any corporation owning or operating a railroad, express company operating over a railroad, or a steamboat company to appoint any person as a policeman for the perseveration of order and of public peace upon the property under the control of the corporation, an express company or a steamboat company. After the superintendent of police grants approval, a license is issued to the designated person by the NYS Department of State. The purpose of this commission is to regulate watch, guard, patrol and private investigating agents and agencies.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Application for exemption from filing requirements based on the fact that the offering is private.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: State Certified Real Estate Appraiser Application (Residential) (DOS-1432-a)
Permit Description: Allows an individual to perform residential appraisals of one to four family residential units, the appraisal of vacant or unimproved land that is to be utilized for an one to four family residential unit, or the appraisal of vacant or unimproved land for which the highest and best use is an one to four family residential unit all without regard to value or complexity. It allows the use of the title "State Certified Residential Real Estate Appraiser". Under federal law, allows an individual to perform appraisals in federally related real estate transactions. A certified residential real estate appraiser cannot appraise residential subdivisions but can appraise individual properties within a subdivision.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: State Licensed Real Estate Appraiser Application (Residential) (DOS-1432-a)
Permit Description: Allows an individual to perform noncomplex appraisals of one to four family residential units having a transaction value of less than $1,000,000 and complex one to four family residential units having a transaction value of less than $250,000. It also allows the appraisals of vacant or unimproved land to be utilized for an one to four family residential unit or the highest and best use of an one to four family residential unit with a transaction value of less than $1,000,000. It allows the use of the title, "State Licensed Residential Real Estate Appraiser". Under federal law, allows an individual to perform appraisals in federally related real estate transactions.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Real Estate Branch Office Application (DOS-0039 INST)

Brokers licensed as real estate brokers by the NYS Department of State pursuant to Article 12-A of the NYS Real Property Law and who are not acting as dealers are exempt from this requirement, unless they are selling time share interests. All sponsors, selling agents and brokers of time share interest must register as broker-dealers with the NYS Department of Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the holder to act as an agent for another for a fee, in negotiations for the purchase, sale or rental of real property or for the negotiation of a mortgage secured by real property. Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Real Estate Qualifying Course Approval Application (DOS-1503, DOS-1765)

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A registration requirement for salespersons who are employees of broker-dealers registered with the NYS Department of Law or Associate Real Estate Brokers who are engaged in sales activities of cooperative interests in realty. A real estate salesperson or an associate real estate broker licensed by the NYS Department of State pursuant to Article 12-A of the NYS Real Property Law and who are not acting as dealers are exempt from this requirement, unless they are selling time share interests. All salespersons and associate brokers of time share interest must register as a salesperson with the NYS Department of Law. NOTE: For the purposes of this filing, associate real estate brokers are considered salespersons unless they are partners of the broker-deals or if they act as broker-dealers on their own behalf.

A salesperson cannot operate independently.

Permit Description: This permit allows institutions to maintain representative offices in this State. The purpose is to ensure that banking business will not be conducted at the site.

Permit Description: The Department requires electric utilities to directly meter all end users supplied with electricity so users would receive individual bills and have recourse to the Department for resolution of complaints about the utility. However, in certain instances, submetering is allowed if direct metering is not feasible or if there are economic benefits to submetering. Submetering is the practice of reselling electricity to tenants in a building whose owner buys the electricity through a single meter from the utility. Separate meters for tenants may or may not be used. There is no standard permit. The Public Service Commission authorizes submetering by memorandum.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Residential Health Care Facilities Operating Certificate(Nursing Homes) (CON, DOH-155)
Permit Description: A residential health care facility is a nursing home or a facility providing health-related services. The operating certificates are issued following Certificate of Need (CON) approval. The CON review process determines whether a proposed facility or service meets a public need, is financially feasible and is to be offered by owners and operators who are of sound character and professional competence. Issuance of an operating certificate attests that the facility meets all code requirements -- operational, structural, staffing -- which helps ensure quality and safety of service.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Registration Requirement for Residual Petroleum Products
Permit Description:
You must apply for registration if you:

• import (or cause to be imported) any residual petroleum product into New York State for use, distribution, storage, or sale in New York State;
• produce, refine, manufacture, or compound residual petroleum product within New York State; or
• sell residual petroleum product in New York State.

Permit Description: Allows a retail establishment or section of a retail establishment to offer food and food products to consumers intended for off-premise consumption. The following do NOT qualify for an Article 28A Retail Food Store License: Establishments that handle only pre-packaged, non-potentially hazardous foods; Roadside markets that offer only fresh fruits and vegetables for sale; Stores that conduct food processing (cappuccino, slicing cold cuts, making sandwiches); Food service establishments (cafe's/restaurants); or Juice bars or food and beverage vending machines. Retail food establishments requiring the Article 28A license are identified by the sale of any of the following: Milk; Shell eggs; Refrigerated meats; and/or other potentially hazardous foods.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing, Beverage Processing, Beverage Manufacturing (Non - Alcohol),Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Authorizes a licensed winery to sell wine at retail in sealed containers to a regulatory organized church, synagogue, or religious organization for sacramental purposes and to a householder for consumption at home.
