Permit Name: Registration Requirement for Diesel Motor Fuel
Permit Description:
There are three types of diesel motor fuel registrations:
• distributor of diesel motor fuel,
• retailer of non-highway diesel motor fuel only, and
• distributor of kero-jet fuel only. 

Distributor of Diesel Motor Fuel:

You must apply for registration as a distributor of diesel motor fuel if you: 
• import (or cause to be imported) any diesel motor fuel into New York State (other than fuel imported in the tank of a vehicle for its operation);
• produce, refine, manufacture, or compound diesel motor fuel within New York State; or
• sell diesel motor fuel in New York State (except diesel motor fuel sold to customers and delivered directly into the fuel tank of a motor vehicle, boat, or aircraft for its operation).

As a distributor of diesel motor fuel, you may sell non-highway diesel motor fuel and highway diesel motor fuel.

Non-highway diesel motor fuel is any diesel motor fuel that is designated for use other than on a public highway (except for the use of the public highway by farmers to reach adjacent land) and is dyed diesel motor fuel.

Highway diesel motor fuel is any diesel motor fuel that is not non-highway diesel motor fuel.

Retailer of Non-highway Diesel Motor Fuel Only (RONDO):

You may apply for a retailer of non-highway diesel motor fuel only if you import (or cause to be imported) into or sell in New York State non-highway diesel motor fuel that you will sell to customers.

A RONDO may not purchase undyed diesel motor fuel, including undyed qualified biodiesel, for resale, and may not produce, refine, manufacture, or compound diesel motor fuel in this state.

   
Distributor of Kero-jet Fuel Only:

You may apply for a limited registration as a distributor of kero-jet fuel only if:
• you are a fixed-based operator in New York State, and
• all your sales of kero-jet fuel are delivered directly into the fuel tank of an airplane for use in its operation.

As a distributor of kero-jet fuel only, you are also permitted to import (or cause to be imported) kero-jet fuel into New York State.

Permit Name: Authorization for a Stock-Form Bank/Savings and Loan Association to Amend Organizational Certificate
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission for a stock-form savings bank or savings and loan association to make changes to its Organization Certificate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for a Stock-Form Bank/Savings and Loan Association to Restate Organizational Certificate
Permit Description: This permit allows the Superintendent to grant permission for a stock-form savings bank or savings and loan association to restate its Organization Certificate to reflect any changes that have been made.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Savings & Loan Association to Open and Occupy a Branch Office (BR)
Permit Description: To permit a savings and loan association to establish a branch office. To ensure safe and sound operation.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Stock-Form Bank/Savings and Loan Association to Have Excess or Fewer Number of Directors
Permit Description: This permit allows a stock-form savings bank or stock-form savings and loan association, with the approval of the Superintendent, to have a higher or lower number of directors than stated in the statute.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for a Savings Bank to Establish a Life Insurance Department
Permit Description: A savings bank may apply for the Superintendent's approval to establish a life insurance department to sell savings bank life insurance.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for a Savings Bank to Exercise Trust Powers
Permit Description: A savings bank may apply for Banking Board authorization to exercise trust powers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization to Open a Savings Bank Branch Office (BR)
Permit Description: Gives permission for a savings bank to open a branch office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization of Conversion of a Savings Bank from a Mutual to Stock Form of Organization (FORM 86-AC)
Permit Description: Authorization permits the change from a mutual organization to a stock form of ownership. The purpose would be to permit an institution to raise capital from the market. It provides for the organization and operation of Stock-form Savings Banks and Savings and Loan Associations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization of Savings Bank to Form Holding Company
Permit Description: Allows a savings bank to form a holding company in connection with the conversion of a mutual institution.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Savings Bank to Invest in Bank Premises in Excess of Statutory Limits
Permit Description: A savings bank may apply for approval to exceed the 5% of assets limitation for investment in plots and buildings for the transaction of its business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Savings Bank to Establish and Operate a Public Accommodation Office (PAO)
Permit Description: A savings bank may apply for approval to establish and operate not more than one public accommodation office as an adjunct to each of its branch offices.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Authorization that allows the business of a savings bank or savings and loan association to be conducted. The purpose is to ensure that the chartering will enhance public convenience and advantage without creating unsound and destructive competition.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association to Convert from National to State Charter
Permit Description: A savings bank or a savings and loan association may apply for the Superintendent's approval to convert from national charter to a state charter.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association Branch Closing Notice
Permit Description: A banking organization shall submit to the Superintendent a report of its planned closing of a branch office. Purpose is to allow the Superintendent to assess the impact of the branch closing on the affected community.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Merger of a Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association into a Bank/Trust Company
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a savings bank or savings and loan association to be merged with and into a bank or trust company. The purpose is to ensure that the merger is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Merger of a Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association into a Savings Bank
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a savings bank or savings and loan to merge with and into another savings bank. The purpose is to ensure that the merger is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Merger of a Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association into a Savings & Loan Association
Permit Description: Authorization that allows a savings bank or a savings and loan to merge with and into another savings and loan association. The purpose is to ensure that the merger is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for a Savings Bank/Savings & Loan Association to Invest in Subsidiaries
Permit Description: With prior notice to the Superintendent, institutions may invest in service corporation subsidiaries, which engage in activities as permitted by regulations. Application must be made for approval of the Banking Board for investment in a service corporation engaged in any other activity.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Amendments to a savings and loan association's bylaws require the superintendent's prior approval. Purpose is to determine that any changes are in compliance with laws and regulations.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization of a Savings & Loan Association to Exercise Trust Powers
Permit Description: A savings and loan association may apply for Banking Board authorization to exercise trust powers.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for Conversion of Savings & Loan Association from a Mutual to Stock Form of Organization (FORM 86-AC)
Permit Description: Authorization permits the change from a mutual organization to a stock form of ownership. The purpose would be to permit an institution to raise capital from the market. It provides for the organization and operation of Stock-form Savings Banks and Savings and Loan Associations.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission for Savings & Loan Association to Invest in Bank Premises in Excess of Statutory Limits
Permit Description: A savings and loan association may apply for approval to exceed the 5% of assets limitation for investment in plots and buildings for the transaction of its business.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for Permission to Establish, Maintain and Operate a Public Accommodation Office (PAO)
Permit Description: A savings and loan association may apply for approval to establish and operate not more than one public accommodation office as an adjunct to each of its branch offices.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate

Permit Name: Permit to Salvage and Relay Scallops
Permit Description: Allows the permittee to salvage and transplant bay scallops (Argopecten irradians) at any age to prevent destruction from predators, wind and tidal action, or other causes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: New York State School-Age Child Care Initial Application (Rev.09.00)
Permit Description: Allows for care to be provided on a regular basis to seven or more children enrolled in kindergarten or a higher grade, who are younger than thirteen years old,  or are incapable of caring for themselves. Programs operate before and/or after school and during school holidays and vacations.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Scrap Collector Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19)
Permit Description: Allows a person to engage in the business of the collection of miscellaneous scrap for disposal, or who may collect vehicular parts as scrap as an incident of their business. Provides consumer protection and safety of parts. Government agencies do not need a permit to collect or sell scrap.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Scrap Processor Original Facility Application (VS-1, VS-19)
Permit Description: Entitles the person to purchase material which is or may have been a vehicle or vehicle part for processing into a form other than a vehicle or vehicle part as metallic or non-metallic scrap, BUT who does not sell any such material as a motor vehicle, a trailer, or a major component part. Regulates the sale, registration and disposition of motor vehicles providing consumer protection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment (SBIRT) Training Provider Certification (PDS-39.1, PDS-39.2, PDS-39.3)
Permit Description: Certification allows an entity (accredited colleges and universities, governmental agencies, professional organizations, training institutes, in-service training programs, qualified trainers, distance learning providers and special events/conference sponsors) to offer course work/training to ensure the qualifications of instructors and the training curricula is in compliance with NYS Regulations, Part 853. Only SBIRT course work/training submitted to, and approved by NYS OASAS may be identified and promoted by a Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment (SBIRT) Provider through its Certificate.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Revocable Permit for Scuba and Skin Diving
Permit Description: Permit identifies divers using State Park facilities and provides conditions which assure respect for underwater resources and enhances and safety of divers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: New York State Thruway Sealed Marine Container Permit (TA-W-68173)
Permit Description: Allows the movement of sealed marine containers on the NYS Thruway to and from seaports and foreign countries. The containers must be of legal dimensions and not to exceed 125 percent of legal weight (100,000 lbs).
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Annual permit is issued to recreational vessels for the term of the navigation season (typically May through November). Cost of permit is based on vessel length.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: All securities broker-dealers who are member of, or have applied for membership in the National Association of Securities Dealer and is engaged in the sale of securities in New York, must file with the Central Registration Depository system.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Broker-Dealer (Non NASD) (M-1, DOS-125, NYF-5 or Form U-2)
Permit Description: Allows any person, firm, association or corporation engaged in the business of buying and selling securities from or to the public within or from New York for his or its own account or of effecting transactions in securities for the account of others within or from New York.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Issuer Broker-Dealer (NYS Form M-11, DOS-125, Form U-2)
Permit Description: Allows an issuer to register for the purpose of being able to sell its own securities to the public. Allows any person, firm, association or corporation engaged in the business of buying and selling securities from or to the public within or from New York for his or its own account or of effecting transactions in securities for the account of others within or from New York.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Issuer Broker-Dealer (Exemption) (NYS Form RI-1, IPS Instruction Sheet for 359-f (2), ATS-1)
Permit Description: Grants an exemption to any person, partnership, corporation, company, trust or association which is a broker- dealer solely by reason of the fact that it is offering to sell or selling or offering to purchase or purchasing to or from the public, within or from New York any one or more of the securities which are specified in any one or more of the paragraphs of Subdivision 2 of Section 359-f. It is an exemption from some of the registration requirements.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Issuers Broker-Dealer of Open End Investment Company (NY Form NF, DOS-125, Form U-2)
Permit Description: Allows open-end management companies registered with S.E.C. to register for the purpose of being able to sell securities to the public in New York.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: To transfer the registrations of several salespersons at one time from one registered NASD member brokerage firm to another. A mass transfer allows the representatives to be systematically terminated with the predecessor firm and registered with the successor firm without requiring submission of Form U4 and U5 filings. To learn more about the mass transfer process and whether it would be suitable for your firm, contact the NASD Gateway Call Center at (301) 869-6699 and ask to speak with a mass transfer representative.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Salesperson of NASD Member Firm (Form U4)
Permit Description: A salesperson employed by a firm that is a member of the National Association of Securities Dealer and is engaged in the sale of securities in New York, must file with the Central Registration Depository system.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Securities Salesperson of Non-NASD Member Firm (NY Form M-2, M3)
Permit Description: To register a personas a non-NASD member firms employed by a broker or dealer engaged in the buying and selling of stocks, bonds and other securities.
Permit Categories: General Business Information,Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows an individual employed in New York as a security guard to principally perform one or more of the following functions for the protection of individuals and/or property from harm, theft or other unlawful activity; deterrence, observation, detection and/or reporting of incidents in order to prevent any unlawful or unauthorized activity including but not limited to unlawful or unauthorized intrusion or entry, larceny, vandalism, abuse, arson or trespass on property; street patrol services; or response to but NOT installation or service of security alarm system alarm installed and/or used to prevent or detect unauthorized intrusion, robbery, burglary, theft, pilferage and other losses and/or to maintain security of protected premises. Exemption: active police officers and federally regulated personnel.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: A registration required when a private or public entity employs individuals, other than peace and police officers, to perform security services. These proprietary entities are considered Security Guard Companies but are exempt from the licensure requirement but must register.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Security Dealers, Brokers and Salespersons Designation - State Notice
Permit Description: Security dealers, brokers and salespersons who are non-residents of New York State and who will sell securities in New York State are required to obtain legal jurisdiction to engage in this business by filing with the Department of State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: License for Business of Installing, Servicing or Maintaining Security or Fire Alarm Systems (DOS, 1587a)
Permit Description: Permit allows a person or company to engage in the business of installing, servicing or maintaining security or fire alarm systems to detect intrusion, break-in, movement, sound or fire. A license is not required to install systems on motor vehicles, boats or airplanes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: The permit allows commercial harvesters working on privately owned underwater lands to possess and transplant shellfish of less than legal size.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Name: License to Sell Securities of Unlicensed Insurer (Corporation)
Permit Description: Allows one to sell securities issued by or for the benefit of an insurer not licensed to do business in New York state. There are exemptions set forth in 11 NYCRR, Section 7.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Sell Securities of Unlicensed Insurer (Individual)
Permit Description: Allows one to sell securities issued by or for the benefit of an insurer not licensed to do business in New York state. There are exemptions set forth in 11 NYCRR, Section 7.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: License to Sell Securities of Unlicensed Insurer (Partnership)
Permit Description: Allows a partnership to sell securities issued by or for the benefit of an insurer not licensed to do business in New York state. There are exemptions set forth in 11 NYCRR, Section 7.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Registration with the New York State Insurance Department grants the authority to act as service contract (warranties/warranty) provider pursuant to Article 79 of the New York Insurance Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Registration with the New York State Insurance Department grants the authority to act as service contract (warranties/warranty) provider pursuant to Article 79 of the New York Insurance Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Registration with the New York State Insurance Department grants the authority to act as service contract (warranties/warranty) provider pursuant to Article 79 of the New York Insurance Law.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Real Estate,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: The term "servicemark" means any word, name, symbol or device or any combination thereof used by a person to identify and distinguish the services of one person, including a unique service, from the services of others, and to indicate the source of the services, even if the source is unknown. Titles, character names used by a person, and other distinctive features of radio or television programs may be registered as servicemarks not withstanding that they, or the programs, may advertise the goods of the sponsor. Registration of a servicemark is made to show ownership of a mark and to provide protection to the mark itself. Each mark must be reviewed to determine if it so resembles a previously filed mark as not to cause confusion, mistake or deception.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Registration of a Shared Health Facility (SHF)
Permit Description: For the registration of a Shared Health Facility, the activities allowed include a wide range of professional services such as dentistry, medicine, podiatry and chiropractic. The registration is required by Article 47 of the Public Health Law as a way to regulate practitioners in private practice who have a high volume of Medicaid patients.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Allows the holder who is classified as a "grower" cultivate and market shellfish harvested from those waters designated as "certified" on the permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows a person not domiciled with New York state to take shellfish from under water lands in the state for commercial purposes. If the applicant is under the age of 16, a parent or guardian must sign for the permit. The permittee cannot ship or sell shellfish except to a holder of a valid shipper's permit. Shellfish such as: hard clams, mussels, oysters and soft clams.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Allows a New York State resident, who has been a resident of New York for at least six months, to take shellfish from under water lands in the state for commercial purposes. If the applicant is under the age of 16, a parent or guardian must sign for the permit. The permittee cannot ship or sell shellfish except to a holder of a valid shipper's permit. Shellfish such as: hard clams, blue mussels, oysters and soft clams.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: Allows shellfish culturists to import shellfish of less than legal size or legal into New York state for cultivation purposes. This permit is only issued to holders of a marine hatchery permit or any on/off bottom culture permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows the holder to harvest shellstock from designated uncertified shellfish lands and to transport and/or sell the shellstock to a designated shellfish microbiological cleansing facility only which holds shellstock in tanks of clean and sanitary water of proper salinity and temperature for the purposes of reducing the numbers of fecal coliform bacteria for use as food for human consumption. Harvested shellfish for microbiological cleansing must be placed in containers clearly and permanently labeled "cleansing" as soon as possible after such shellfish have been harvested.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Entitles the holder to operate a facility for the microbiological cleansing of shellfish harvested from designated uncertified waters of the state. Shellfish harvested under direct supervision by the department are placed in tanks and depuration for a minimum of 48 hours. After the requested testing, the shellfish may be sold as a food product.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: The permit authorizes the harvesting and surveying of shellfish in uncertified waters of New York state, for the purpose of determined the quantity of shellfish in a specific location. Population surveys are undertaken as part of shellfish management programs.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Shellfish Shipper's and Processor's (Class A) Permit (96-19-002 -Text 12)
Permit Description: A Class A Permit allows the holder and any person in the employ of the permit holder to reship shellfish previously shipped by the holder of a class A, B, C, D or E permit, to pack or repack shell stock received from the holder of a digger's permit, or to pack or repack shell stock from the holder of a class A, B, C, D or E permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit is required for the transport of explosives on the New York State Thruway.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Shellfish Shipper's and Processor's (Class B) Permit (96-19-002 - Text 12)
Permit Description: A Class B Permit allows the holder and any person in the employ of the permit holder to engage in the activities authorized by a Class A Permit to process shellfish.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Shellfish Shipper's and Processor's (Class C) Permit (96-19-002 -Text 12)
Permit Description: A Class C Permit allows the holder and any person in the employ of the permit holder to reship shellfish previously shipped by the holder of a class A, B, C, D or E permit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Shellfish Shipper's and Processor's (Class D) Permit (96-19-002 -Text 12)
Permit Description: A Class D Permit allows the holder to ship shell stock which the holder has legally harvested from shellfish lands of New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Shellfish Shipper's and Processor's (Class E) Permit (96-19-002 - Text 12)
Permit Description: A Class E Permit allows the holder, members of the permit holder's immediate family and not more than two employees of the permit holder to shuck and pack bay scallops which have been received from the holder of a digger's permit and to ship such scallops in the form of fresh shucked stock only in intrastate commerce.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Harvest and Relay Shellfish from Uncertified Areas for Transplanting Purposes (MCR-23 PVT, MCR-23PUB)
Permit Description: Allows the holder to harvest, transplant, and relay of shellfish (oysters, scallops and all kinds of clams and mussels) from designated uncertified areas of the state for cleaning and eventual marketing as a food product. Transplanting allows for the transfer of shellfish from shellfish lands within or outside New York state to shellfish lands within New York state. A shellfish transplant permit is required for each transplant activity.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A license for off-track betting corporations and racing associations/corporations to conduct this specialized form of pari-mutuel wagering on horse races run at another site, with the display of live audio/visual signals of the races and other amenities. The permit enables the Board of monitor the number of entities, pursuant to legislation, allowed to transmit and receive said signals.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Registration of Ski Tow or Passenger Tramway
Permit Description: To assure the safe operation of passenger tramways. Prevents the operation of devices that do not meet minimum standards of compliance. Covers not only alpine ski areas but also tramways at amusement parks and urban areas such as Roosevelt Island.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Sheriff, Marshall, Trustee, Receiver, Executor, Assignee Alcohol Permit
Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to sell alcoholic beverages which came into the applicant's possession pursuant to judicial process. If a marshal or sheriff, a copy of the execution; if a trustee or receiver in bankruptcy or assignee for the benefit of creditors, a certified copy of the court order authorizing such sale; or if an executor or administrator, a certified copy of letters of testamentary or administration must be provided.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will be sold and delivered to manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers duly licensed by the Liquor Authority;  The alcoholic beverages will be delivered directly to the purchaser and will not be stored at the place of sale in excess of 48 hours after the date of sale;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of the law with respect to labels and size of containers will be sold;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each purchaser;  The permittee will pay all excise taxes imposed by or under the provisions of the Tax Law;  Such permit shall be valid for one transaction only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A Class A shooting preserve license allows the licensee to operate a commercial shooting preserve of a minimum of 100 acres. Allows an owner or lessee of wholly enclosed lands or an entire island, a shooting preserve license, permitting the licensee to purchase, possess, rear, transport, release and take by shooting domestic game birds legally acquired. The licensee can charge a daily fee for hunting or charge a fee for each domestic game bird killed or any combination of fees. Domestic game birds may be killed by the licensee for their own use and may be sold dead or alive. Domestic game birds means captive bred ducks, geese, brant, swans, pheasants, quail, wild turkey, ruffed grouse, chukar partridge and Hungarian or European gray-legged partridge.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: A Class B shooting preserve license allows the license to operate a non-profit shooting preserve or a non-profit club or membership shooting preserve with use limited to members and guests only of a minimum of 100 acres. Domestic game birds may be killed by the licensee for his or her own use but no live domestic game birds or their eggs, or their carcasses may be sold unless the licensee holds a valid Domestic Game Bird Breeder (Class A) license. Domestic game birds mean captive bred ducks, geese, brant, swans, pheasants, quail, wild turkey, ruffed grouse, chakar, partridge and Hungarian or European gray-legged partridge.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: The NYS Department of Environmental Conservation has guidelines and publications for vehicle repair/maintenance shops regarding environmental compliance requirements.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Permit to Do Work or to Use Property Under the Jurisdiction of the Power Authority  - Short Form Permit (PA-39)
Permit Description: Permit allows the underlying fee owner of a property in which the Power Authority has an interest to construct and use minor facilities which would not require entrance onto the property by third party contractors or heavy equipment. Permit insures that fee owners' use will not conflict with the easement or rights granted to the Power Authority.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction

Permit Name: Permit for Meal Period of Less Than Thirty Minutes (LS-284)
Permit Description: A permit allowing employers to shorten meal periods in hardship cases where machinery must be in constant operation.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Application for Show Permit and Notice of Show (Form DTF-723)
Permit Description:
A show promoter includes any person who, directly or indirectly, grants the use of a location to any person for the display for sale or for the sale of taxable products or services at four or more shows during a calendar year; or who operates four or more shows during a calendar year. An example of a person who indirectly grants such use of a location is a person who leases space to a person who intends to operate a show. Show promoters may own or lease parking lots, shopping malls, hotels, or any other place where shows are held.

What qualifies as a show:
A show is a single event lasting up to seven consecutive days. On the eighth consecutive day, a second show automatically begins; on the fifteenth consecutive day, a third show begins; and so on. If there is a break between show dates, a new show automatically starts on the first day after the break.

Shows include, but are not limited to, flea markets, craft shows, antique shows, coin shows, stamp shows, comic book shows, and fairs,  whether they are held regularly or as occasional events, at which more than one vendor displays for sale, or makes sales of, taxable products or services.

Filing for a show permit:
A show promoter must file Form DTF-723, Application for Show Permit and Notice of Show, at least 10 days before the fourth show  (at any one location) opens. A show promoter needs only one permit for all shows held at the same location during the calendar year, but the shows must be listed individually on the application and on the back of the permit. 

A show promoter must file Form DTF-723 at least 10 days before each additional show that is held at a different location, or for each show that is not listed on the promoter's permit.

If the application for a show promoter’s permit is approved, the Tax Department will send the applicant a validated Form DTF-724, Permit to Operate a Show, within five days after receiving a properly completed application.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Tax Information

Permit Description: Permit is issued for the construction and operation of a facility that is processing, recovery, reclamation, or disposal of solid waste defined as any garbage, refuse, sludge, or other waste material as well as the treatment or disposal of waste oil. Types of facilities include: landfills; research, development and demonstration; land application; solid waste incineration; refuse derived fuel processing; composting; recyclable handling and recovery; transfer station; medical waste; waste tire storage; landfill gas recovery; and waste oil.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permit

Permit Name: Registration for a Solid Waste Management Facility (47-14-020)
Permit Description: Registers certain types of solid waste management facilities such as transfer stations and land clearing debris landfills that the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation deems are on a smaller scale than a full evaluation of the 6 NYCRR, Part 360 permit process. Registration controls smaller, less complex solid waste management facilities for energy recovery incinerators of pyrolysis units, land clearing debris landfills less than 3 acres, certain types of transfer stations, waste tire retreaders, waste tires stored for on-site energy recovery, tire dealers selling waste tires, tire manufacturing facilities, as well as other types of facilities. Land Application and Composting facilities register using registration form for 6 NYCRR, Part 360.4 and 360.5.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permit

Permit Description: This permit authorizes a permittee under the age of 18, with the consent of parents or legal guardians, to appear as an entertainer on a premises licensed to sell alcoholic beverages at retail. Any false answer or statements made by the applicant constitute a misdemeanor and will subject any permit issued hereunder to revocation.  If this child performer is under 16 years of age, a copy of the Child Performer's Permit (Section 151 of the Labor Law) must be provided or a written explanation why the permit was not obtained.  This term is subject to the following conditions:  The permit shall be valid only for the date or dates specified and for performances only at the licensed premises specified.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a currently active on premises licensee to apply for a permit to remain open to sell alcoholic beverages between the closing hour prescribed by statute or established county hours on any week day (New Year's Eve). This application must be received by the Liquor Authority 45 days prior to the date of the event. Notice of the licensee's intent to apply for the permit must be sent to the local police department or, if there is no local police department, to the County Sheriff's Department. All night permits will not be issued for a Sunday.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Special Hauling Permit Survey For Over Dimensional Vehicles (TA-W6813)
Permit Description: A Special Hauling Permit allows for the movement of overweight and oversized vehicles on the New York State Thruway. Vehicles traveling the NYS Thruway that are greater than 10' wide must obtain a Special Hauling Permit from the Thruway Over-Dimensional Permit System (TOPS) and have a valid E-ZPass tag in the vehicle. A Special Hauling Permit must be obtained prior to traveling on the Thruway.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Special Hauling Trip and Annual Oversize/Overweight Loads Permit (PERM-39)
Permit Description: Special Hauling Permits are required to move vehicles and/or loads on New York State highways if the vehicle and/or loads exceed the legal dimensions or weights specified in Section 385 of the New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law. A Special Hauling Permit is generally issued for the transportation of a single piece or item. However, multiple items such as wood trusses, precast concrete pipe or manholes, construction equipment, etc. are allowable as long as the additional items do not cause an overweight condition or cause an additional over dimension condition. A permit will not be issued for any load which can be reduced to legal weight or dimensions.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certification as Special Needs Assisted Living Residence (SNALR) (DOH S-4355)
Permit Description: Certification as a SNALR allows an assisted living residence to advertise or market as serving individuals with special needs, including but not limited to dementia or cognitive impairments. SNALR's must also be certified as an adult home or enriched house program.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Required for new recreational uses, parasails, seaplanes and tour boats on Lake George
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Name: Special Risk Insurer (Free Trade Zone) License
Permit Description: Allows an authorized insurer to write special risk insurance in the "Free Trade Zone".
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permit allows for the placement of logo signs at specific locations on the New York State Thruway.

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Authorization for State Chartered Banks to Purchase Assets of Other State Banks
Permit Description: Authorization that allows one state bank to purchase the assets of another state bank. The purpose is to ensure that the purchase is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: State Environmental Quality Review Act Permit (SEQR) (617.2)
Permit Description: The State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQRA) is a review process that must be conducted by all state and local agencies when they issue any discretionary permit or approval for actions funded, permitted, or directly undertaken by the governmental agency. The process requires that all agencies determine whether the actions they directly undertake, fund, or approve may have a significant impact on the environment. The process establishes a single lead agency for coordinating multiple agency environmental reviews, environmental assessment form to aid in determining whether an action may have a significant adverse impact on the environment, and environmental impact statement. Some examples of projects are: construction of residential and non-residential developments, energy production, entertainment and recreation, wetlands, zoning, landfills, mining.
Permit Categories: General Business Information

Permit Name: State Pollutant Discharge Eliminate System Application (SPDES)
Permit Description: To maintain reasonable standards of purity of the waters of the state consistent with public health and enjoyment thereof, propagation and protection of fish and wildlife, and the industrial development of the state; and to that end require the use of all known available and reasonable methods to prevent and control the pollution of the New York state waters. Any business discharging to groundwater or surface water may be subject to regulation. Some examples of regulated activities: construction or operation of disposal systems (sewage treatment plants), brine wells, wastewater treatments, and storm water discharge activities. Some examples of prohibited activities: discharge of radiological agent, chemical or biological warfare agent.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Steamship Company Permit (Ship Stores - One Time)

This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will not be offered for sale or sold in this state;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made;  The alcoholic beverages will be delivered directly to the steamship of the permittee or to a warehouse for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor Authority;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of law with respect to labels and sizes of containers will be purchased;  Applicant must own and operate or charter and operate the steamship for which it will purchase alcoholic beverages for the ship's store.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Steamship Company Permit (Ship Stores - Three Years)

This permit is subject to the following conditions:  The alcoholic beverages will not be offered for sale or sold in this state;  A copy of the permit will be delivered to each manufacturer or wholesaler from whom purchases are made;  The alcoholic beverages will be delivered directly to the steamship of the permittee or to a warehouse for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor Authority;  Only alcoholic beverages in the original sealed containers which comply with the provisions of law with labels and sizes of containers will be purchased;  Applicant must own and operate or charter and operate the steamship for which it will purchase alcoholic beverages for the ship's store.

Permit Name: Stock, Property and Casualty Insurance Company License - Alien (AUSB S-10)
Permit Description: License to operate an insurance company in New York state by an alien company as a U.S. branch. New York Insurance Law defines an "Alien insurer" as "... any insurer incorporated or organized under the laws of any foreign nation, or of any province or territory not included under the definition of ,foreign insurer." A Canadian insurer would be classified as an alien insurer. The statute defines a "United States branch" as "... the business unit through which business is transacted within the United States by an alien insurer, or the assets and liabilities of such insurer within the United States pertaining to such business or the management powers pertaining to such business and to such assets and liabilities or any combination of these three."

Permit Name: Stormwater Management Permit (stormwater appl, stormwater guide)

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Commercially Harvest Striped Bass
Permit Description: The purpose of this permit is to identify qualified participants in the commercial fishery for striped bass in New York state. Activities allowed under the permit include the possession of striped bass tags and gear legally permitted for use in the harvest and sale of striped bass. The permit and tag system is required to keep New York from exceeding the annual quota of striped bass granted under the provisions of the Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission Management Plan for the species. A moratorium is currently in effect for this permit. Taking striped bass for commercial purposes from the Hudson River is prohibited.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Wholesale

Permit Description: The purpose of this filing is to permit subdividers to offer vacant land for sale to New York state residents on an installment plan. "Installment plan" means a plan whereby at least two periodic payments are made before the land is transferred by deed. The filing includes a filing statement and an offering statement.

These certificates are used for various purposes, loan closing or to verify an entity before doing business with said entity.

Permit Description: Required to prove that the entity is licensed/chartered by the NYS Department of Financial Services and that the entity has not been revoked or suspended. The purpose of these certificates are used for various purposes, loan closing or to verify an entity before doing business with said entity.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: A permit is required to operate a tanning facility where one or more ultraviolet radiation devices (including but not limited to sunlamps, tanning booths or tanning beds) are used, offered, or made available for use by any human being for which a fee is charged. A facility where such devices are used by qualified health care professionals for treatment of medical conditions are excluded. Depending on the facility location, the State Commissioner of Health or designee, or an authorized County Commissioner of Health or Public Health Director is the Permit Issuing Official. Visit the Department of Health's website to determine the Permit Issuing Official in the county where the tanning facility is located.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Certification authorizes the operation of a substance abuse treatment or prevention services program.  A substance abuse program is any public or private person, corporation, partnership, agency, either profit or non-profit, or state or municipal government which provides substance abuse services, in either a residential or ambulatory setting, to persons who are substance abusers, substance dependent, in need of services to avoid becoming substance abusers, substance dependent or to significant others.  Substance abuse services include services to inhibit the onset of substance abuse or substance dependence; to address the social dysfunction, medical problems and other disabilities associated with substance abuse or substance dependence, and to rehabilitate persons suffering from substance abuse or dependence.  Any person or entity providing such services as a minor part of a general health or counseling unit subject to regulations promulgated by OASAS and other appropriate agencies shall not be considered a substance abuse program.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Name: Temporary Sulfur-in-Fuel Variance Contingent Upon Fuel Storage
Permit Description: A temporary variance given to air contamination source owners or a fuel supplier upon their application for “Limitation of Sulfur-in-Fuel” when it can be shown that there is an insufficient supply of conforming fuel, either of the proper type required for use in a particular air contamination source; or generally throughout an area of the State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: The owner of a stationary combustion installation may develop a sulfur dioxide impact offset plan instead of having each emission source comply with the sulfur-in-fuel limitations. The impact offset plan may consist of two or more emission sources at a single facility, or at two or more proximate facilities.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Miscellaneous,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit allows commercial fisherman to harvest and land summer flounder for commercial purposes in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Name: Summer Flounder Party Boat Fillet Permit
Permit Description: Allows party boat owners or operators to fillet summer flounder while at sea, which otherwise is prohibited in New York state. This permit is required to provide an exemption for large passenger carrying fishing vessels to fillet their summer flounders at sea for their customers.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Authorizing duly licensed supply ship engaged in furnishing supplies to other vessels. Available only on Lake Erie.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit for Residents to Harvest Surf Clam/Ocean Quahog (Atlantic Ocean)
Permit Description: Allows a New York State resident to harvest surf clams and/or ocean quahogs by mechanical means from the waters of the Atlantic Ocean.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Permit for Residents to Harvest Surf Clam/Ocean Quahog (Other than Atlantic Ocean)

Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Name: Bait Harvesting Permit to Harvest Surf Clams from Uncertified Waters for Bait Purposes Only
Permit Description: Allows for the taking of surf clams from uncertified areas of the Atlantic Ocean for bait purposes only.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: Allows the operation, maintenance, or permits the use by the public of any swimming pool, wading pool, spa pool, white-water slide, wave pool, special-purpose pool or movable-bottom pool.

Permit Name: Permit for Aircraft Take-Off from Thruway System (TA-6834)
