Permit Description: A Takeover Statement Registration is required for the "takeover bid" acquisition of, or offer to acquire by an offerer, from an offeree, pursuant to a tender offer or request or invitation for tenders, any equity security of a target company, if after acquisition thereof the offerer would, directly or indirectly, be a beneficial owner of more than five percent of any class of the issued and outstanding equity securities of such target company. Person(s) or entities making a "tender offer" for equity securities of a New York chartered company to 50 or more New York shareholder must register by filing a statement evidencing full disclosure to the public.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Allows a licensed ticket reseller to maintain and operate a branch office in additional to the ticket reseller's principal place of business.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Specifies the rules and regulations under which the utility renders service and the charges applicable to the various classes of customers. Utilities set out the rates, terms and conditions of service in Commission-reviewed filings referred to as tariffs. The Public Service Commission (PSC) keeps utility tariffs for electric companies doing business in New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A tariff rate filing is a requirement that specifies the rules and regulations under which the utility renders service and sets rates to its various classes of customers. Gas rate schedule filings are required by the Public Service Commission to protect the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A tariff rate filing is a requirement that specifies the rules and regulations under which the utility renders service and sets rates to its various classes of customers. A tariff rate schedule must be filed for steam service with the Public Service Commission to ensure that the rates are in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A tariff rate filing is a requirement that specifies the rules and regulations under which the utility renders service and sets charges applicable to the various classes of customers. Telecommunication rate schedules filings are required by the Public Service Commission to protect the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A tariff rate filing is a requirement that specifies the rules and regulations under which the utility renders service and the charges applicable to the various classes of customers. It is required by the Public Service Commission to protest the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: New York State Tax Preparer Registration
Permit Description:
Tax return preparers and facilitators may be required to register (annually) to prepare NYS tax returns and issue or administer a refund anticipation loan or refund anticipation check.

Tax return preparers are individuals who receive compensation to prepare at least one NYS tax return or report in a calendar year. A tax return preparer who meets the definition of a commercial tax return preparer must pay an annual registration fee of $100.

A commercial tax return preparer means a tax return preparer who: 

• prepared ten or more returns for compensation in the preceding calendar year, and will prepare at least one return for compensation during the current calendar year; or
• prepared fewer than ten returns for compensation in the preceding calendar year, but will prepare ten or more returns for compensation during the current calendar year.

If an individual acts as both a tax return preparer and a facilitator, they will receive one registration certificate that indicates both activities.

After a preparer or facilitator registers, the Tax Department will issue them a New York Tax Preparer Identification Number (NYTPRIN), which the preparer or facilitator must include along with their signature on all the signed tax returns and reports they prepare.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Tax Information

Permit Description: Permit authorizes a duly licensed taxicab to deliver only wine or liquor sold at retail in cities having a population of one million or less. A $1,000 penal bond is required.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity for Telecommunication Services (Form B, TCCI Form, Form A)
Permit Description: A Certificate is required before constructing facilities and/or offering telecommunications services in New York State to the public for a fee. Applies to providers of local exchange (dial tone), long distance, alternative operator, and other types of telephone services, whether they utilize their own facilities or resell the services of other telephone companies. Providers of cellular telephone service or providers of telephone service by means of customer-owned or leased, currency or credit card operated telephones (COCOTs), and motels, hotels or hospitals are not required to obtain a CPCN.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration as a Telecommunication System Controller (WC-53A)
Permit Description: Registration allows individuals to participate in the operation of the telecommunication hiring system through which longshoremen and checkers are hired for employment at piers and other waterfront terminals in the Port of New York and New Jersey.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: To authorize an individual or business to engage in New York State in the sale of products made from Vicuna Hair. A vicuna is a South American hoofed mammal, and member of the camel family. The vicuna is on the endangered or threatened species list.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: Allows any entity which in connection with a plan, program, or campaign to induce a sale of goods or services by the use of one or more telephones and by more than one telephone call, either initiates or initiates and receives telephone calls to or from a customer when the customers is in New York State. Telemarketing does not include solicitation of sales through any media other than by telephone calls.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: The purpose of this permit is for the registrant to temporarily use the vehicle. The Department uses this permit to expedite service for the customer to get the vehicle on the road as soon as possible.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Temporary Beer, Wine and Cider Permit (One Time)
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, One-Time Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Grants authority to person/persons named herein to renew the business of the "original licensee" and to perform other acts incidental to the continuance of the insurance business of such original licensee. Temporary license is required along with a copy of the death certificate. If applicant is NOT the spouse, letters of testamentary included with proof of executor of estate is required. No Life business can be done with a temporary license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Temporary Permit for Winery or Farm Winery
Permit Description: Authorizes the applicant of a winery, farm winery, special winery or special farm winery license to continue operation of an existing winery, farm winery, special winery or special farm winery facility during the course of good faith negotiations for ownership rights to ensure the harvest and production of wine while the application is pending before the NYS Liquor Authority.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing

Permit Name: Permit to Operate a Temporary Residence (DOH-3915)
Permit Description: Permit grants permission to operate a hotel, motel, other labor camp, cabin colony, or other place providing temporary shelter for 10 or more persons for greater than 60 hours per year. If operating within the five boroughs of New York City (New York, Bronx, Kings, Richmond or Queens counties), contact the NYC Department of Buildings at 212-566-5000 and NYC Department of City Planning at 212-720-3291.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Outside of New York City new applicants at locations without a current liquor license may apply for a temporary permit to serve alcohol while their application is pending. Applicants that are purchasing the business of a current licensee at the same location (this is called a Transfer) can apply for a temporary retail permit throughout the State. The temporary permit is valid for 90 days and may be extended for additional 30 day periods, if necessary. Temporary permits are NOT available for wine or liquor stores, or applications that fall under the 500 Foot Law. Temporary permits where the permanent application must go before the Members of the Full Board may be denied. In these instances only the fee will be refunded.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description:
A terminal is a motor fuel or diesel motor fuel storage facility with a storage capacity of 50,000 gallons or more, excluding any facility where motor fuel or diesel motor fuel is stored solely for its retail sale.

You must apply for registration as a  terminal operator if:
• you have the use or control over a terminal, or 
• you have the right to so use or control, a terminal. 
Resources:
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities,Tax Information

Permit Description: Waivers of the investors' rights to receive theatrical offering literature which has been reviewed by the Attorney General. If theatrical offering literature is not being filed to assure that investors understand that they have the right to receive such offering literature.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Disclosure documents (prospectus or private placement memorandum) prior to raising funds for a theatrical production to disclose information necessary for an investor to make an informed investment decision. This may be waived if waivers of investors are filed.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Registers original sellers of tickets including box office personnel, producers, and computer ticketing companies to allocate, distribute, and sell tickets for theatrical productions, sporting events, or other events including concerts, public exhibitions, games, shows, contests, or performances presented to the public in a place of entertainment. A place of entertainment includes: theatre, dinner theatre, hall, coliseum, convention center, arena, auditorium, stadium, concert hall, garden, outdoor space or place of amusement operated as a for-profit entity and located in New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Any person, firm, or corporation who resells or engages in the business of reselling any tickets to a place of entertainment that is located within New York State is required to be licensed. Any person, firm, or corporation who operates an internet website or any other electronic service that provides a mechanism for two or more parties to participate in a resale transaction of that facilitates resale transactions by means of an auction, or who owns, conducts or maintains an office, branch office, bureau, agency or sub-agency for such business must to obtain a license for each location where business will be conducted. An Internet company that engages in the business of reselling tickets is required to be licensed. However, if the website serves as a platform to facilitate resale or resale by way of a competitive bidding process solely between third parties and does not in any other manner engage in the resale of tickets to places of entertainment is exempt from the licensing requirements. Individuals who sell tickets on eBay or any other internet website are required to be licensed as a ticket reseller if they have not purchased the ticket solely for their own use; solely for the use of their invitees, employees or agents or if they purchased tickets on behalf of others and resells such tickets to invitees, employees and agents or others at or less than the established price. Individuals who purchase tickets solely for their own use or use of their invitees, employees and agents or who purchase tickets on behalf of others and resells such tickets to invitees, employees and agents or others at or less than the established price are exempt from the licensure requirement. However, even those individuals who are exempt from licensure are prohibited from reselling tickets within a defined buffer zone of 1,500 feet from the physical structure of a venue having a permanent seating capacity in excess of 5,000 persons and within 500 feet of the physical structure of a venue having a permanent seating capacity of 5,000 or fewer persons. “Not-for-profit” organizations as defined in NYS Arts and Cultural Affairs Law, Article 25, Section 25.03 are exempt from licensure; as well as any operator or manager of a website that serves as a platform to facilitate resale, or resale by way of a competitive bidding process, solely between third parties and does not in any other manner engage in resale of tickets to places of entertainment.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Allows licensee to act as a timekeeper at a boxing or sparring match.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Recreation,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: License for Human Tissue/Non-Transplant Anatomic Bank (DOH-2973, DOH-2973 (a-f), DOH-2973 (i))
Permit Description: A license is required to allow any person or facility that solicits, retrieves, performs donor selection and/or tests, preserves, transports, allocates, distributes, acquires, processes, stores or arranges for the storage of human tissues for transplantation, transfer, therapy, artificial insemination or implantation, including autogenic procedures. Tissue banks are issued a license in the specific category of tissue and type of tissue services and must comply with the standards applicable to the category or categories of tissue acquired, processed, stored and/or distributed. Tissue categories include: cardiovascular tissue, musculoskeletal tissue, skin, eye, reproductive tissue (examples: semen and embryos), human milk, and hematopoietic progenitor cells (examples: bone marrow and cord blood). The shipment of any tissue from an out-of-state facility constitutes distribution and may require licensing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Title Insurance Corporation License - Domestic (UCAA-Primary, Form 1, Form-3)
Permit Description: Organization of a Domestic Stock Title Insurance Company. Title insurance means insuring owners of, and other persons lawfully interested in, real property and chattels real against loss by reason of defective titles and encumbrances and insuring the correctness of searches for all instruments, liens or charges affecting the title to such property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Title Insurance Corporation License - Foreign (UCAA-Expansion, Form 1, Form-3)
Permit Description: Admission of a foreign stock title insurance company. Title insurance means insuring owners of, and other persons lawfully interested in, real property and chattels real against loss by reason of defective titles and encumbrances and insuring the correctness of searches for all instruments, liens or charges affecting the title to such property.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Towing Permit for State Parks and Parkways
Permit Description: Allows tow truck operations on State Parkways and within State Park and campgrounds.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: The term "trademark" means any word, name, symbol or device or any combination thereof used by a person to identify and distinguish the goods of such person, including a unique product, from those manufactured and sold by others, and to indicate the source of goods, even if the source is unknown. Registration of trademarks are made to show ownership of the mark and to provide protection to the mark itself. Each mark must be reviewed to determine if it so resembles a previously registered mark as not to cause confusion, mistake or deception.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: Trading stamp companies may not advertise or distribute trading stamps in New York State unless it has filed with the Department of State a statement of registration accompanied by representative samples of its stamps, stamp collection books, stamp redemption catalogues and stamp distribution and redemption agreement forms.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Approval for Transfer and Ownership of Utility Stock
Permit Description: A utility's transfer of ownership of stock must be approved under the Public Service Law to ensure that the transfer is in the public interest. No corporation can hold more than 10% of a utilities voting capital stock without NYS Public Service Commission approval.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Application for Transfer of a License/Registration to Operate a Private School in New York State (BPSS-3)
Permit Description: Allows the transfer or assignment of any interest totaling 10 percent or more, whether direct or indirect, in the total equity or assets of a private school or registered business school.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Education

Permit Name: Transporter Business Original Facility Application (VS-19, VS-3, VS-141, VS-142, VS-1)
Permit Description: Allows the limited operation of motor vehicles for the purpose of delivery, repair, or improvement thereof or the installation of something thereon. Required to regulate highway safety issues in this delivery and to provide consumer protection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: A 72-hour temporary registration issued to out-of-state vehicles that qualify for IRP registration but are not apportioned for New York.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Operate a Private Freshwater Fish Hatchery (DFG-197)
Permit Description: Allows the permitee to propagate, raise and sell trout and salmon (i.e., brook trout, brown trout, rainbow trout, and Atlantic salmon) at a private hatchery.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to transport alcoholic beverages within New York State;  to transport alcoholic beverages from within New York State to points outside the state;  and to transport alcoholic beverages from outside New York State to points within the state.  The following documentation must be submitted with the application:  Authorization Form;  $1,000 penal bond.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permission for a Trust Company to Open and Occupy a Branch Office (BR)
Permit Description: Allows Superintendent to grant permission to a trust company to establish a branch. To ensure public interest is met.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Acquisition of a Savings Bank's Branch Offices by a Trust Company
Permit Description: Allows a trust company to acquire branches from a savings bank. Transaction must be in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Authority to commence business as a Trust Company. Application must promote public convenience and advantage.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission to Change the Designation of Trust Company Branch/Principal Office (CL)
Permit Description: Authorizes a trust company to change the designation of a branch office to a principal office and of the principal office to that of a branch office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Name: Permission to Change the Location of Trust Company Branch/Principal Office (CL)
Permit Description: Permits a Trust Company to move its banking premises. Location is analyzed for competitive factors.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Finance and Insurance

Permit Description: Permits the underground storage reservoir devoted to the storage of natural gas or liquefied petroleum gas. A map must show the location and boundaries of the underground storage reservoir. A report containing sufficient data to show that the reservoir is adaptable for storage purposes. An affidavit sign by the operator to the effect that he has acquired by grant, lease, or other agreement at least 75 percent of the storage rights in reservoir and in the buffer zone.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration of Labor Organization Labels, Brands and Marks (UL-10)
Permit Description: Registration of union labels for local, state, national and international organizations active in New York State for the purpose of designating the products of the labor of its members.
Permit Categories: General Business Information

Permit Name: Approval for Use of Utility Revenues
Permit Description: Approval of a utility's use of revenues received from rendition of public service is required by the NYS Public Service Commission to ensure that such use is in the public interest.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Approval of Dissolution and Certificates of Merger or Consolidation are required by the Public Service Commission to ensure that they are in the public interest and that the company is financially viable.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Registration of Utilization Review Agents  (DOH-4219A, uracheckdoc)
Permit Description: Independent utilization review agents (those which are not licensed insurers or certified HMOs) who want to contract with managed care organizations must register with the Department of Health. The application describes the utilization review plan and the standards applicable to their utilization review policy, appeal rights and the qualifications of the personnel performing utilization review.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care

Permit Description: A license authorizes an individual to sell beer as a vendor in cities with a population of one million or more. All sales must be at retail and not for resale.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail

Permit Description: A TEMPORARY license to possess venomous reptiles in New York. The NYS Department of Environmental Conservation is in the process of promulgating regulations pertaining to the possession, transportation or cause to transport, import or export any venomous reptile in New York. Issuance of this license does not signify that an individual will be qualified for a venomous reptile license.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: This waiver applies to all motor vehicles and trailers (except semi-trailers) used commercially, or to transport persons or property for hire or profit.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: This permit authorizes the permittee to store alcoholic beverages in a location other than in a licensed premises.  A diagram of the proposed licensed area, proof of liability insurance, photographs of the interior and exterior and a $5,000 penal bond is required.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Health Care,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Recreation

Permit Description: Allows any food establishment in which food and/or food products is held for commercial distribution. Food and food products shall include all articles of food, drink, confectionery or condiment, whether simple, mixed or compound, used or intended for use by men or animals, and shall also include all substances or ingredients to be added to food for any purpose including chewing gum. Exemptions to this licensure is if a food warehouse is already licensed by the NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets or is subject to the US Department of Agriculture inspections, pursuant to the federal meat, poultry, or egg inspection programs.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: License permits the holder to operate a food storage facility that rents space for the storage of food at or below a temperature of 45 degrees Fahrenheit for more than 30 days.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Food Service and Processing

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the holder to engage in waste transportation by vehicle in New York state. Waste is classified as non-hazardous industrial/commercial wastes, asbestos, hazardous industrial/commercial waste, waste oil, waste tires, petroleum contaminated soil, non-residential raw sewage or sewage-contaminated wastes, grease trap waste, sewage or water supply treatment plant sludge, medical, septage (residential), residential raw sewage including portable toilet waste, low-level radioactive waste (LLRW) or mixed waste (LLRW mixed with hazardous waste). The purpose of the permit is to protect the environment from the mishandling and mismanagement of wastes transported from the site of generation to the site of ultimate treatment, storage, or disposal; and to prevent a discharge of waste into the environment whether accidental or intentional, except at a site approved for the treatment, storage, or disposal of such wastes.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit authorizes the holder to engage in the transportation of low-level radioactive waste into, within, and through New York state by vehicle. The purpose of the permit is to protect the environment from the mishandling and mismanagement of wastes transported from the site of generation to the site of ultimate treatment, storage, or disposal; and to prevent a discharge of waste into the environmental whether accidental or intentional, except at a site approved for the treatment, storage, or disposal of low-level radioactive waste.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Approval of Plans for Wastewater Disposal System
Permit Description: Allows a person, public or private corporation, political subdivision, government agency, or any other legal entity whatsoever to construct an outlet for a thermal discharge or make a thermal discharge, directly or indirectly, into the waters of New York state. The operation of a point source of wastewater is regulated under the State Pollution Discharge Elimination System permit. The design of wastewater facilities requires approval.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Industries that install wastewater treatment facilities are eligible for certain tax benefits. The certificate of compliance confirms that the facility has been approved and that the construction and the facility complies with the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation standards.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Watch, Guard or Patrol Agency Application (DOS 0075)
Permit Description: License allows an individual or company to engage in the business of providing security services to protect individuals or property from harm, theft, or other unlawful activity. A watch, guard or patrol agency furnishes for hire watchpersons, guards, or private patrolpersons to protect persons or property from theft, concealment, or misappropriation of goods, wares and merchandise, money, valuable documents, or articles of value; and procure the return of such items.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Watch, Guard or Patrol Agency Branch Office Application (DOS 1542)
Permit Description: Permit allows a licensed Watch, Guard or Patrol Agency to operate a branch office in addition to the Agency's primary office. A separate license is required for each branch office.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Name: Approval of Water Diversion for Power
Permit Description: A license is required to divert for power generation any waters in which the state claims a proprietary interest (e.g. Barge Canal), or any boundary waters (e.g. Niagara River). Three licensed projects remain in operation at Rochester, Oswego and the Niagara River.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Special Approval of Window Cleaning Device (DOSH-753, SH740)
Permit Description: Resolution of Special Approval for an installation of window washing equipment on a specific site. Permits window washing operation with specified equipment using hoists, platforms, harnesses and rope grabs and in accordance with specified conditions as to maintenance, safety requirements, wind conditions and training of operators.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Manufacturing,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Section 401 Water Quality Certification  (Joint Application, D-1, D-2)
Permit Description: Certification is used to ensure that federal agencies issuing permits or carrying out direct actions which may result in a discharge to the waters of the United States do not violate New York State's water quality standards or impair designated uses. This Certification is added to other permits by the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation to comply with federal regulations, such as permits under Section 404 of the Clean Water Act, or construction and operation of hydroelectric or major interstate transmission facilities. Many federal agencies will issue their permits only after a 401 Water Quality Certification has been issued.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Water Supply Application, Long Island Wells (Joint Application, Water Withdrawal Supplement, WW-1)
Permit Description: To conserve and control the water resources in Kings, Queens, Nassau, and Suffolk counties by regulating the installation and operation of certain wells. Regulates the installation and/or operation to withdraw water for any purpose where the total capacity of such well or wells on any one property is in excess of 45 gallons per minute.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Protection of Water Supply (Joint Application, Water Withdrawal Supplement, WW-1)
Permit Description: Permit includes a wide variety of projects, including new complete systems, new water sources, extensions of systems, changes of ownership and adjudication of rates. The purpose of this permit is to conserve, control, and develop the water resources of New York state for the beneficial uses of New York State's inhabitants and to ensure that the use of New York State's waters for domestic or municipal (potable) purposes shall have priority over all other uses.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certificate of Approval of Plans to Interconnect Water Systems (DOH - 1018)
Permit Description: A certificate that allows for the temporary, infrequent supply of water between two existing public water systems.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Transporting, by vessel, more than 10,000 gallons per day of water from any freshwater lake, pond, brook, river, stream, or creek requires a permit. No permit is necessary for taking ballast water necessary for normal vessel activity.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Certification to Operate a Community Water Treatment Plant/Distribution System (DOH-354)
Permit Description: To insure the sanity conditions, quantity and quality of a public water supply. The Certificate to Operate a Community Water Treatment Plant or Distribution System assures that operators of a plant will have a minimum level of competency. Competent operators are necessary to assure that the public will receive safe water.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows a person or business to engage in water well drilling activities such as the construction and/or reconstruction of water wells, the establishment or repair of a connection through the well casing and the repair of water wells that includes the repairs of the opening of the well casing.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Protection of  Water (Dams Only) (Joint Application Form, D-1)
Permit Description: Permit is required for the construction or alterations of dams or similar structures that permanently or temporarily impound water to reduce the threat of flooding, associated environmental damage and threat to life and property caused by the improper impounding of water. A permit is required for construction, reconstruction or repair of any dam or impoundment structure, including any artificial obstruction, temporary or permanent, in or across a natural stream or watercourse.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit allows an individual to provide the service of removing hair of the face, neck, arms, legs or shoulders by the use of depilatories, waxes or tweezing. Permit does not include the practice of electrology.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services,Professional Licenses

Permit Description: Allows a person to carry out the function of a weighmaster or public weigher.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Name: Yacht Broker Official Business Certificate (VS-1, VS-19)
Permit Description: Authorizes the licensee to act as an agent for either the buyer or seller of a boat or yacht. Regulation enhances boating safety and consumer protection.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Retail,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A welder's certification is required only when welding on transportation structures, such as bridges. All welder qualification tests for manual and semiautomatic welding must be witnessed by a representative of the State. The NYS Department of Transportation regional offices are responsible for witnessing of field welder tests within New York State.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Allows the transfer of well plugging responsibility from one owner to another.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Permit to Drill, Deepen, Plug Back or Convert Wells (85-12-5 , 85-16-5-10b)
Permit Description: Allows the drilling, completion, and operation of oil, gas, solution mining, gas storage, stratigraphic, brine disposal, and geothermal wells.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Request for Shut-in or Temporary Abandonment of Wells (85-16-4-10d)
Permit Description: Permit allows the bearer to shut-in (one-year term) or temporarily abandon (9- day term) a well for oil or gas production, storage, input, solution mining, geothermal, stratigraphic or brine disposal. Approval by the NYS Department of Environmental Conservation allows an inactive well to remain so for a specific time and thus avoid the requirement to plug and abandon the well. Requires applicant justification and demonstration of sufficient good cause. Shut-In means a producing well closed down temporarily for repairs, testing, lack of market etc. Temporary Abandonment mean the cessation of work on a well pending determination of whether it should be completed as a producing well or permanently plugged and abandoned.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit allows an applicant to perform an activity or erect a structure that will impact a regulated freshwater wetland or an adjacent area. Examples of activities are: filling, draining, excavating, grading, and dredging; construction of buildings, roadways, septic systems, bulkheads, dikes, dams, and docks; or clear cutting timber and other vegetation. Generally, freshwater wetlands which are 12.4 acres or larger in area or small wetlands deemed to be of unusual local importance, and which appear on the Freshwater Wetlands regulatory maps. The purpose of this permit is to preserve and protect freshwater wetlands, and prevent their despoliation and destruction while giving due consideration to the reasonable economic, social, and agricultural development of New York state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Description: Permit allows an applicant to perform an activity or erect a structure that will impact a regulated tidal wetland or an adjacent. A tidal wetland can consist of marshes, shoals, bars, mudflats and littoral zone which appears on the NYS Tidal Wetland Inventory in the counties of Suffolk, Nassau, Rockland, Westchester, and New York City. Activities include: placement of fill, dredging, excavation, beach regarding, construction of buildings, septic systems, bulkheads, docks, catwalks, piers and floating docks, restoration, reconstruction, expansion, or modification or existing functional structures, drainage, mooring of a vessel to be used as a dwelling or commercial or public use building. The purpose of the permit is to preserve and protect tidal wetlands, and prevent their despoliation and destruction, while giving due consideration to the reasonable economic and social development of New York state.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Construction,Licenses and Permits, Transportation and Pubic Utilities

Permit Name: Professional Fund Raiser Registration Statement (CHAR013, CHAR015, CHAR037)
Permit Description: Registration as a Professional Fund Raiser is required by any person or organization who directly or indirectly (1) for a fee or other consideration, solicits contributions in New York for or on behalf of any charitable organization or any other person, or who engages in the business, or holds himself out to persons in New York State as independently engaged in the business of soliciting for such purpose; (2) solicits by telephone or door-to-door and advertises a sale, performance or event which will benefit a charitable organization; or (3) advertises a sale, performance or event which will benefit a charitable organization but is not a commercial co-venturer. A bona-fide officer, volunteer or employee of a charitable organization of a Fund Raising Counsel shall not be considered a Professional Fund Raiser.
Permit Categories: Licenses and Permits,Licenses and Permits, Services

Permit Description: A Nail Specialty Trainee is a person pursuing in good faith a course of study in the practice of nail specialty under the tutelage, supervision and direction of a licensed Nail Specialist at a licensed Appearance Enhancement Business. After the year traineeship, the trainee can upgrade to a Nail Specialty license by completing a 26 hour course of instruction and passing both the written and practical exam.

Permit Name: Certificate of Group Eligibility to Employ Child Performers
